复数“forenoons”常用于谈论习惯、日程或一段时间内的多个“上午”（例如：a week’s forenoons 一周里的各个上午）。

summary.en: Forenote is a rare word meaning an introductory note at the beginning of a text; as a verb, it can mean ‘to note in advance.’
summary.zh: Forenote 是个罕见词，通常指写在正文开头的简短说明；作动词时可表示“提前提及/预先记下”。

definition.en: (Rare) An introductory note or short preface placed at the beginning of a book, report, or document.
definition.zh: （罕见）写在书、报告或文件开头的简短导言/前言式说明。

examples.en: The editor added a brief forenote explaining how the letters were collected.
examples.zh: 编辑加了一段简短的 forenote，说明这些信件是如何收集的。

examples.en: In older publications, a forenote sometimes served the role we now call a foreword.
examples.zh: 在较早的出版物中，forenote 有时起到如今所说 foreword（序言）的作用。

definition.en: (Very rare) To note or mention something in advance; to foreshadow in a note.
definition.zh: （非常罕见）预先记下/提前提及；用说明文字作铺垫。

examples.en: The author forenoted the main argument in a short opening paragraph.
examples.zh: 作者在开头一小段里预先点出主要论点。

extraExplanation: “forenote”在现代英语里非常少见，更多人会用“foreword”（序言）、“preface”（前言）、“introduction”（引言）或“opening note”（开场说明）。
也常有人把它误写/误读成“footnote”（脚注）。如果你想表达“脚注”，应使用 footnote；如果是“写在开头的说明”，通常选 foreword/preface 更自然。

summary.en: “Forenoted” means previously mentioned/noted, often in formal or legal writing.
summary.zh: “forenoted”意为“前文所述/先前提到的”，多用于正式或法律语境。

definition.en: Previously mentioned or noted (often in formal, legal, or old-fashioned writing).
definition.zh: 先前提到的；前文所述的（常见于正式、法律或较旧式的表达）。

examples.en: The forenoted issues will be discussed at tomorrow’s meeting.
examples.zh: 上述（前文所述）问题将在明天的会议上讨论。

examples.en: Please refer to the forenoted agreement for details.
examples.zh: 详情请参阅前述协议。

definition.en: Past tense/past participle of “forenote”: to note or mention beforehand.
definition.zh: “forenote”的过去式/过去分词：预先注明；事先提及。

examples.en: The report forenoted several risks before the project began.
examples.zh: 该报告在项目开始前就预先指出了几项风险。

examples.en: All exceptions were forenoted in the margin.
examples.zh: 所有例外情况都已在页边预先注明。

extraExplanation: “forenoted”在现代日常英语中不常用，更常见的替代说法是：previously mentioned / mentioned above / aforesaid（法律用语）/ the above-mentioned。
它常出现在合同、判决书、公告、旧式书信等场景，用来指代“前面已经写过的内容”，避免重复。

summary.en: Forenotice means information given ahead of time—advance notice.
summary.zh: forenotice 指“提前通知；预先告知”，也就是 advance notice。

definition.en: notice or information given ahead of time; advance notice.
definition.zh: 提前通知；预先告知（在事情发生前给出的消息或提醒）。

examples.en: Thanks for the forenotice—I can adjust my schedule.
examples.zh: 谢谢你提前通知——我可以调整我的日程。

examples.en: The landlord must give tenants forenotice before entering the apartment.
examples.zh: 房东进入公寓前必须提前通知租客。

examples.en: With little forenotice, it was hard to prepare for the meeting.
examples.zh: 由于提前通知很少，很难为会议做准备。

extraExplanation: “forenotice”由前缀“fore-（在……之前）”+“notice（通知）”组成，意思直观，常见近义表达是“advance notice”。在日常写作中，更常用“advance notice”或“prior notice”；“forenotice”略显正式或偏书面。

summary.en: “Fore-notion” means a preconceived idea—an opinion formed beforehand.
summary.zh: “fore-notion”指“先入之见”，即事先形成的看法。

definition.en: a preconceived idea; an opinion formed in advance (often without enough evidence)
definition.zh: 先入之见；预先形成的看法（常指在证据不足时就下结论）

examples.en: Try to read the article without any fore-notion about the author’s intentions.
examples.zh: 尽量在没有任何关于作者意图的先入之见的情况下阅读这篇文章。

examples.en: Her fore-notion that the interview would be easy made her less prepared.
examples.zh: 她先入为主地以为面试会很简单，结果准备得不够。

extraExplanation: “forenotion”更常见的写法是连字符形式“fore-notion”，但在现代英语里这个词很少用；更自然、更常见的表达是“preconception”（先入之见）或“preconceived notion”（先入为主的看法）。
构词提示：fore- 表示“在前、预先”（如 forewarn 预先警告），notion 表示“观念、想法”。
语体建议：在日常写作或口语中，用“preconception / preconceived notion”更地道；“fore-notion”更偏旧式或文学化表达。

summary.en: Forensal describes an organism that lives in or on another mainly for shelter or transport, typically without harming the host.
summary.zh: forensal 指生物为庇护或搭便车而栖居在另一生物身上，通常不伤害宿主。

definition.en: (Biology) Living in or on another organism mainly for shelter or transportation, without harming it (a type of commensal relationship).
definition.zh: （生物）栖居在另一生物体内或体表，主要为了获得庇护或“搭便车”传播，一般不伤害宿主（属于偏利共生/共栖的一种）。

examples.en: Some mites are forensal on insects, using them mainly as transportation.
examples.zh: 有些螨虫与昆虫呈共栖关系，主要把昆虫当作“交通工具”。

examples.en: The species is thought to be forensal rather than parasitic because it does not damage the host.
examples.zh: 这种物种被认为是共栖而非寄生，因为它不会伤害宿主。

extraExplanation: 该词较少见，更多出现在生态学/动物学文献里。常与“parasitic（寄生的）”对比：寄生会损害宿主；而 forensal 通常只是借住或搭乘。
相关概念：commensal（偏利共生/共栖，广义上“一方受益、另一方无明显影响”）；phoresy（乘便/搭载，一种常见的 forensal 形式，强调“搭车传播”）。

summary.en: Forensic means connected to scientific analysis of evidence for legal investigations, and it can also mean extremely detailed and analytical.
summary.zh: forensic 指与法医鉴识/司法调查中的科学证据分析有关；也可指“细致严谨、深入分析的”。

definition.en: Related to using scientific methods to examine evidence for a court case or an official investigation.
definition.zh: 与用科学方法检验证据、用于法庭或官方调查有关的；法医学（鉴识科学）的。

examples.en: The police sent the knife to the forensic lab for testing.
examples.zh: 警方把刀送到法医鉴识实验室进行检测。

examples.en: Forensic scientists analyzed the DNA found at the scene.
examples.zh: 法医鉴识人员分析了现场发现的 DNA。

definition.en: Carefully analytical and detailed, especially when examining facts to find the truth.
definition.zh: （分析）细致入微、严谨的；尤指对事实进行深入分析以找出真相的。

examples.en: She gave a forensic analysis of the company’s financial records.
examples.zh: 她对公司的财务记录做了细致严谨的分析。

examples.en: The report takes a forensic look at what went wrong during the project.
examples.zh: 这份报告以细致入微的方式审视了项目中哪里出了问题。

extraExplanation: 词源提示：forensic 来自拉丁语 forensis，意思是“与广场（forum）有关的”。古罗马的 forum 是公众辩论与审判的场所，所以 forensic 逐渐发展出“与法庭/诉讼有关的”含义，后来又延伸到“法医学、鉴识科学”。
常见搭配：forensic evidence（法庭/鉴识证据）、forensic science（法医学/鉴识科学）、forensic lab（鉴识实验室）、forensic analysis（细致分析/鉴识分析）。
文化语境：在美剧/英剧里常听到 “forensics” 指“鉴识部门/鉴识工作”。注意：forensics 作为口语名词时通常表示“法医鉴识（这门学科/这类工作）”，如 “She works in forensics.”（她从事法医鉴识工作）。

summary.en: A document used or examined as evidence in legal investigations; also describes scientific document examination for court purposes.
summary.zh: 用于或被检验为司法证据的文件；也可形容为法庭目的进行的科学文件检验。

definition.en: (Noun phrase) A document used as evidence in an investigation or court case, especially one examined for authenticity, alterations, or origin.
definition.zh: （名词短语）用于调查或法庭案件的证据文件，尤其指会被检验其真伪、是否被篡改、来源等的文件。

examples.en: The bank provided the forensic document to help investigators trace the fraudulent transactions.
examples.zh: 银行提供了这份法证文件，帮助调查人员追踪欺诈交易。

examples.en: A forensic document examiner checked the contract for signs of forgery.
examples.zh: 法证文件检验人员检查了合同是否有伪造痕迹。

definition.en: (Adjective use) Related to the scientific examination of documents for legal purposes (often used before a noun: “forensic document analysis/examination”).
definition.zh: （形容词用法）与为法律目的而对文件进行科学检验有关的（常作定语：forensic document analysis/examination）。

examples.en: They requested a forensic document analysis of the handwritten note.
examples.zh: 他们申请对那张手写便条进行法证文件分析。

examples.en: The case relied on forensic document evidence from the lab.
examples.zh: 案件依赖实验室提供的法证文件证据。

extraExplanation: “forensic”在现代英语里多指“与司法/法庭相关的科学检验”，因此“forensic document”常见于法证科学语境。更常见、更自然的搭配是：forensic document examination（法证文件检验）、forensic document analysis（法证文件分析）。
法证文件检验可能包括：笔迹比对、纸张与墨水分析、印章/打印机痕迹比对、是否有涂改/拼接、文件形成时间线等。注意它不等同于一般的“legal document（法律文件）”，后者强调文件的法律性质，而不一定涉及检验。

summary.en: Forensical means ‘forensic’: related to scientific/legal investigation, or very detailed, evidence-based analysis.
summary.zh: forensical意为“法证的/司法鉴定的（forensic）”：与科学/法律调查相关，或指基于证据的细致分析。

definition.en: Related to forensic science: using scientific methods (especially medical, biological, or chemical) to investigate a crime or legal case.
definition.zh: 与法医学/司法鉴定有关的：用科学方法（尤指医学、生物学、化学等）来调查犯罪或法律案件的。

examples.en: The investigators collected forensical evidence from the scene.
examples.zh: 调查人员从现场收集了法证（司法鉴定）证据。

examples.en: Her job involves forensical analysis of DNA samples.
examples.zh: 她的工作涉及对DNA样本进行司法鉴定分析。

definition.en: Using careful, detailed investigation and reasoning; analytical in a way similar to a legal inquiry.
definition.zh: 像法律调查一样严谨细致的；带有审查、分析意味的。

examples.en: He gave a forensical account of what happened, step by step.
examples.zh: 他对发生的事情进行了逐步、严谨的陈述。

examples.en: The report takes a forensical approach to the company’s finances.
examples.zh: 这份报告以细致审查的方式分析了公司的财务情况。

extraExplanation: “forensical”在现代英语中相对少见；更常用的是“forensic”（如forensic evidence / forensic analysis）。在正式写作或新闻报道里，用“forensic”通常更自然、更地道。
词源提示：forensic来自拉丁语forensis，原指“法庭/公共场所（forum）上的”，后来引申为“与法律调查相关的”。

summary.en: Forensicality means the forensic quality or legal-evidence usefulness of something, though the word is rare.
summary.zh: Forensicality 指某事物的“司法鉴定/法庭证据属性或适用性”，但该词较少见。

definition.en: the quality of being forensic—related to courts, legal evidence, or scientific investigation used to support legal decisions (especially the usefulness or suitability of something for forensic work)
definition.zh: 法医学/司法鉴定的属性；与法庭证据或用于法律判断的科学调查相关的性质（尤指某事物对司法鉴定的适用性或可用性）

examples.en: The report questioned the forensicality of the fingerprint evidence because the sample was too smudged.
examples.zh: 报告质疑该指纹证据的“法庭证据适用性”，因为样本太模糊。

examples.en: Researchers tested the forensicality of the method before recommending it to police labs.
examples.zh: 研究人员在向警方实验室推荐该方法前，先测试了它在司法鉴定中的适用性。

extraExplanation: “forensicality”非常少见，很多母语者也不常用。更常见、更自然的表达是：forensic value（司法价值）、forensic validity（司法有效性）、forensic usefulness（司法用途/有用性）、admissibility in court（法庭可采性）。
词根来自 forensic（法庭的；法医学/司法鉴定的），其核心含义与“能否在法律语境中作为证据、是否经得起检验”有关。

summary.en: Forensically means either “using crime-lab/forensic science methods” or, more generally, “with extremely careful, evidence-based detail.”
summary.zh: forensically 指“用法医/刑事科学方法（对证据）进行分析”，也可引申为“像取证一样极其细致、以证据为依据地审查”。

definition.en: In a way that relates to scientific methods used to investigate a crime (for example, examining evidence in a lab).
definition.zh: 以（犯罪）法医鉴定或刑事科学的方法；用科学手段对证据进行分析的方式。

examples.en: The phone was forensically examined for fingerprints.
examples.zh: 这部手机被用法医鉴定的方法检查是否有指纹。

examples.en: Police forensically analyzed the DNA found at the scene.
examples.zh: 警方用刑事科学方法分析了现场发现的 DNA。

definition.en: With extremely careful, detailed examination, focusing on evidence and small facts.
definition.zh: （比喻）极其细致、像“侦查取证”一样地审查；一丝不苟地分析。

examples.en: She forensically reviewed the contract before signing.
examples.zh: 她在签字前非常细致地审查了合同。

examples.en: The journalist forensically pieced together what happened from emails and receipts.
examples.zh: 记者通过邮件和收据等材料，像取证一样细致地拼凑出事情的经过。

extraExplanation: “forensically”来自形容词“forensic”。“forensic”更早的含义与“法庭/公开辩论”有关（源自拉丁语 forum “公共广场、法庭”），后来常用于“法医/刑事科学鉴定”。因此它既能指真实的犯罪证据分析，也常被引申为“像办案一样严密、注重细节的分析”。
学习提示：真实语境里常见搭配有 forensically examine / analyze / test / investigate；引申用法里常见 forensically detailed / forensically accurate（非常严谨、细到可核查）。

summary.en: Forensics is the scientific study and use of evidence for investigating crimes and supporting legal cases.
summary.zh: Forensics 指用科学方法研究并运用证据来调查犯罪、支持司法案件的“取证学/法庭科学”。

definition.en: the scientific study of evidence (such as blood, fingerprints, or digital data) used to investigate crimes and support legal cases
definition.zh: （法庭）取证学；法医学/司法鉴定：用科学方法研究证据（如血迹、指纹、数字数据）以调查犯罪并支持法律案件

examples.en: She wants to study forensics and work in a crime lab.
examples.zh: 她想学取证学，在犯罪实验室工作。

examples.en: Forensics helped identify the suspect through DNA evidence.
examples.zh: 法庭科学通过DNA证据帮助确认了嫌疑人。

examples.en: Digital forensics can recover deleted files from a computer.
examples.zh: 数字取证可以从电脑中恢复被删除的文件。

definition.en: the use of forensic methods or analysis in an investigation or court case
definition.zh: 取证方法/鉴定分析的运用：在调查或法庭案件中使用取证分析

examples.en: The case relied on careful forensics to connect the weapon to the scene.
examples.zh: 这起案件依靠严谨的取证分析，将武器与现场联系起来。

examples.en: Modern forensics often combines lab work with computer analysis.
examples.zh: 现代取证常把实验室检测与计算机分析结合起来。

extraExplanation: “forensics”来自拉丁语forensis，意思与“论坛/法庭（forum）”有关，所以它强调的是“与法庭相关的证据与论证”。
日常英语里“forensics”常被当作不可数名词来用（study forensics / work in forensics）。但在某些语境也会说“the forensics of the case”来指该案的取证工作。
常见搭配：forensic science（法庭科学/司法鉴定学）、forensic evidence（法庭证据）、forensic analyst（法证分析员）、digital forensics（数字取证）、forensic pathology（法医病理学）。

summary.en: Foreordain means to decide something in advance—often suggesting destiny or God’s plan.
summary.zh: Foreordain 指“预先决定/预定”，常暗示命运或上帝的安排。

definition.en: to decide or determine (something) in advance; to predestine or plan beforehand (often with a religious or formal tone).
definition.zh: 预先决定；预先安排；（常带宗教/正式语气）预定、注定。

examples.en: Some theologians say events are foreordained by God.
examples.zh: 一些神学家认为事件是上帝所预定的。

examples.en: It seemed foreordained that she would become a teacher, given her patience and love of books.
examples.zh: 考虑到她的耐心和对书籍的热爱，她成为老师似乎是命中注定的。

examples.en: The treaty did not foreordain peace; it only created a chance for it.
examples.zh: 这项条约并没有预先保证和平；它只是创造了一个机会。

extraExplanation: “foreordain”由“fore-（在前）+ ordain（任命、规定）”组成，因此带有“提前规定/安排”的含义，语体偏正式。
它常见于宗教语境，尤其与“predestination（预定论）”相关；在日常写作中也可用于强调“结果似乎早已注定”，但语气会更文学化。
词形提示：foreordain（动词）→ foreordained（过去式/过去分词）→ foreordination（名词，较少用）。

summary.en: Foreordainable means “able to be destined or decided in advance.”
summary.zh: foreordainable 指“能够被预先注定/预先决定的”。

definition.en: Able to be foreordained; capable of being decided or destined in advance (often used in religious or philosophical contexts about fate or predestination).
definition.zh: 可被预先注定的；能够在事前被决定或安排命运的（常用于宗教或哲学语境，谈“宿命/预定”）。

examples.en: Some people believe major life events are foreordainable by a higher power.
examples.zh: 有些人相信人生中的重大事件可以被更高的力量预先注定。

examples.en: In the novel, the hero questions whether his suffering is foreordainable or the result of choices.
examples.zh: 在这部小说里，主人公怀疑自己的痛苦究竟是可被注定的，还是选择造成的。

extraExplanation: “foreordain”常见于基督教神学与宗教写作，指“上帝预定（人的命运/救赎）”。“foreordainable”是较少见的派生形容词，多用于讨论“是否能被预定”这一观点。
构词：fore-（在前、预先）+ ordain（任命/规定/注定）+ -able（能够……的）。在现代英语中，更常见的表达是“predestined / predetermined”。

summary.en: Foreordained means “predetermined,” often with a sense of fate or divine plan.
summary.zh: foreordained 指“预先注定/预定”，常带“命运或神意安排”的意味。

definition.en: decided or arranged in advance, often by God, fate, or a larger plan; predetermined
definition.zh: 预先决定的；（常指被上帝、命运或某种更大的安排）注定的

examples.en: In the novel, the hero believes his journey was foreordained.
examples.zh: 在小说里，主人公相信自己的旅程是命中注定的。

examples.en: Some people think success is foreordained, while others believe it comes from effort.
examples.zh: 有些人觉得成功是注定的，而另一些人认为成功来自努力。

definition.en: to decide or plan something in advance, especially as part of a divine or fated plan
definition.zh: 预先决定；（尤指作为神意或命运的一部分）预定

examples.en: The prophecy said the child was foreordained to become a leader.
examples.zh: 预言说这个孩子注定会成为领袖。

examples.en: They believed the event was foreordained by fate.
examples.zh: 他们认为这件事是命运预定的。

extraExplanation: “fore-”表示“在前、预先”，而“ordain”原意与“任命、授予（宗教）圣职、颁布”有关，所以“foreordain”常带有宗教或宿命色彩，比一般的“planned / decided”更强调“不可避免、早已安排好”。
常见搭配：foreordained destiny（注定的命运）、foreordained plan（预定的计划）、be foreordained to do sth（注定要做某事）。
近义词细微差别：predestined 更偏“宿命/注定”；preordained 与 foreordained 很接近（有时可互换）；inevitable 强调“不可避免”但不一定含“神意/命运”色彩。

summary.en: Foreordaining means deciding or determining something in advance, often implying destiny or divine will.
summary.zh: foreordaining 指预先决定或注定某事，常带“命运/神意安排”的意味。

definition.en: deciding or appointing something in advance; predestining (often in a religious or philosophical sense).
definition.zh: 预先决定或安排某事；（常用于宗教/哲学语境）预定、注定。

examples.en: Some traditions teach that God is foreordaining certain events.
examples.zh: 一些传统教义认为，上帝预定了某些事件。

examples.en: He spoke as if success were foreordaining his career, no matter what he did.
examples.zh: 他说话的样子仿佛成功早已注定，无论他做什么都一样。

extraExplanation: “foreordaining”是动词“foreordain”的现在分词/动名词形式，常见于宗教（尤其讨论“预定论”predestination）或较正式、文学性的表达中。
在日常英语里，人们更常用“predestine / predestined”或更中性的“decide in advance / plan ahead”。“foreordain”带有更强的“命运/超自然力量已安排好”的语气。

summary.en: Foreordainment means something is decided in advance—often in a religious sense, like being predestined.
summary.zh: Foreordainment 指“预先决定/预定”，常用于宗教语境，强调“命中注定、被预先安排”。

definition.en: the act of deciding or arranging something in advance; predestination (often by God)
definition.zh: 预先决定；预定（常指上帝的预定、宿命/天命）

examples.en: Some religious traditions teach foreordainment—that God has a plan for every life.
examples.zh: 一些宗教传统讲“foreordainment（预定）”，认为上帝为每个人的生命都有计划。

examples.en: He believed their meeting was not coincidence but foreordainment.
examples.zh: 他相信他们的相遇不是巧合，而是命中注定。

extraExplanation: “foreordainment”较少用于日常口语，更常见的是“predestination（预定论）”或动词“foreordain（预先注定）”。在宗教与哲学语境里，它常讨论“自由意志（free will）”与“天命/预定（destiny/predestination）”之间的关系。
词源上可拆为 fore-（预先）+ ordain（任命/规定/立法式地规定）。因此它带有“被权威（尤其是神）提前安排”的色彩。

summary.en: Foreordainments means things believed to be decided in advance—often by God or fate; it can also mean plans arranged beforehand.
summary.zh: foreordainments 指被认为已预先决定的事（常与上帝或命运相关）；也可泛指事先安排好的计划。

definition.en: (plural) events or outcomes believed to be decided in advance—especially by God or fate; predestined plans.
definition.zh: （复数）预先注定的安排或结果（尤指被认为由上帝或命运预先决定的）；宿命的计划。

examples.en: In his sermons, he spoke of God’s foreordainments and human responsibility.
examples.zh: 在他的布道中，他谈到上帝的预定与人的责任。

examples.en: She accepted the foreordainments of life with calm faith.
examples.zh: 她以平静的信念接受人生的宿命安排。

definition.en: (plural, broader) decisions or arrangements made beforehand; things planned in advance.
definition.zh: （复数，更广义）事先做出的决定或安排；预先规划之事。

examples.en: The project’s foreordainments left little room for last-minute changes.
examples.zh: 这个项目事先定好的安排几乎不给临时改动留空间。

examples.en: Their meeting felt less like chance and more like foreordainments at work.
examples.zh: 他们的相遇更像是冥冥中的安排，而不是偶然。

extraExplanation: “foreordainment(s)”常见于宗教/神学语境，尤其与“predestination（预定论）”相关；在现代日常英语里相对少用，更多人会说“predestination”“fate”或“what was meant to happen”。
构词上：fore-（在前）+ ordain（任命/命定/规定）+ -ment（名词后缀），因此带有“提前规定/命定”的意味。

summary.en: “Foreordains” means “decides in advance,” often suggesting fate or divine will.
summary.zh: “Foreordains”意为“预先决定/预定”，常暗含宿命或神意。

definition.en: to decide or plan something in advance, as if it is unavoidable (often used in religious or fate-related contexts)
definition.zh: 预先决定；（常带宗教或宿命意味）预定、注定

examples.en: Some people believe our lives are foreordained by God.
examples.zh: 有些人相信我们的生命是上帝预先安排（注定）的。

examples.en: It wasn’t foreordained that she would fail; she changed her plan and succeeded.
examples.zh: 她并非注定会失败；她调整了计划，后来成功了。

examples.en: In the novel, the hero feels foreordained to repeat his father’s mistakes.
examples.zh: 在小说中，主人公觉得自己被宿命驱使，会重蹈父亲的覆辙。

extraExplanation: “foreordains”是动词“foreordain”的第三人称单数（he/she/it foreordains）。
这个词常见于宗教语境（如“God foreordains …”），强调一种超越个人选择的“预定/注定”。在日常口语中更常用“predestine（注定）”或“preordain（预先安排）”。
词形拆解：fore-（在前）+ ordain（任命/制定）。在历史上“ordain”也常与宗教职位授予有关，因此“foreordain”带有较强的宗教/命运色彩。

summary.en: “Foreorder” means to arrange or decide something ahead of time (rare/formal).
summary.zh: “foreorder”意为“预先安排或事先决定”（用法罕见、偏正式）。

definition.en: to arrange or decide something in advance; to order beforehand (rare or formal)
definition.zh: （罕见/较正式）预先安排；事先决定；提前下令

examples.en: The committee tried to foreorder the agenda so the meeting would run smoothly.
examples.zh: 委员会试图预先安排议程，让会议顺利进行。

examples.en: In some older texts, events are described as foreordered by a higher power.
examples.zh: 在一些较古老的文本中，事件被描述为由更高力量预先安排。

extraExplanation: “foreorder”在现代英语里非常少见，读者更常看到的是“preorder”（预订/预先订购）或“foreordain”（宿命般地预先注定，常见于宗教/文学语境）。
构词上：fore- 表示“在前、预先”，order 表示“安排/命令”。因此字面意思就是“提前安排/提前下令”。如果你是在写日常英语，通常用“plan in advance / arrange beforehand / prearrange”更自然。

summary.en: “Foreordinate” means to decide or arrange something in advance, often with a sense of being predestined.
summary.zh: “Foreordinate”指预先决定或安排（常带“预定/注定”的语感），属于少见偏古旧用词。

definition.en: to decide or arrange something in advance; to predestine or preordain
definition.zh: 预先决定；预先安排；（尤指神学语境）预定、预先注定

examples.en: Some theologians used the word “foreordinate” to talk about events believed to be decided by God in advance.
examples.zh: 一些神学家用“foreordinate”来讨论那些被认为是上帝预先决定的事件。

examples.en: The committee did not foreordinate the outcome; it listened to all the evidence first.
examples.zh: 委员会并没有预先决定结果；它先听取了所有证据。

extraExplanation: 这是一个非常少见、偏古旧的词，常见于较早期的宗教或哲学写作中。现代英语里更常用的是 preordain（预定）或 predestine（注定）。
词形上可理解为 fore-（在……之前）+ ordain（任命/规定/按宗教仪式授职；也可指“制定、规定”），因此核心意思是“提前规定”。在神学讨论里，它常与“宿命/预定论”相关。

summary.en: Foreordinated means decided or destined in advance (often formal or religious).
summary.zh: Foreordinated 指“预先决定/安排；命中注定”，多用于正式或宗教语境。

definition.en: (often in religion or formal writing) planned or decided in advance; destined to happen.
definition.zh: （常用于宗教或正式语境）预先安排好的；命中注定要发生的。

examples.en: Some people believe our lives are foreordinated by a higher power.
examples.zh: 有些人相信我们的人生是由更高的力量预先安排好的。

examples.en: In the story, the hero’s victory seems foreordinated from the beginning.
examples.zh: 在这个故事里，英雄的胜利从一开始就像是命中注定的。

definition.en: past form of “foreordinate”: to plan, appoint, or determine in advance.
definition.zh: “foreordinate”的过去式：预先计划、指定或决定。

examples.en: The council foreordinated the date of the ceremony months ago.
examples.zh: 议会在几个月前就预先定好了仪式日期。

examples.en: They argued that the outcome was foreordinated and could not be changed.
examples.zh: 他们认为结果早已注定，无法改变。

extraExplanation: “foreordinated”较少见，更常见的拼写是“foreordained”。两者意思非常接近，尤其在基督教神学里常用来谈“预定/天命”（predestination）的观念。
词根提示：fore-（在前、预先）+ ordain（任命、规定）。在现代日常英语中，人们更常用“predestined / destined / preplanned”。

summary.en: Foreordinating means deciding or arranging something in advance—often with the sense of predestination.
summary.zh: Foreordinating 指预先决定或安排某事，常带有“宿命/预定”的含义。

definition.en: deciding or arranging something in advance, as if by fate or a higher power; predestining
definition.zh: 预先决定（仿佛由命运或更高力量安排）；注定

examples.en: Some traditions describe the universe as foreordinating each person’s life path.
examples.zh: 一些传统把宇宙描绘为预先注定每个人的人生道路。

examples.en: He rejected the idea of a foreordinating fate and believed people shape their own choices.
examples.zh: 他否定“命运预先安排”的观念，认为人应当塑造自己的选择。

definition.en: planning or setting something up beforehand (rare, formal)
definition.zh: 事先规划或安排（罕见、较正式）

examples.en: The committee is foreordinating the schedule months before the event.
examples.zh: 委员会在活动前几个月就先行安排日程。

extraExplanation: “foreordinating”是动词“foreordain”的现在分词/动名词形式，常见于宗教或哲学语境，强调“预定”“宿命”的意味，比普通的“plan/arrange（计划/安排）”更强烈、更带价值判断。
在基督教神学讨论中，“foreordain/foreordination”常与“predestination（预定论）”相关；在日常英语里较少用，通常用“predestine”或更中性的“plan/arrange”来表达。

summary.en: Foreordination means that a future outcome or destiny is decided in advance, often in a religious sense.
summary.zh: Foreordination 指未来结果或命运在事先就被决定，常带宗教（神意预定）的含义。

definition.en: the act or belief that events or a person’s destiny have been decided in advance (often by God or a divine plan)
definition.zh: 预定；预先安排（常指由上帝或神意预先决定人的命运或事件的发展）

examples.en: In some Christian traditions, foreordination is linked to the idea that God knows and appoints what will happen.
examples.zh: 在一些基督教传统中，“foreordination”与“上帝知晓并安排将发生之事”的观念相关。

examples.en: The novel explores whether the hero’s life is shaped by choice or by foreordination.
examples.zh: 这部小说探讨主人公的人生究竟由选择塑造，还是由“预定”决定。

extraExplanation: “foreordination”常见于宗教与哲学语境，尤其在基督教神学中，常与“predestination（预定论）”相关但不一定完全等同。一般可理解为“预先决定/任命”的观念或行为。
词形上可拆为 fore-（在前、预先）+ ordain（任命、授予圣职、规定）+ -ation（名词后缀）。因此它带有“提前安排/规定”的语感，语域较正式。

summary.en: “foreorlop” isn’t a standard word; you probably mean “forelock,” a small tuft of hair at the front of the head (or a horse’s forehead hair).
summary.zh: “foreorlop”不是标准英语词；你可能想写“forelock”，指额前的一撮头发（或马额前的毛）。

definition.en: (Likely a misspelling of) forelock: a small piece of hair that grows or falls at the front of the head, especially on the forehead; also used for a horse’s hair on the forehead.
definition.zh: （可能是拼写错误，正确应为）forelock：额前的一撮头发（刘海/前额垂发）；也可指马额前的毛。

examples.en: She brushed her forelock out of her eyes.
examples.zh: 她把额前的一撮头发从眼前拨开。

examples.en: The horse had a white star and a long forelock.
examples.zh: 那匹马额头有一块白斑，额前的毛很长。

extraExplanation: “foreorlop”不是常见英语单词，最接近且常用的词通常是“forelock”（额前的一撮头发）。如果你想表达“前额的刘海/垂发”，用 forelock 或 bangs（美式常用）更自然。
在文学或较正式的描写里，forelock 常用来营造人物外貌细节（比如“a rebellious forelock”=一撮不听话、翘起的前额头发）。

summary.en: A forepad is the soft pad under an animal’s front paw.
summary.zh: forepad 指动物前爪脚底的肉垫。

definition.en: the soft pad on the underside of an animal’s front paw (front foot), such as a cat or dog
definition.zh: （猫、狗等动物）前爪（前脚）脚底的肉垫

examples.en: The dog’s forepad was cut on the broken glass.
examples.zh: 狗的前爪肉垫被碎玻璃划伤了。

examples.en: Check each forepad after a long hike to make sure there’s no thorn stuck in it.
examples.zh: 长途徒步后检查每个前爪肉垫，确保没有刺扎进去。

extraExplanation: “fore-”表示“前面的、前部的”，如 foreleg（前腿）、forearm（前臂）。
在兽医或宠物护理语境里更常见的说法是 paw pad（肉垫）或 footpad（脚垫）；forepad 更强调“前爪/前脚”的肉垫。

summary.en: Forepale is a rare, archaic word meaning “pale beforehand,” and it can also be used as a verb meaning “to become/make pale in advance.”
summary.zh: forepale 是一个罕见的古用词，意为“预先显得苍白”；也可作动词表示“提前变白/使提前变白”。

definition.en: (rare, archaic) Pale beforehand; already pale in anticipation (often from fear, shock, or illness).
definition.zh: （罕见/古用）预先变得苍白的；因恐惧、震惊或病弱而提前显得面色苍白的。

examples.en: At the news, his forepale face suggested he already feared the worst.
examples.zh: 听到消息时，他那张预先苍白的脸显示他早已担心最坏的结果。

examples.en: She looked forepale before speaking, as if the words would hurt.
examples.zh: 她开口前就显得面色发白，仿佛那些话会让人受伤。

definition.en: (rare, archaic) To become pale beforehand; to make (someone) pale in advance.
definition.zh: （罕见/古用）提前变苍白；使（某人）预先变得面色苍白。

examples.en: Fear seemed to forepale him before he reached the door.
examples.zh: 恐惧似乎在他走到门口之前就让他脸色发白。

examples.en: The memory forepaled her, even before she read the letter again.
examples.zh: 那段记忆甚至在她再次读信之前就让她面色苍白。

extraExplanation: “forepale”并不是现代英语里的常用词，更常见的是用“pale / pallid / ashen”来表达“脸色苍白”。它看起来是由前缀“fore-（预先、提前）”+“pale（苍白）”构成，因此语义上相当于“提前变白/预先显得苍白”。如果你是在某篇旧文学作品或诗歌里见到它，通常带有一种古典、文学化的色彩。
如果你是想查更常用的表达，可以考虑："turn pale"（脸色发白）、"go pale"、"pale with fear"（吓得脸色发白）。

summary.en: Forepaled means fenced in or confined within boundaries (often used in literary style).
summary.zh: Forepaled 指“被围栏围住的、被圈在界限内的”，多见于文学语体。

definition.en: enclosed or fenced in (usually with a barrier like a fence); shut in, kept within boundaries
definition.zh: （通常指用栅栏等）围住的；被圈在界限之内的；受限制的

examples.en: The deer were forepaled within the park, unable to wander into the fields beyond.
examples.zh: 鹿群被围在园林的围栏之内，无法走到外面的田野去。

examples.en: He felt forepaled by rules that left him little freedom.
examples.zh: 他觉得自己被规章制度“围住了”，几乎没有自由。

extraExplanation: “forepaled”来自较古老/文学性的动词 forepale（如今很少用），意思是“在前方设围栏、用栅栏围住”。这里的 pale 不是“苍白”，而是古义“栅栏、围栏”。因此 forepaled 常见于文学语境，带有“被圈在某个范围里”的意象，也可引申为“受制度/环境限制”。

summary.en: “Forepaling” is an archaic, poetic word meaning “terrifying, making someone turn pale,” and can also refer to causing something to fade in color.
summary.zh: “forepaling”是古语/诗歌用词，意为“骇人、吓得人脸色发白”，也可指“使褪色、变淡”。

definition.en: (Archaic/poetic) making someone look pale with fear or shock; terrifying; appalling.
definition.zh: （古语/诗歌用法）使人因恐惧或震惊而脸色苍白的；骇人的；令人惊惧的。

examples.en: A forepaling cry rose from the alley, and everyone froze.
examples.zh: 小巷里传来一声骇人的尖叫，所有人都僵住了。

examples.en: He described the battle in forepaling detail, as if the scene were still before his eyes.
examples.zh: 他用令人惊惧的细节描述那场战斗，仿佛场景仍在眼前。

definition.en: (Archaic) the act of making pale or blanching; causing to fade or lose color.
definition.zh: （古语）使变白/褪色的行为；使颜色变淡。

examples.en: The forepaling of the cloth came from too much sun.
examples.zh: 布料褪色是因为晒太阳太久。

extraExplanation: “forepaling”常被理解为动词/形容词“forepale”的现在分词形式，带有强烈的文学、古风色彩，现代英语里很少使用。更常见的表达是 terrifying / chilling / frightening，或用“turn pale”来描述“吓得脸色发白”。
在古典诗歌或史诗风格文本中，这类词常用来营造强烈画面感：不是单纯说“可怕”，而是强调“可怕到让人脸色发白”。

summary.en: A formal word meaning an ancestor, especially a grandparent or earlier family member.
summary.zh: 较正式用语，意为“祖先”，尤指祖父母或更早的先人。

definition.en: A grandparent or other ancestor; someone from whom you are descended.
definition.zh: 祖先；（尤指）祖父母或更早的先人。

examples.en: My foreparents came to the U.S. in the early 1900s.
examples.zh: 我的祖先在20世纪初来到美国。

examples.en: She is researching her foreparents in old church records.
examples.zh: 她在旧教会记录中研究自己的祖先。

extraExplanation: “Foreparent”较偏正式，也较少用；日常英语里更常说“ancestor(s)”或“forebear(s)”。
词源上由“fore-（在前、早先）+ parent（父母）”组成，意思是“在你之前的父母辈/先人”。
相关词：ancestor（最常用、范围广），forebear（较正式、带历史感），progenitor（更正式，常指家族/族群的始祖或开创者）。

summary.en: Foreparents means your ancestors—family members from long ago, used in formal or historical contexts.
summary.zh: foreparents 指“祖先”，语气较正式、偏历史语境。

definition.en: People in your family who lived a long time ago; ancestors (often used in a formal or historical way).
definition.zh: 很久以前的家族成员；祖先（常用于正式或历史语境）。

examples.en: Many immigrants honor their foreparents by keeping traditional holidays.
examples.zh: 许多移民会通过保留传统节日来纪念祖先。

examples.en: Our foreparents built the first schools in this town.
examples.zh: 我们的祖先在这个镇上建立了最早的学校。

extraExplanation: “foreparents”是比较正式、略带历史感的说法，比日常更常见的“ancestors”或“forefathers”更少用。它强调“在我们之前的父辈/祖辈”，不一定只指男性（而“forefathers”常带“男性祖先”的感觉）。
常见搭配：honor/remember one’s foreparents（纪念祖先），the ways of our foreparents（祖先的生活方式/传统）。

summary.en: Forepart means the front part of something, especially the front section of a ship.
summary.zh: Forepart指某物的前部，尤其常用于指船只的前部区域。

definition.en: the front part of something; the part nearest the front
definition.zh: 前部；前段（指某物最靠前的部分）

examples.en: Please sit in the forepart of the bus so the back isn’t crowded.
examples.zh: 请坐在公交车的前部，这样后面就不会太拥挤。

examples.en: In the forepart of the book, you’ll find the introduction and table of contents.
examples.zh: 在书的前段，你会看到序言和目录。

definition.en: (nautical) the front section of a ship, near the bow
definition.zh: （航海）船的前部；船首附近的区域

examples.en: The crew secured the ropes in the forepart of the ship.
examples.zh: 船员在船的前部把绳索固定好。

examples.en: Heavy waves struck the forepart, sending spray over the deck.
examples.zh: 巨浪拍打船的前部，水花溅满甲板。

definition.en: located in or toward the front; earlier or front-positioned
definition.zh: 位于前部的；在前面的（较少用作形容词）

examples.en: Damage was found on the forepart panels of the aircraft.
examples.zh: 飞机前部的面板发现了损伤。

extraExplanation: “fore-”是英语里表示“前、在前面”的常见前缀（如: forecast, foreword, forefront）。因此forepart字面意思就是“前面的部分”。
在现代日常英语里，更常见的说法是the front part或the front section；forepart更偏书面、技术或航海语境。

summary.en: “Foreparts” means the front parts of something, especially in formal or technical contexts.
summary.zh: “foreparts”指某物的前部（较正式或技术性语境常用）。

definition.en: The front parts of something; the portions located toward the front.
definition.zh: 某物的前部；靠前的部分。

examples.en: The foreparts of the ship were damaged by the storm.
examples.zh: 船的前部被暴风雨损坏了。

examples.en: Please keep heavy boxes out of the foreparts of the boat.
examples.zh: 请不要把重箱子放在船的前部。

extraExplanation: “fore-”是英语里表示“在前、前方”的常见前缀（如: forehead 前额, forecast 预报）。
“foreparts”常见于航海、工程、解剖或较正式的描述中；日常口语里更常说“the front part(s)”或“the front end”。

summary.en: Forepass is a rare, mostly archaic word meaning “to go before” or “to pass in front of.”
summary.zh: Forepass 是一个罕见且多为古语的词，意思是“走在前面”或“从……前方经过”。

definition.en: (rare, usually archaic) To pass in front of someone or something; to go before; to precede.
definition.zh: （罕见，常为古语）从……前方经过；走在前面；先于……发生（先行）。

examples.en: In the old tale, a bright star seemed to forepass the travelers and show them the road.
examples.zh: 在那则古老故事里，一颗明亮的星似乎走在旅人前方，为他们指路。

examples.en: She let the guests forepass her into the hall.
examples.zh: 她让客人先于她进入大厅。

definition.en: (very rare) A passing in front; an act of going before.
definition.zh: （极罕见）从前方经过；先行之举。

examples.en: The poem mentions the forepass of dawn across the hills.
examples.zh: 诗中提到黎明先行越过群山的过程。

extraExplanation: “fore-”表示“在前、先于”，加上“pass（经过）”构成“forepass”。这个词在现代英语里几乎不用，更常见的替代说法有：pass in front of, go before, precede, let someone go first。
如果你是在某段古英语/中古或早期现代英语文本里看到它，通常就是“先行、走在前面”的意思；现代写作中用它会显得刻意古风或不自然。

summary.en: “Forepassed” is an archaic word meaning “already passed; bygone,” and it can also be the past form of “forepass” (time passed).
summary.zh: forepassed 是古语，意思是“已经过去的、往昔的”，也可作 forepass 的过去式/过去分词，表示“时间消逝”。

definition.en: (Archaic) Having already passed; gone by; earlier.
definition.zh: （古语）已经过去的；先前的；早先的。

examples.en: We should learn from forepassed mistakes.
examples.zh: 我们应该从过去的错误中吸取教训。

examples.en: In his diary, he compared the present winter to forepassed winters.
examples.zh: 在日记里，他把今年的冬天与往昔的冬天作了比较。

definition.en: (Archaic) Past tense / past participle of “forepass”: to pass before; to pass away (of time).
definition.zh: （古语）“forepass”的过去式/过去分词：先于……经过；（时间）过去、消逝。

examples.en: Many years had forepassed before they met again.
examples.zh: 许多年过去后，他们才再相见。

examples.en: The hour forepassed quickly in conversation.
examples.zh: 谈话中一个小时很快就过去了。

extraExplanation: “fore-”表示“在前、预先”（如 foresee 预见、foretell 预言）。forepassed 多见于较老的文学或宗教/诗歌风格文本，现代英语更常用 past, previous, bygone, elapsed, has passed 等表达。
在现代写作里，用 forepassed 可能显得刻意“古风”。如果你想要正式但不古旧的表达，可以用 previously, earlier, in years past, time elapsed 等。

summary.en: “Forepast” is an archaic/literary adjective meaning “earlier; former; belonging to the past.”
summary.zh: “forepast”是古语/文学用语，作形容词，意为“较早的、从前的、过去的”。

definition.en: (Archaic or literary) Earlier; belonging to a time before the present; former.
definition.zh: （古语/文学用语）较早的；过去的；从前的。

examples.en: In forepast days, the village was surrounded by forests.
examples.zh: 在往昔的日子里，这个村庄四周都是森林。

examples.en: She wrote about forepast customs that few people remember now.
examples.zh: 她写到了如今很少有人记得的旧时习俗。

extraExplanation: “forepast”带有古风色彩，现代英语中很少在日常交流里使用，更常见于诗歌、历史叙述或刻意营造古典语气的写作。
词义上接近“former / bygone / past”。在现代写作中，如果不是为了文体效果，通常用“past”“former”更自然。

summary.en: A forepaw is an animal’s front paw (front foot).
summary.zh: forepaw 指四足动物的前爪（前脚）。

definition.en: the front foot of an animal that walks on four legs (such as a dog, cat, or bear)
definition.zh: （四足动物的）前爪；前脚（如狗、猫、熊等）

examples.en: The dog raised its forepaw to scratch its ear.
examples.zh: 那只狗抬起前爪去挠耳朵。

examples.en: You can see bear tracks by the shape of the forepaw and hind paw prints.
examples.zh: 你可以通过前爪和后爪脚印的形状来辨认熊的足迹。

extraExplanation: “fore-”是表示“前面的、在前方的”前缀（如 forehead 额头、forearm 前臂）；paw 指“（有爪的）动物脚掌”。因此 forepaw 就是“前面的爪/脚”。
在自然写作与故事描写中，forepaw 常用来突出动物的动作细节（如“伸出前爪”），比一般的 front foot 更形象。

summary.en: Forepaws are an animal’s front paws (front feet).
summary.zh: forepaws 指动物的前爪（前脚）。

definition.en: the front feet (paws) of an animal; especially of a four-legged animal like a dog, cat, bear, or rabbit
definition.zh: （动物的）前爪；前脚（尤指狗、猫、熊、兔等四足动物的前脚）

examples.en: The puppy rested its forepaws on the edge of the couch.
examples.zh: 小狗把前爪搭在沙发边上。

examples.en: The bear stood up on its hind legs and raised its forepaws.
examples.zh: 熊用后腿站立，抬起了前爪。

examples.en: Wipe your dog’s forepaws before it comes inside.
examples.zh: 狗进屋前先把它的前爪擦干净。

extraExplanation: “Fore-”表示“前面的”（如 forehead 额头、forecast 预测）。forepaw 常用于描述动物的动作与姿态，写动物观察或文学描写时很常见。
在日常口语里也常说 front paws（前爪）。不过 forepaws 更偏书面、叙述或科普语气。

summary.en: Forepayment means an advance payment made before something is due (similar to prepayment).
summary.zh: Forepayment 指在到期前先支付的款项，意思接近 prepayment（预付款）。

definition.en: Payment made in advance before goods, services, or a debt is due; an advance payment (often used in finance or business contracts).
definition.zh: 预先付款；预付款（常用于金融或商业合同中，指在到期前先支付款项）。

examples.en: The supplier requires forepayment before shipping the order.
examples.zh: 供应商要求先预付款才发货。

examples.en: We offered a small forepayment to reserve the apartment.
examples.zh: 我们付了一小笔预付款来预订这套公寓。

extraExplanation: “forepayment”在现代英语中不如“prepayment”常见，更正式、偏商务/法律语境。日常交流里通常说“pay in advance”或“make a prepayment”。
词形上由“fore-”（在前、预先）+ “payment”（付款）构成。写合同或账单时可能会看到，也可能出现在较旧的文本中。

summary.en: A forepeak is a storage or utility compartment in the very front part of a ship, below the deck near the bow.
summary.zh: forepeak 指船首最前端、甲板以下的前尖舱（常用于储物或设备）。

definition.en: the compartment in the forward (front) part of a ship, especially the space in the bow below the deck (often used for storage, equipment, or crew quarters).
definition.zh: （船的）艏尖舱；前尖舱：位于船首前部、甲板以下的舱室（常用于储物、设备或船员住舱）。

examples.en: The crew stored spare rope in the forepeak.
examples.zh: 船员把备用绳索存放在前尖舱里。

examples.en: Water had leaked into the forepeak during the storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨期间，水渗进了前尖舱。

extraExplanation: “fore-”表示“前部/在前”，而“peak”在航海语境里常指“船体前端尖部附近的结构或空间；因此 forepeak 指船首最前端下方的舱室。
相关词：aftpeak（后尖舱，船尾处的对应舱室）；bow（船首）；stern（船尾）；fore（在前部的）。

summary.en: “Forepeaks” means the forward-most compartments of a ship (plural of forepeak).
summary.zh: “forepeaks”指船首舱（forepeak 的复数），即船上最前端的舱室。

definition.en: the forward-most compartment of a ship, usually below the main deck (often used for storage or crew space); plural form of “forepeak.”
definition.zh: 船首舱（船上最前端、通常在主甲板以下的舱室；常用于储物或船员空间），“forepeak”的复数。

examples.en: The crew stored spare ropes in the forepeaks.
examples.zh: 船员把备用缆绳存放在船首舱里。

examples.en: Water was seeping into one of the forepeaks during the storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨中，有一个船首舱在渗水。

extraExplanation: “forepeak”是航海/船舶用语：fore- 表示“前部”，peak 指船体最前端区域。常见搭配有 forepeak tank（船首压载/储水舱）、forepeak deck（船首甲板区域）。在现代日常英语里不常见，多出现在航运、海事报告或海洋文学作品中。

summary.en: Foreperiod means the time just before an event, or (in experiments) the time between a warning signal and the required response.
summary.zh: Foreperiod 指事件发生前的一段时间；在实验中也指从提示信号到需要反应之间的时间间隔。

definition.en: The period of time just before a particular event happens; a lead-up interval.
definition.zh: 某件事发生之前的一段时间；前期、前置时间。

examples.en: During the foreperiod before the storm, the air felt unusually still.
examples.zh: 暴风雨来临前的那段时间，空气异常安静。

examples.en: In the foreperiod of the election, candidates travel constantly and give many speeches.
examples.zh: 选举前期，候选人频繁奔波并发表大量演讲。

definition.en: (Psychology/experiments) The interval between a warning signal and the moment a person must respond to a stimulus.
definition.zh: （心理学/实验）从“提示/警告信号”出现到需要对刺激作出反应之间的时间间隔。

examples.en: Researchers varied the foreperiod to see how it affected reaction time.
examples.zh: 研究人员改变前置间隔（foreperiod），以观察它对反应时的影响。

examples.en: A longer foreperiod can sometimes help participants prepare for the task.
examples.zh: 较长的前置间隔有时能帮助受试者为任务做好准备。

extraExplanation: fore- 表示“在前、预先”，period 表示“时期/时间段”，合在一起就是“事件发生前的一段时间”。
在实验心理学里，foreperiod 常用于反应时研究：先给一个提示（如声音或灯光），过一段 foreperiod 后再出现目标刺激，研究被试的准备与反应。

summary.en: Forepersons are leaders in charge of a work crew or the chosen leaders of juries.
summary.zh: forepersons 指工作团队的领班/负责人，或陪审团的主持人（团长）。

definition.en: Plural of foreperson: a person in charge of a group of workers (especially on a construction site or in a factory), or the elected leader of a jury.
definition.zh: foreperson 的复数：负责人/领班（常见于工地或工厂等工作团队）；也可指陪审团的主持人（陪审团团长）。

examples.en: The forepersons assigned tasks and checked safety rules before work began.
examples.zh: 领班们在开工前分配任务并检查安全规定。

examples.en: During the trial, the forepersons of different juries announced their verdicts.
examples.zh: 在审判中，不同陪审团的团长宣布了各自的裁决。

extraExplanation: “foreperson”常被视为比“foreman”更中性、更包容的说法，尤其在正式场合或写作中更常用。
在陪审团语境中，foreperson（或 foreman/forewoman）通常负责组织讨论、与法官沟通，并在法庭上宣读裁决。

summary.en: Forepiece means the front part of something, and in older/literary use it can also mean a book’s introductory section.
summary.zh: Forepiece 指某物的前部；在较旧或文学用法中也可指书的序言/引言部分。

definition.en: The front part of something, especially the piece or section at the very front.
definition.zh: 某物的前部；尤指最前端的部分或一块。

examples.en: The forepiece of the ship was damaged in the storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨中，船的前部受损了。

examples.en: He adjusted the forepiece of his costume to make it sit neatly.
examples.zh: 他调整了服装的前襟，让它更整齐。

definition.en: (Literary/older) A short introduction or prefatory section at the beginning of a book or document.
definition.zh: （文学/旧用）书或文件开头的简短引言、序言部分。

examples.en: The author explains her purpose in the forepiece before Chapter 1.
examples.zh: 作者在第一章前的序言里说明了写作目的。

examples.en: In older books, the forepiece sometimes includes a note to the reader.
examples.zh: 在较老的书里，序言有时会包含写给读者的话。

extraExplanation: “fore-”表示“前面的”（如 forearm 前臂、forecast 预测）。因此 forepiece 字面意思就是“前面的那一块/那一部分”。
这个词在现代英语里不算常见，更多见于较旧的文字或特定领域（如服装、船只结构、书籍版式）。现代更常用 front part / front piece / preface / introduction 等表达。

summary.en: Foreplace is a rare/archaic noun meaning “the front position” or, figuratively, “a position of prominence.”
summary.zh: foreplace 是一个罕见/古语名词，意思是“前排位置”，也可引申为“显要地位”。

definition.en: (Archaic or rare) A front place or the position in front; the foremost part or area.
definition.zh: （古语/罕见）前方的位置；最前面的部分或区域。

examples.en: In the procession, the elders were given the foreplace.
examples.zh: 在游行队伍中，长者被安排在最前面的位置。

examples.en: She moved to the foreplace of the crowd to see the speaker clearly.
examples.zh: 她走到人群前排，好更清楚地看到演讲者。

definition.en: (Figurative, archaic) The leading position in attention or importance; prominence.
definition.zh: （比喻，古语）显要地位；突出、显赫。

examples.en: Honesty should have the foreplace in public life.
examples.zh: 诚实在公共生活中应当居于首要地位。

examples.en: In his mind, duty held the foreplace over comfort.
examples.zh: 在他心里，责任比安逸更重要。

extraExplanation: “fore-”表示“前、先”（如 forehead 额头，foreground 前景），“place”是“位置”。合在一起直观地表示“在前面的地方”。
这个词在现代英语里非常少见，更常用的表达有 “front place / first place / the front / the forefront / a leading position”。如果你在现代写作中使用，可能会显得古风或不自然。

summary.en: Foreplan means to plan ahead (rare in modern usage).
summary.zh: Foreplan 意为“提前计划/预先筹划”（现代英语中较少见）。

definition.en: to plan in advance; to think about and arrange something before it happens
definition.zh: 预先计划；提前筹划

examples.en: We foreplanned the trip so we could save money and avoid last-minute stress.
examples.zh: 我们提前筹划了这次旅行，这样既能省钱也能避免临时的压力。

examples.en: If you foreplan your week, you’ll have more time to rest.
examples.zh: 如果你提前规划一周的安排，你会有更多时间休息。

definition.en: a plan made in advance (rare use)
definition.zh: 预先制定的计划（较少见用法）

examples.en: Her foreplan included a backup option in case the meeting ran late.
examples.zh: 她的预先计划里包含了一个备用方案，以防会议拖延。

extraExplanation: “foreplan”在现代英语里不算常用词，写作或口语中更自然的表达通常是：plan ahead（提前计划）、make plans in advance（事先做计划）、preplan（预先规划）。
构词上，fore- 表示“在前、预先”（如 forecast 预测、foresee 预见），plan 表示“计划”，合起来就是“提前计划”。
使用时注意：preplan 有时会被认为“重复”（因为 plan 本身就包含提前安排的意思），但在口语和工作场景里仍很常见。

summary.en: Foreplanning means planning ahead in advance.
summary.zh: Foreplanning 指“提前规划、预先做计划”。

definition.en: the act of planning ahead in advance; making plans before something happens
definition.zh: 预先规划；提前做计划（在事情发生前先安排好）

examples.en: Good foreplanning can save you time and money during a trip.
examples.zh: 好的预先规划可以在旅行中帮你省时间和省钱。

examples.en: With careful foreplanning, the team avoided most last-minute problems.
examples.zh: 通过细致的提前规划，团队避免了大多数临时问题。

definition.en: (less common) the process of deciding steps and resources for a future project or event
definition.zh: （较少见）为未来的项目或活动确定步骤和资源的过程

examples.en: The conference took months of foreplanning, from booking rooms to inviting speakers.
examples.zh: 这场会议从订场地到邀请讲者，花了几个月的前期筹备。

extraExplanation: “foreplanning”在现代英语里不算常见，日常更常用的说法是“planning ahead”或“advance planning”。在正式写作中也可以用“preplanning/advance planning”。
词源上“fore-”表示“在……之前/预先”，所以它的核心含义就是“提前规划”。

summary.en: Foreplanting means planting (or placing scenery) in the foreground, especially in landscaping or stage design.
summary.zh: Foreplanting 指在前景进行种植（或在舞台前部布置景物），多用于景观设计或舞台美术。

definition.en: the act or practice of planting something in the front (foreground), especially to create a visual frame or to hide less attractive areas in landscaping or gardening
definition.zh: （园艺/景观中）在前景处种植的做法；通过前排植物来框景或遮挡不美观区域

examples.en: The designer used foreplanting to soften the edge of the driveway with low shrubs.
examples.zh: 设计师用前景种植在车道边缘种上矮灌木，让线条更柔和。

examples.en: A row of ornamental grasses is common foreplanting in front of taller hedges.
examples.zh: 在更高的树篱前种一排观赏草，是常见的前景种植方式。

definition.en: in stage design, foliage or low scenery placed near the front of the stage to create depth and a natural look
definition.zh: （舞台美术中）前景布景；放在舞台前部的植物/矮景片，用来增加层次与自然感

examples.en: The forest scene looked more realistic after the crew added foreplanting along the stage front.
examples.zh: 工作人员在台口加了前景布景后，森林场景看起来更逼真了。

extraExplanation: “foreplanting”并不算日常高频词，更常见于景观设计、园艺写作或舞台布景语境。
构词可理解为 fore-（在前）+ planting（种植）。在园艺里它常与 “background planting（背景种植）” 相对：前景多用较矮、质感细致的植物来“压前景/做边框”，背景则用更高或更醒目的植物来形成主体。

summary.en: Foreplay means intimate actions before sex; it can also mean a figurative “lead-in” to something important.
summary.zh: Foreplay 指性行为前的亲密互动；也可比喻为某事发生前的“前奏/铺垫”。

definition.en: Intimate touching, kissing, or talk before sexual intercourse, meant to build desire and arousal.
definition.zh: 前戏：在性交前的亲密接触（如亲吻、抚摸或挑逗性对话），用于增加欲望与性唤起。

examples.en: They spent time on foreplay to feel more relaxed and connected.
examples.zh: 他们花时间做前戏，让彼此更放松、更有亲密感。

examples.en: Good communication can make foreplay more comfortable for both partners.
examples.zh: 良好的沟通能让前戏对双方都更舒适。

definition.en: Anything that happens before an important event and helps lead up to it; a lead-in or preparation.
definition.zh: （比喻）前奏：重要事件发生前的铺垫或准备。

examples.en: The heated debate was foreplay to the election season.
examples.zh: 那场激烈的辩论是选举季的前奏。

examples.en: Small announcements can be foreplay to a major product launch.
examples.zh: 一些小公告可能是重大产品发布的前奏。

extraExplanation: “foreplay”多用于性相关语境，在正式写作或不确定场合可用更委婉的表达，如“intimacy before sex”“romantic touching”。
在日常口语中它是中性词，但在工作场合或与不熟的人交谈时可能显得过于私密；使用时注意语境与对象。

summary.en: “Foreplays” is the plural of “foreplay” (sexual activities before intercourse) or the third-person singular verb form meaning “does foreplay.”
summary.zh: “Foreplays”是“foreplay”的复数（指性交前的亲密/性活动），也可以是动词第三人称单数，表示“进行前戏”。

definition.en: (plural of foreplay) Sexual activity (such as kissing, touching, and talking) that happens before intercourse, often to increase comfort and arousal.
definition.zh: （foreplay 的复数）前戏：发生在性交之前的亲密/性活动（如亲吻、抚摸、语言交流等），常用于增进放松、亲密感与性唤起。

examples.en: They talked openly about what kinds of foreplays made them feel comfortable.
examples.zh: 他们坦诚交流了哪些前戏方式会让彼此感到舒服。

examples.en: Good communication can make foreplays feel safer and more enjoyable for both people.
examples.zh: 良好的沟通能让前戏对双方而言更安全、更愉快。

definition.en: (third-person singular of foreplay) To engage in foreplay; to do sexual activities before intercourse.
definition.zh: （foreplay 的第三人称单数）进行前戏：在性交前进行亲密/性活动。

examples.en: In the novel, the couple foreplays slowly, focusing on trust and consent.
examples.zh: 在小说里，这对伴侣慢慢地进行前戏，强调信任与同意。

extraExplanation: “foreplay”在日常英语里通常是不可数名词（We spent time on foreplay.）。当说“different foreplays / kinds of foreplay(s)”时，复数更常见于强调“不同方式/类型”。
这是与性相关的词，使用时要注意语境与对象。在健康教育或亲密关系讨论中较常见；在工作场合或不熟的人面前可能显得不合适。
相关的更中性表达包括“intimacy（亲密行为）”“physical affection（身体上的亲昵）”。在强调尊重时常与“consent（同意）”“boundaries（界限）”一起出现。

summary.en: “forepleasure” is not standard; it is most likely “for pleasure” = for enjoyment.
summary.zh: “forepleasure”不是标准用法；更可能是“for pleasure”，表示“为了享受/消遣”。

definition.en: (Nonstandard) Likely a misspelling of “for pleasure,” meaning done for enjoyment rather than for work, profit, or necessity.
definition.zh: （非标准用法）多半是把“for pleasure”拼错了，意思是“为了享受/消遣”，不是为了工作、利润或必需。

examples.en: I read novels for pleasure, not for school.
examples.zh: 我读小说是为了消遣，不是为了上学。

examples.en: She plays the piano just for pleasure.
examples.zh: 她弹钢琴只是为了享受。

examples.en: They travel for pleasure during the summer.
examples.zh: 他们夏天旅行是为了娱乐。

extraExplanation: “forepleasure”不是常见英文单词或固定表达，日常写作里几乎不会这样连写。通常应写成两词：for pleasure。
如果你想表达“前戏的快乐/性愉悦”，英文更常用 sexual pleasure、physical pleasure，或在性语境下用 foreplay（前戏）而不是 forepleasure。请根据语境选择更合适、更得体的说法。

summary.en: Foreplot usually means the main, foreground storyline; more rarely, it can mean the front section of a garden or land plot.
summary.zh: Foreplot 通常指作品中最主要、最突出的情节；较少见的用法是指花园或土地的前部地块。

definition.en: the main or most visible storyline in a novel, play, film, etc. (the “foreground” plot, as opposed to a background or subplot)
definition.zh: （文学/影视作品中）主要情节；最突出的故事线（相对于支线/副线）

examples.en: The romance is the foreplot, while the political conflict stays in the background.
examples.zh: 爱情线是主要情节，而政治冲突则退居幕后。

examples.en: In the foreplot, the detective races to stop the crime before midnight.
examples.zh: 在主要情节中，侦探争分夺秒要在午夜前阻止犯罪。

definition.en: the front part of a piece of land or a garden plot (the section nearest the street or entrance)
definition.zh: （土地/花园的）前部地块；靠近道路或入口的地段

examples.en: They planted roses in the foreplot and vegetables behind it.
examples.zh: 他们在前面的花圃种玫瑰，后面种蔬菜。

examples.en: A small foreplot makes the house feel more welcoming.
examples.zh: 一小块前庭花圃会让房子更有亲切感。

extraExplanation: “fore-”有“在前、前景”的意思，foreplot 可理解为“前景中的 plot（情节/地块）”。这个词在现代英语里比较少见；谈文学时更常用 main plot / primary storyline，与之对比的是 subplot（支线情节）。谈花园时更常说 front garden / front yard。

summary.en: Forepoint means the frontmost point or forward end of something, especially a ship or aircraft.
summary.zh: forepoint 指某物最前端的点或前端部位，尤用于船只或飞机。

definition.en: the part that is furthest forward; the frontmost point of something (especially a ship or aircraft).
definition.zh: 最前端；最前面的点（尤指船或飞机的前部/最前点）。

examples.en: The lifeboat was stored near the forepoint of the ship.
examples.zh: 救生艇存放在船的最前端附近。

examples.en: Damage to the forepoint can affect how the vessel cuts through waves.
examples.zh: 最前端受损会影响船只破浪前行的能力。

extraExplanation: “fore-”表示“在前、前部”（如: forecastle 前甲板楼, forearm 前臂），“point”是“尖端/点”。“forepoint”在现代日常英语中不算常用，写作里更常见的替代说法有 the front, the tip, the bow（船头）, the nose（飞机/车辆前部）。在航海或技术语境中使用会更自然。

summary.en: Forepointer is a rare word meaning either an old term for a pointer-type hunting dog or something that indicates what comes next.
summary.zh: Forepointer 是个罕用词，可指旧时的指示犬（pointer 类猎犬），也可指预示后续发展的迹象或信号。

definition.en: (rare) A dog of a pointer type, especially an early or old-fashioned term for a hunting dog trained to point at game birds.
definition.zh: （罕用）一种“指示犬”（pointer）类型的猎犬，尤指旧时对训练来“指示/站定”猎物（常为猎鸟）的犬的称呼。

examples.en: The hunter walked behind his forepointer as it froze, nose aimed at the tall grass.
examples.zh: 猎人跟在他的指示猎犬后面走着，那狗突然定住不动，鼻子对准高草丛。

examples.en: In older sporting writing, a forepointer was prized for a steady point.
examples.zh: 在较早的狩猎文章里，“forepointer”因站定稳、指示清楚而备受推崇。

definition.en: (rare) Something that points forward; an indicator or sign of what is coming next.
definition.zh: （罕用）指向前方的事物；预示、指向接下来会发生什么的 संकेत/迹象。

examples.en: The opening scene serves as a forepointer to the conflict later in the story.
examples.zh: 开场一幕成了后续冲突的预兆。

examples.en: A sudden drop in sales can be a forepointer of deeper problems.
examples.zh: 销量突然下滑可能是更深层问题的预警信号。

extraExplanation: “forepointer”在现代英语中非常少见，更常见的说法是：指示犬用“pointer (dog)”，而“预示/预兆”可用“sign, indicator, warning, foreshadowing”。
词形上由“fore-（在前）+ pointer（指示者/指针）”组成；遇到该词时，往往出现在较旧的狩猎文字或较文学化的表达里。

summary.en: A forepole is a pole at the front of a boat or vehicle, used for support, rigging, or pulling.
summary.zh: forepole 指船只或车辆前部的杆/车辕，用于支撑索具设备或用于牵引。

definition.en: A pole or spar at the front (fore) part of a boat or small vessel, used to support rigging or equipment (and in some cases a small sail).
definition.zh: （航海）船只前部（船首）的杆/桁，用来支撑索具或设备（有时也用于支撑小帆）。

examples.en: They lashed the lantern to the forepole so it would shine over the bow.
examples.zh: 他们把灯绑在前杆上，让光照向船首。

examples.en: Check the forepole for cracks before you tighten the ropes.
examples.zh: 在拉紧绳索前，先检查前杆有没有裂痕。

definition.en: The front pole/shaft of a wagon, cart, or similar vehicle, used for pulling or steering (less common).
definition.zh: （较少见）马车、手推车等车辆前端的牵引杆/车辕，用于牵引或转向。

examples.en: The farmer repaired the forepole after it split near the hitch.
examples.zh: 农夫在靠近挂钩处断裂后修好了前车辕。

examples.en: The horses were harnessed to the forepole and set off down the road.
examples.zh: 马套在前车辕上，随后沿路出发。

extraExplanation: “fore-”是英语里表示“前面的、在前部”的常见前缀（如: forehead 额头, forecast 预测）。因此 forepole 字面就是“前面的杆”。
这个词属于较专业/较少见词汇，更常见的替代表达包括 front pole, bow pole（船首杆）, shaft（车辕/车杆，语境不同意义会变）。

summary.en: Forepoled describes a wagon/cart that has a forepole, or the act of fitting one.
summary.zh: forepoled 指“装有前牵杆的（车）”，也可指“给车装上前牵杆”。

definition.en: (Rare) equipped with a forepole (a pole projecting from the front of a wagon or cart, used to attach animals or connect to another vehicle).
definition.zh: （罕见）装有前牵杆/前车辕（从马车或手推车前端伸出的杆，用来套牲口或连接另一辆车）。

examples.en: The forepoled wagon could be pulled by two horses side by side.
examples.zh: 这辆装有前牵杆的马车可以由两匹马并排拉动。

examples.en: Some older farm carts were forepoled for heavier loads.
examples.zh: 一些较旧的农用车会装前牵杆，以便拉更重的货物。

definition.en: (Rare, past tense/past participle) to fit or equip (a wagon/cart) with a forepole.
definition.zh: （罕见，过去式/过去分词）给（马车/手推车）装上前牵杆/前车辕。

examples.en: They forepoled the cart so it could be hitched to a team.
examples.zh: 他们给车装上前牵杆，这样就能套上一组牲口来拉。

examples.en: A forepoled trailer was easier to connect to another vehicle in the old system.
examples.zh: 在旧式连接方式里，装了前牵杆的拖车更容易与另一辆车连接。

extraExplanation: “forepole/fore-pole”多见于较老的英式/美式农业与马车语境，现代英语里更常见的是与车辆结构相关的词，如“tow bar（牵引杆）”“drawbar（牵引杆）”“shaft（车辕）”。
拼写提示：更常见的词形是“forepole”（名词/动词），而“forepoled”多作为形容词或过去分词出现，属于比较少见的用法。

summary.en: Forepoles are the front poles/beams used for hitching or supporting something, most often on wagons or carts.
summary.zh: Forepoles 指前部的杆/梁，多用于马车或货车前端的牵引杆，也可泛指前部支撑杆。

definition.en: (plural of forepole) a long pole or beam at the front of a wagon, cart, or similar vehicle, used to attach and guide the draft animal(s) or hitch.
definition.zh: （forepole 的复数）马车、货车等车辆前端的一根长杆/横梁，用来连接并引导拉车的动物或牵引装置。

examples.en: The horses were harnessed to the forepoles before the wagon started moving.
examples.zh: 马在马车出发前被套在前牵杆（forepoles）上。

examples.en: A cracked forepole can make the cart hard to control.
examples.zh: 前牵杆裂了会让车很难控制。

definition.en: (less common) front support poles on a structure (for example, the forward poles of a simple frame, shelter, or setup).
definition.zh: （较少见）某种结构前部的支撑杆（例如简易框架、棚子等装置的前部杆件）。

examples.en: They tied the rope to the forepoles to keep the frame steady.
examples.zh: 他们把绳子系在前部支撑杆（forepoles）上，让框架更稳。

extraExplanation: “fore-”表示“前面的/前部的”，如 forearm（前臂）、forecast（预报）。
在美式英语里，连接马车/拖车前端用来牵引的那根杆也常叫 tongue（车辕/牵引杆）；在较英式或较旧的语境里也可能见到 pole。

summary.en: Forepoling is a tunneling technique that installs supports ahead of excavation to prevent collapse.
summary.zh: Forepoling 指隧道开挖前方的超前支护/棚护工法，用于防止坍塌。

definition.en: a tunneling support method in which steel pipes, spiles, or boards are installed ahead of the tunnel face to create a protective “umbrella” and prevent soil or rock from collapsing during excavation
definition.zh: 一种隧道超前支护方法：在掌子面前方打入钢管、钢板（或木板、注浆小导管等），形成“伞状/棚状”保护层，以在开挖时防止土体或围岩坍塌

examples.en: The contractor used forepoling to stabilize the ground before advancing the tunnel face.
examples.zh: 承包商在推进掌子面之前采用了超前棚护（forepoling）来稳定地层。

examples.en: Forepoling is often chosen in soft ground where the roof might collapse during excavation.
examples.zh: 在软弱地层、拱顶可能塌方的情况下，常会选择采用超前棚护（forepoling）。

extraExplanation: “Forepoling”常见于隧道与地下工程语境，尤其是在浅埋、软弱、含水或破碎地层中。其核心思路是“先把伞撑起来再往前挖”，让围岩/土体在开挖瞬间有临时承载与约束。
工程上也常把它与“pipe umbrella（管棚）/spiling（超前小导管、插板）”等概念并列或互用；不同地区和规范对具体构造与材料叫法可能不同。
词形上，fore- 表示“在前方”，pole 指“杆/桩”，-ing 表示“施工/过程”，合起来就是“在前方打入杆件进行超前支护”的意思。

summary.en: Forepool is a rare noun meaning a pool/basin at the front of a mill or water system (and sometimes, in nautical use, a place near a ship’s front where water collects).
summary.zh: Forepool 是较少见的名词，指磨坊/水利系统前方的蓄水池（有时也指船首附近容易积水的部位）。

definition.en: (Watermills/hydraulic engineering) A small basin or pool where water is held at the front (upstream side) of a mill or waterwheel before it flows into the wheel or channel.
definition.zh: （水车/水利工程）水磨坊或水车前方（上游侧）用来暂时蓄水的小水池，水随后流入水轮或水道。

examples.en: The miller cleared leaves from the forepool so water could run smoothly to the wheel.
examples.zh: 磨坊主清理了前蓄水池里的落叶，好让水顺畅流向水轮。

examples.en: After heavy rain, the forepool filled quickly and overflowed into the channel.
examples.zh: 大雨后，前蓄水池很快灌满，溢入水道。

definition.en: (Nautical, rare) A low place or compartment near the front of a vessel where water can collect and be pumped out.
definition.zh: （航海用语，罕见）船只前部较低处/舱位，水可能在此积聚并需要抽排。

examples.en: They checked the forepool for standing water before setting sail.
examples.zh: 他们在启航前检查船首集水处是否有积水。

extraExplanation: “forepool”非常少见，多见于较老的技术语境；现代更常用的对应词是 **forebay**（水轮/水电站前的前池、前水池）或更具体的结构名称。
词源很直观：**fore-**（在前的）+ **pool**（水池）。在不同地区或行业文献中，所指结构可能与“前池/前湾/引水渠入口处的蓄水区”重叠。

summary.en: Foreporch means the front porch of a house.
summary.zh: foreporch 指房子的前廊（front porch）。

definition.en: A porch at the front of a house; a covered entrance area where people may sit or relax.
definition.zh: （房屋）前廊；门廊前的有顶入口区域，常用于坐着休息、聊天。

examples.en: We sat on the foreporch and watched the rain.
examples.zh: 我们坐在前廊上看雨。

examples.en: She left the package on the foreporch.
examples.zh: 她把包裹放在前廊上。

extraExplanation: “foreporch”在现代英语里更常写作两词“front porch”，或连字符形式“fore-porch”。在美式英语中，“front porch”很常见，尤其在描写社区生活、邻里聊天、夏天乘凉等场景时，带有一点温馨的生活气息。
在美国南部与中西部文化中，“front porch”有时象征一种开放、社交的邻里文化（porch sitting / porch talk）。一些文学作品中也会用“front porch”营造家庭、乡镇或怀旧的氛围。

summary.en: A foreportico is a front portico: a covered, columned entrance on the front of a building.
summary.zh: foreportico 指“前柱廊”：建筑正面带顶、常有柱子的入口门廊。

definition.en: a portico (covered entrance with columns) located at the front of a building; a front porch-like structure, often formal or classical in style
definition.zh: （建筑）前柱廊；位于建筑正面的有顶入口（常有柱子），类似正式的前门廊

examples.en: The museum’s foreportico is supported by tall white columns.
examples.zh: 博物馆的前柱廊由高大的白色柱子支撑。

examples.en: Guests waited under the foreportico to stay out of the rain.
examples.zh: 客人们在前柱廊下等候，以避雨。

examples.en: In many classical designs, the foreportico creates a grand first impression.
examples.zh: 在许多古典设计中，前柱廊能营造宏伟的第一印象。

extraExplanation: “fore-”表示“在前、前面的”（如 forehead 额头、forearm 前臂）。foreportico 多见于建筑/古典建筑语境，指建筑正面入口处的柱廊。
相关词：portico（柱廊/门廊），porch（门廊，较口语），colonnade（柱廊/柱列，强调一排柱子）。

summary.en: Foreporticoes are the covered, often columned entrances at the front of a building.
summary.zh: Foreporticoes 指建筑正面有顶、常带柱子的入口门廊（前柱廊入口）。

definition.en: plural of foreportico: covered, columned entrances (porticos) at the front of a building.
definition.zh: foreportico 的复数：建筑物正面的有顶、常带柱廊的入口（门廊/柱廊入口）。

examples.en: Visitors waited under the foreporticoes to stay out of the rain.
examples.zh: 来访者在前柱廊入口下等候，以躲雨。

examples.en: The museum’s foreporticoes give the building a formal, classical look.
examples.zh: 博物馆正面的前柱廊入口让整座建筑显得庄重而古典。

extraExplanation: “fore-”表示“在前面的”，而“portico”指建筑入口处带屋顶、常由柱子支撑的门廊结构；合起来“foreportico”强调“正门前的柱廊入口”。
这是偏书面、偏建筑学的词，在日常英语里更常用 portico / porch / entrance porch 来表达类似意思；在描写古典风格（如希腊、罗马或新古典主义）建筑时更常见。

summary.en: Forepossessed means being influenced or biased in advance (an older/rare word).
summary.zh: forepossessed 指“先入为主、预先受影响/有偏见”（较古旧/少见）。

definition.en: (Archaic) already influenced or biased in advance; having your mind made up before hearing all the facts.
definition.zh: （古用）事先受影响或带有成见的；未听全事实就先入为主的。

examples.en: The jury must not be forepossessed against the defendant.
examples.zh: 陪审团不应对被告先入为主、带有成见。

examples.en: She tried to listen fairly, but she was forepossessed by rumors.
examples.zh: 她努力公正地倾听，但流言让她先入为主。

definition.en: (Rare) occupied or taken over beforehand (for example, by a feeling, thought, or interest).
definition.zh: （罕用）预先被占据的；（思想、情绪或兴趣等）先一步占据心头的。

examples.en: His mind was forepossessed with worry, so he missed the details.
examples.zh: 他满脑子都是担忧，因此忽略了细节。

extraExplanation: “fore-”表示“在前、预先”，与“possess（占有）”组合后，整体强调“在事情发生/证据出现之前就被某种看法或情绪占据”。
该词在现代英语中较少见，阅读较老的文学、法律文本时更可能遇到。日常表达中常用的替代说法有：biased, prejudiced, preconceived, prepossessed。

summary.en: A forepost is the front upright structural post at the bow of a ship.
summary.zh: forepost 指船首（船头）最前端的竖向结构件——艏柱。

definition.en: the forward vertical post or timber at the very front of a ship’s hull (at the bow), forming part of the ship’s frame
definition.zh: （船体的）艏柱；船首最前端的竖向构件（位于船头，构成船体骨架的一部分）

examples.en: The forepost was damaged when the ship struck a rock near the harbor.
examples.zh: 船在港口附近触礁时，艏柱受损了。

examples.en: In traditional wooden shipbuilding, the forepost helps shape and strengthen the bow.
examples.zh: 在传统木质造船中，艏柱有助于塑造并加固船头。

extraExplanation: “fore-”表示“前部、前方”，“post”在这里指“柱、立柱”。因此 forepost 字面意思就是“前部的柱”。
在现代英语里，日常语境更常说 stem 或 stempost（指船首结构）。forepost 更偏航海/造船的技术用语。

summary.en: “Forepredicament” isn’t standard English; you probably mean “predicament,” a difficult situation.
summary.zh: “forepredicament” 不是标准英语；你可能想写 “predicament”，意思是“困境、窘境”。

definition.en: A difficult, unpleasant, or confusing situation that is hard to get out of.
definition.zh: 困境；窘境（难以摆脱的、令人不舒服或棘手的处境）

examples.en: I’m in a real predicament—I lost my wallet the day before my flight.
examples.zh: 我真的陷入困境——航班前一天我把钱包弄丢了。

examples.en: She faced a predicament: tell the truth and risk her job, or stay silent and feel guilty.
examples.zh: 她面临两难困境：说真话可能丢工作，沉默又会内疚。

examples.en: The team found itself in a predicament when the main computer stopped working.
examples.zh: 主电脑停摆后，团队发现自己陷入了困境。

extraExplanation: “forepredicament” 不是常见或标准英语单词。最可能是拼写错误，想写的是 **predicament**（困境）。
如果你确实想表达“事先/前方的困境”，英语更自然的说法是：**a predicament ahead**（前方有困境）、**an upcoming predicament**（即将到来的困境）、或 **a looming predicament**（迫在眉睫的困境）。

summary.en: “Forepreparation” means preparation done in advance, but it’s rare; “preparation” or “advance/prior preparation” is more natural.
summary.zh: “Forepreparation”表示“事先准备/提前准备”，但很少见；更自然的说法是“preparation”或“advance/prior preparation”。

definition.en: Preparation done beforehand; advance preparation. (Rare and not standard in modern English; people usually say “preparation” or “preparation in advance.”)
definition.zh: 事先准备；提前准备。（较少见，现代英语不常用；更常说“preparation”或“preparation in advance”。）

examples.en: With good forepreparation, the trip felt easy and safe.
examples.zh: 有了充分的事先准备，这次旅行感觉轻松又安全。

examples.en: A little preparation in advance can prevent many problems.
examples.zh: 一点提前准备就能避免很多问题。

extraExplanation: “fore-”是一个前缀，表示“在前、预先”（如 forewarn 预先警告、forecast 预测）。从构词逻辑看，forepreparation=“预先的准备”，但这个组合在当代英语里非常少见，写作时更自然的表达是：preparation, advance preparation, prior preparation。
如果你是在某个专业领域（例如工艺/工程/医疗）看到该词，它可能是特定文献中的自造词或较旧用法；一般交流中建议换成更常用的说法。

summary.en: Foreprepare means “prepare in advance,” but it’s rare and old-fashioned in modern English.
summary.zh: Foreprepare 指“预先准备”，但在现代英语中较少见、偏旧式。

definition.en: to prepare in advance; to make something ready beforehand
definition.zh: 预先准备；事先使（某事）就绪

examples.en: The team foreprepared a backup plan in case the weather changed.
examples.zh: 团队预先准备了一个备用方案，以防天气变化。

examples.en: She foreprepared the documents the night before the meeting.
examples.zh: 她在会议前一晚就把文件事先准备好了。

definition.en: to be prepared beforehand (rare/old-fashioned use)
definition.zh: （罕见/较古老用法）事先准备好

examples.en: In earlier writings, people might say they had foreprepared for the journey.
examples.zh: 在较早期的写作中，人们可能会说他们已为旅程事先准备好了。

extraExplanation: “fore-”是一个表示“在前、预先”的前缀（如: foresee 预见、forecast 预测）。因此 foreprepare 字面意思就是“提前准备”。
foreprepare 在现代英语中非常少见，日常更常用 prepare in advance / prepare beforehand / make preparations。阅读古文或仿古写作时可能会遇到。

summary.en: “Forepretended” is a rare, old-fashioned word meaning “previously pretended/previously alleged.” In modern English, people usually say “previously alleged,” “earlier claimed,” or “feigned.”
summary.zh: “forepretended”是罕见的古语，意思是“先前假装的/先前声称（捏造）的”。现代英语更常用“previously alleged / earlier claimed / feigned”等表达。

definition.en: (Archaic/rare) Pretended or claimed earlier; previously alleged or put forward as a pretense.
definition.zh: （古语/罕见）先前假装的；先前声称/托辞出来的。

examples.en: The witness repeated the forepretended story he had told the night before.
examples.zh: 证人重复了他前一晚就已经编造过的那套说辞。

examples.en: They rejected his forepretended reasons and asked for the real motive.
examples.zh: 他们否定了他先前那些托辞，要求他说出真正动机。

definition.en: (Archaic/rare) Past tense/past participle form used with the sense of “to pretend beforehand” or “to allege previously.”
definition.zh: （古语/罕见）作过去式/过去分词使用，含“事先假装/先前声称”的意思。

examples.en: He forepretended illness so he could avoid the meeting.
examples.zh: 他事先装病，以便躲开会议。

examples.en: The charge was forepretended by his enemies to damage his reputation.
examples.zh: 这项指控是他的敌人先前捏造出来的，为了损害他的名声。

extraExplanation: “fore-”是古英语里常见的前缀之一，表示“在前、预先、先前”（如: foresee, foretell）。因此“forepretended”字面上就是“先前假装/先前捏造”。不过它在现代英语中几乎不用，更自然的说法通常是 previously alleged / earlier claimed / pretextual / feigned。
如果你是在旧书、法律文书或戏剧文本里看到它，它往往带有“借口、托辞、捏造出来的理由”的语气。

summary.en: Foreprise is an archaic word meaning an enterprise or daring undertaking.
summary.zh: Foreprise 是古语，意为“事业/计划/大胆的尝试”，相当于 enterprise。

definition.en: (Archaic) An undertaking, project, or daring attempt; an enterprise.
definition.zh: （古语）事业；计划；大胆的尝试；（同）enterprise。

examples.en: In old poems, a knight might begin a foreprise to prove his honor.
examples.zh: 在古老的诗歌里，骑士可能会开启一项 foreprise 来证明自己的荣誉。

examples.en: Their foreprise was risky, but it promised great rewards.
examples.zh: 他们的 foreprise 风险很大，但可能带来丰厚回报。

extraExplanation: “foreprise”是“enterprise”的古体/变体拼写，现代英语几乎不用；阅读古典文学或历史文本时偶尔会遇到。
前缀“fore-”有“在前、预先”的感觉，但在这个词里整体意义更接近“enterprise（事业/冒险的计划）”，不要按“fore + prize”来拆解理解。
在一些早期英语文学（如中世纪/文艺复兴时期文本）中可见该词，用来营造古风或骑士冒险的语感。

summary.en: Foreprize means to prize or praise something in advance (archaic).
summary.zh: Foreprize 指“预先看重/事先称赞”，属于古旧用法。

definition.en: (Archaic) To value or praise in advance; to prize beforehand.
definition.zh: （古/罕用）预先看重；事先称赞；提前珍视。

examples.en: Some patrons foreprize a young artist long before the public notices her.
examples.zh: 有些赞助人会在大众注意到之前就预先看重一位年轻艺术家。

examples.en: Don’t foreprize the plan until you’ve seen the risks.
examples.zh: 在看清风险之前，不要过早抬高这个计划的价值。

extraExplanation: 这是一个非常罕见、偏古英语的词，由 fore-（“预先”）+ prize（“珍视/称赞”）构成，字面意思就是“提前珍视/提前称赞”。在现代英语里通常不用，常用替代说法包括 praise in advance、value highly early、overrate (too early) 等。

summary.en: Foreproduct means the main or intended product of a process (the opposite of a byproduct).
summary.zh: Foreproduct 指某个过程的主要或预期产物（与副产品 byproduct 相对）。

definition.en: a main or primary product (as opposed to a byproduct), especially the intended result of a process or industry
definition.zh: 主要产品；主产物（与“副产品”相对），指某个过程或产业的主要、预期产出

examples.en: In oil refining, gasoline is often treated as the foreproduct, while asphalt can be a byproduct.
examples.zh: 在石油炼制中，汽油常被视为主要产品，而沥青可能是副产品。

examples.en: The project’s foreproduct was a working app, not the research report.
examples.zh: 这个项目的主要产出是一款可用的应用，而不是研究报告。

extraExplanation: “fore-”有“在前、主要”的意思（如 forefront 前沿）。因此 foreproduct 通常强调“主要产物/首要成果”。
这个词在现代英语中不算常见，更常见的说法是 primary product、main product、principal product；与之相对的常用词是 byproduct（副产品）。

summary.en: Foreproffer means to offer or present something ahead of time, sometimes in a formal or literary way.
summary.zh: Foreproffer 指“预先提出/提前提供”，有时带较正式或文学色彩。

definition.en: to offer or present something in advance (before it is asked for or needed)
definition.zh: 预先提出；提前提供（在被要求或需要之前）

examples.en: The manager foreproffered a solution before the team even raised the issue.
examples.zh: 经理在团队还没提出问题前，就预先给出了解决方案。

examples.en: She foreproffered her help, knowing the move would be difficult for him.
examples.zh: 她知道搬家会很难，于是提前提出要帮忙。

definition.en: to offer something formally or respectfully beforehand (often used in more literary or archaic writing)
definition.zh: （较正式/文学用法）预先呈上；提前郑重提议

examples.en: He foreproffered his apologies at the start of the letter.
examples.zh: 他在信的开头就先郑重致歉。

examples.en: The envoy foreproffered gifts to show goodwill.
examples.zh: 使节预先呈上礼物以示友好。

extraExplanation: 这个词非常少见，多数情况下英语会用更常见的表达：offer in advance / pre-offer / propose beforehand。它由 fore-（“在前、预先”）+ proffer（“提出、提供（尤指正式地）”）组成，带一点“先发制人式的提前提出”的语感。
学习时可顺带掌握常用词 proffer：to offer (something) for acceptance（提出/提供，常用于较正式语境）。

summary.en: Forepromise means to promise beforehand, or a promise made in advance (rare in modern English).
summary.zh: Forepromise 指“预先承诺”，也可指“事先做出的承诺”（现代英语中较少见）。

definition.en: to promise or pledge in advance; to promise beforehand
definition.zh: 预先承诺；事先保证

examples.en: The manager couldn’t forepromise a promotion before the annual review.
examples.zh: 经理不能在年度考核之前就预先承诺升职。

examples.en: She refused to forepromise her support until she had read the full plan.
examples.zh: 在读完完整方案之前，她拒绝预先承诺支持。

definition.en: a promise made in advance
definition.zh: 预先做出的承诺；事先的保证

examples.en: He treated her casual comment as a forepromise, which caused confusion later.
examples.zh: 他把她随口的一句话当成了预先承诺，后来就引起了误会。

examples.en: There was no forepromise—only a general intention to help.
examples.zh: 没有任何预先承诺——只是大体上愿意帮忙。

extraExplanation: “fore-” 是英语里表示“在前、预先”的前缀（如 foretell 预言、forecast 预测）。因此 forepromise 字面意思就是“提前承诺”。
该词在现代英语中非常少见，更多时候会用 promise in advance / promise beforehand，或在正式语境用 give assurances / make a prior commitment。

summary.en: “Forepromised” means “promised beforehand,” an older/formal word related to “forepromise.”
summary.zh: “forepromised”意为“事先承诺的/预先答应的”，较古老或正式，用于“forepromise（预先承诺）”的过去式/过去分词或形容词。

definition.en: Promised beforehand; promised in advance (often used in older or formal writing).
definition.zh: 事先承诺的；预先答应的（多见于较古老或较正式的文体）。

examples.en: He reminded them of the forepromised reward for their service.
examples.zh: 他提醒他们，因服务而事先承诺的奖赏。

examples.en: The meeting followed the forepromised schedule exactly.
examples.zh: 会议完全按照先前承诺的日程进行。

definition.en: Past tense/past participle of “forepromise” (to promise in advance).
definition.zh: “forepromise”（预先承诺）的过去式/过去分词。

examples.en: She had forepromised her support before the vote.
examples.zh: 投票前她已预先承诺会支持。

extraExplanation: “fore-”是英语里表示“在……之前”的前缀（如: forewarn 预先警告、forecast 预测）。因此 forepromised 字面意思就是“提前承诺过的”。
这个词在现代英语中比较少见，常被更常用的 in advance / beforehand / previously promised 等表达替代；在阅读较古典或法律/宗教风格文本时可能会遇到。

summary.en: Foreprovided means “provided beforehand,” usually in formal or older usage.
summary.zh: Foreprovided 意为“预先提供的”，多见于正式或较古老的用法。

definition.en: provided beforehand; previously supplied, prepared, or arranged (often used in formal or older legal writing).
definition.zh: 预先提供的；事先准备或安排好的（常见于正式或较古老的法律/文书用语）。

examples.en: All necessary materials were foreprovided before the guests arrived.
examples.zh: 所有必需的物资在客人到达前都已预先备好。

examples.en: The contract assumes that safety equipment is foreprovided by the employer.
examples.zh: 合同假定安全设备由雇主事先提供。

extraExplanation: “fore-”是表示“在前、预先”的前缀（如 foresee, forewarn）。因此 foreprovided 字面意思就是“预先提供”。
该词在现代英语中较少见，很多场合更常用 beforehand / previously provided / already provided / prearranged 等表达。
在法律或合同语境里，使用 foreprovided 往往强调“事前就已具备/已被安排”，以区分事后补充的内容。

summary.en: Foreprovision means making provisions or preparations ahead of time.
summary.zh: Foreprovision 指为未来需要而提前做的供给或准备。

definition.en: advance preparation or supplies provided beforehand for future needs; a provision made in advance
definition.zh: 预先准备（的供给/安排）；为将来需要提前做的准备

examples.en: The team’s foreprovision of water and batteries helped them get through the storm.
examples.zh: 团队预先准备了水和电池，帮助他们撑过了暴风雨。

examples.en: Good foreprovision can prevent small problems from becoming emergencies.
examples.zh: 良好的预先准备能防止小问题变成紧急情况。

extraExplanation: “fore-”有“在前、预先”的意思（如 forewarn 预先警告、forecast 预测），所以 foreprovision 直观上就是“预先的供给/准备”。
该词在现代英语中非常少见，更常用的表达是 “provision in advance / advance provisions / preparation / contingency planning（应急预案）”。在正式写作里也可用 “pre-provisioning（预先配给/预置物资）”。

summary.en: Forepurpose means a plan or intention decided in advance (archaic).
summary.zh: Forepurpose 指“预先决定的目的/意图”（古旧用法）。

definition.en: a purpose or plan decided in advance; a preconceived intention (archaic/rare)
definition.zh: 预先决定的目的；事先拟定的计划或意图（古旧/少见）

examples.en: She spoke as if everything had been arranged with a forepurpose.
examples.zh: 她说话的语气仿佛一切都是事先安排好的。

examples.en: The surprise was not an accident but a forepurpose.
examples.zh: 这次“惊喜”并非偶然，而是预先的安排。

extraExplanation: “fore-”表示“在……之前 / 预先”，与 “before, beforehand” 意思相近；“purpose” 是“目的/意图”。合在一起的 “forepurpose” 就是“预先的意图”。
该词在现代英语里非常少用，写作或口语中更常用：preplanned purpose / prior intention / preconceived plan / deliberate plan。若在文学或历史文本中见到，通常带有“并非偶然，而是蓄意/预谋”的语气。

summary.en: Forequarter means the front part of an animal, especially the front half of a carcass used in butchering.
summary.zh: Forequarter 指动物的前半身，尤指肉类分割中的前半胴体（含肩部与前腿）。

definition.en: The front part of an animal’s body, especially the front half of a carcass (including the shoulder and foreleg).
definition.zh: （动物的）前半身；（尤指胴体的）前半部分（含肩部与前腿），常用于肉类分割。

examples.en: Butchers often separate the forequarter from the hindquarter when cutting beef.
examples.zh: 屠夫在分割牛肉时常把前半胴体（forequarter）与后半胴体（hindquarter）分开。

examples.en: The recipe calls for forequarter meat because it becomes tender when slow-cooked.
examples.zh: 这道菜要求用前半身的肉，因为慢炖后会变得软嫩。

extraExplanation: 在英美语境里，forequarter多见于屠宰、肉品分切与烹饪领域（如牛、羊、鹿等），与hindquarter（后半身）相对。前半部分通常包含肩胛、前腿等部位；不同动物与不同国家的分切法会有差异。
词形上，fore-表示“前”，quarter在这里不是“四分之一”的日常含义，而是“身体/胴体的一个部分（区段）”。
相关词：foreleg（前腿）、shoulder（肩胛/肩肉）、brisket（牛胸肉，常归入前半部分）。

summary.en: Forequarters means the front half of an animal (shoulders and front legs), and can also mean the front section of a carcass in butchery.
summary.zh: forequarters 指动物的前半身（肩部与前腿），也可指屠宰分割中的前段胴体。

definition.en: The front part of an animal’s body (especially a horse or other four-legged animal), including the shoulders and front legs.
definition.zh: （尤指马等四足动物的）前半身；前躯（包括肩部和前腿）

examples.en: The horse’s forequarters were covered in sweat after the long ride.
examples.zh: 长途骑行后，那匹马的前躯被汗水浸湿了。

examples.en: A strong forequarters helps a dog pull a sled more effectively.
examples.zh: 强壮的前躯能让狗更有效地拉雪橇。

definition.en: In butchery, the front section of a carcass, used for certain cuts of meat.
definition.zh: （屠宰/分割用语）前半扇肉；前段胴体（用于特定肉块分割）

examples.en: These cuts come from the forequarters and are often better for slow cooking.
examples.zh: 这些部位来自前半扇肉，通常更适合慢炖。

extraExplanation: “forequarters”通常用复数，指动物的“两侧前半身”整体概念；对应词是“hindquarters”（后躯）。在骑马、兽医、狩猎或肉类分割语境中更常见。

summary.en: Forequoted means “quoted earlier/above in the same document,” often in formal writing.
summary.zh: forequoted 指“在同一文件中前文已引用/上述提到的”，多用于正式书面语。

definition.en: Previously quoted or cited earlier in the same text; mentioned above.
definition.zh: （在同一篇文章/文件中）前文已引用的；上述提到的。

examples.en: As stated in the forequoted passage, the author values honesty over comfort.
examples.zh: 如前文所引的段落所述，作者重视诚实胜过安逸。

examples.en: The judge referred to the forequoted testimony to support the decision.
examples.zh: 法官援引前文所引用的证词来支持该裁决。

definition.en: The past participle form of the rare verb “forequote,” meaning to quote in advance or earlier in a text.
definition.zh: 罕见动词 forequote 的过去分词形式，意为“预先引用；在前文先行引用”。

examples.en: The sources were forequoted to provide context before the main argument.
examples.zh: 这些来源被预先引用，以便在主要论点之前提供背景。

extraExplanation: “forequoted”多见于法律文书、学术写作或较正式的书面语，用来指代“上文已经引用过的内容”。日常英语里更常说：previously quoted / quoted above / earlier cited / aforementioned。

summary.en: “Forerake” is not standard; it’s likely “fore rake,” meaning a forward tilt/slope in technical contexts.
summary.zh: “forerake”不是标准用词；更可能是“fore rake”，指（技术语境中）向前的倾斜/斜度。

definition.en: Not a standard English word; most likely a misspelling or a specialized compound (e.g., “fore rake”).
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词；更可能是拼写错误，或某个专业领域的复合表达（例如“fore rake”）。

examples.en: I can’t find “forerake” in a standard dictionary—did you mean “fore-rake” (the forward tilt) or another word?
examples.zh: 我在常见词典里找不到“forerake”——你是不是想写“fore-rake”（向前倾斜）或别的词？

definition.en: (As “fore rake,” technical) the forward tilt/slope of something, especially in design or nautical contexts (e.g., the forward-leaning angle of a mast or structure).
definition.zh: （作为“fore rake”，偏技术用法）某物向前的倾斜/斜度，常见于设计或航海语境（例如桅杆或结构向前倾的角度）。

examples.en: The mast has a slight fore rake to improve handling.
examples.zh: 桅杆有轻微的前倾角，以改善操控。

examples.en: Engineers adjusted the fore rake of the windshield for aerodynamics.
examples.zh: 工程师调整了挡风玻璃的前倾斜度，以提升空气动力表现。

extraExplanation:
“forerake”更像是把两个词写在一起（fore + rake），或是把别的常见短语/单词拼错了。你可以告诉我：
1）你看到它的句子原文；或
2）你想表达的中文意思。
我就能更准确判断你要找的是哪一个词（例如：for the record / forsake / take for granted 等）。

summary.en: “Foreran” is the past tense of “forerun,” meaning “happened earlier” or “was an early sign of something later.”
summary.zh: “foreran”是“forerun”的过去式，常表示“先于发生”或“作为后事的前兆/预示”。

definition.en: past tense of “forerun”: to happen before something else, or to be an early sign of something that will happen later
definition.zh: “forerun”的过去式：发生在……之前；（常指）作为……的先兆/预兆

examples.en: Small protests foreran the larger movement that came later.
examples.zh: 小规模的抗议先于后来更大的运动。

examples.en: His sudden silence foreran the bad news.
examples.zh: 他突然的沉默预示着坏消息。

definition.en: past tense of “forerun”: to run ahead of someone or something (less common, more literary)
definition.zh: “forerun”的过去式：（更少见/更文学）跑在……前面

examples.en: The scout foreran the caravan to check the road.
examples.zh: 侦察员跑在商队前面查看道路。

extraExplanation: “foreran”是动词“forerun”的不规则过去式（forerun → foreran → forerun）。在现代英语里更常见的用法是比喻义：表示“先兆/前兆、预示”。在新闻报道、历史写作、文学作品中更常见。
相关词：foretell（预言）、predict（预测）、precede（先于）、foreshadow（预示，尤用于文学/叙事）。

summary.en: Forerank means the front rank or a leading position; less commonly, it can mean to place someone in the front or among the leaders.
summary.zh: Forerank 指“前排/前列、领先地位”；较少见时也可作动词，表示“把……置于前列”。

definition.en: the front line or leading position in a group; the most important or advanced place
definition.zh: （队列或群体中的）前排、前列；领先或最重要的位置

examples.en: She quickly moved into the forerank of the debate team.
examples.zh: 她很快进入了辩论队的前列。

examples.en: The company is in the forerank of clean-energy research.
examples.zh: 这家公司在清洁能源研究领域处于前列。

definition.en: to place or position (someone or something) in the front rank; to put in a leading position
definition.zh: 使（某人/某事）处于前排或领先地位；把……置于前列

examples.en: The article foreranks her as a key voice in public health.
examples.zh: 这篇文章把她列为公共卫生领域的重要声音。

extraExplanation: “forerank”在现代英语里比较少见，更常见的表达是“front rank / forefront”。在写作中使用“forerank”会显得偏正式或带一点旧式（古典）语感。
词形上由“fore-”（在前）+“rank”（队列/等级）组成，意思直观：在队列的前面或在等级的前面。

summary.en: “Foreranks” means the front lines or leading positions—the vanguard of a group.
summary.zh: “foreranks”指前线或队伍最前列，即某群体的先锋。

definition.en: the front lines or leading positions of a group (originally in a military formation); the vanguard
definition.zh: （原指军队队列中的）前排、前线；（引申）先锋、最前列

examples.en: She rose quickly through the foreranks of the organization.
examples.zh: 她很快就在组织中进入了前列。

examples.en: Young activists were in the foreranks of the movement.
examples.zh: 年轻的行动者站在这场运动的最前线。

examples.en: In battle, the foreranks took the first impact.
examples.zh: 在战斗中，前排部队最先承受冲击。

extraExplanation: “foreranks”来自“fore-（在前）+ ranks（队列/排）”，最早多用于军事语境，指队伍最前面的几排。现代写作中也常作比喻，表示“领先群体、先锋人物”。
常见搭配：in the foreranks of…（在……的前列/先锋）。也可见拼写为“fore-ranks”。

summary.en: “forereach” is likely a misspelling of “for each” (every one). In programming, it’s often written as “foreach/forEach” meaning a loop over items.
summary.zh: “forereach”很可能是“for each”（每一个）的拼写错误。在编程中常写作“foreach/forEach”，表示对每个元素循环执行。

definition.en: For each; used to say that something happens separately to every person or thing in a group (often written as “for each”).
definition.zh: 对（群体中的）每一个；用于表示对每个人或每件事分别发生（常写作“for each”）。

examples.en: You get one ticket for each person.
examples.zh: 每个人各发一张票。

examples.en: Please write your name on each form—one form for each student.
examples.zh: 请在每张表上写名字——每位学生一张表。

definition.en: (Computing) A command/keyword in some programming languages meaning “do this once for every item in a list or collection.” Often written as “foreach” or “forEach.”
definition.zh: （计算机）某些编程语言中的命令/关键字，表示“对列表或集合中的每个元素都执行一次”。常写作“foreach”或“forEach”。

examples.en: In JavaScript, you can use forEach to run a function on every item in an array.
