examples.zh: 在 JavaScript 里，你可以用 forEach 对数组中的每个元素执行一个函数。

examples.en: The program loops through the files and prints the name of each one (a foreach loop).
examples.zh: 程序遍历这些文件并打印每个文件名（foreach 循环）。

extraExplanation: “forereach”通常是拼写错误。日常英语里更常写成两词：for each。编程语境中常见合写/驼峰写法：foreach / forEach。
发音上更接近“for each”（/fɔr ˈitʃ/），中间会有轻微停顿；写成一个词并不改变读法。

summary.en: Forereaching means overambitious or going too far; in older usage it can also mean deceitfully trying to gain advantage.
summary.zh: forereaching 指“过于冒进/做得过头”；在较旧用法中也可指“用欺骗手段谋取不当利益”。

definition.en: Trying to get too much or go beyond what is reasonable; overambitious or excessive.
definition.zh: （企图）得到过多或做得过头的；过于野心勃勃的；过分的。

examples.en: The plan sounded forereaching, given our limited budget.
examples.zh: 考虑到我们有限的预算，这个计划听起来有点过于冒进。

examples.en: She worried that her expectations were forereaching and might disappoint the team.
examples.zh: 她担心自己的期望太高、太不切实际，可能会让团队失望。

definition.en: (Older/less common) Attempting to gain an unfair advantage by trickery; deceitful or scheming.
definition.zh: （较旧/较少见）企图用欺骗手段占便宜的；狡诈的；阴谋算计的。

examples.en: He was known for forereaching tactics in business deals.
examples.zh: 他因在生意交易中使用狡诈手段而出名。

examples.en: The story warns against forereaching advisers who promise quick success.
examples.zh: 这个故事告诫人们要提防那些承诺快速成功的狡猾顾问。

extraExplanation: “forereaching”来自较古老的动词“forereach”，现代英语里更常用的对应词是“overreaching / overambitious / excessive”。
在较早的英语用法中，“forereach”还可表示“用计谋占上风、骗过别人”，因此“forereaching”也能带有“狡诈、诡计多端”的含义。阅读古典文学或旧文献时更容易见到这一层意思。

summary.en: “Foreread” means to read something in advance; it’s rare today and often replaced by “pre-read” or “read ahead.”
summary.zh: “foreread”意为“预先阅读”；现代用法较少，常用“pre-read”或“read ahead”替代。

definition.en: to read (something) in advance; to pre-read.
definition.zh: 预先阅读；提前读（某内容）。

examples.en: Please foreread the article before class so we can discuss it.
examples.zh: 请在上课前预先阅读这篇文章，这样我们就能讨论了。

examples.en: I foreread the meeting notes to save time later.
examples.zh: 我提前读了会议记录，方便之后节省时间。

definition.en: (rare/old-fashioned) to learn or predict in advance by reading signs, texts, or evidence.
definition.zh: （罕见/较旧用法）通过阅读迹象、文字或证据而预先得知；预判。

examples.en: Some claimed they could foreread the future in the stars.
examples.zh: 有人声称他们能从星象中预判未来。

extraExplanation: “foreread”在现代英语中很少见，日常更常用“pre-read / read ahead / read in advance”。在学术或课堂语境里，用“pre-read”最自然。
词缀“fore-”表示“在前、预先”（如“foresee, foretell”）。因此“foreread”字面意思就是“提前阅读”。

summary.en: Forereading means reading you do in advance to prepare for a lesson or main text.
summary.zh: forereading 指为课堂或主要文本做准备的提前阅读（预习阅读）。

definition.en: reading that you do before a class, lesson, discussion, or another main reading in order to prepare and understand the topic better
definition.zh: 课前阅读；预习阅读（在上课、讨论或主要阅读之前先读，用来做准备、帮助理解）

examples.en: Please finish the forereading before Monday’s seminar.
examples.zh: 请在周一的研讨课前完成预习阅读。

examples.en: The teacher assigned a short forereading to introduce the historical background.
examples.zh: 老师布置了一段简短的预习阅读来介绍历史背景。

examples.en: Doing the forereading made the article much easier to follow.
examples.zh: 做完预习阅读后，那篇文章更容易读懂了。

extraExplanation: “forereading”在日常英语里不算特别常见，更常见的说法是“pre-reading”或“assigned reading (before class)”。在教育场景（课程大纲、教学材料）中你可能会看到它，用来强调“在主要学习活动之前的阅读”。

summary.en: “Forerecited” means “mentioned or cited earlier,” especially in formal or legal writing.
summary.zh: “forerecited”意为“前文提及/引用过的”，多用于正式或法律语境。

definition.en: (Formal, archaic) mentioned or cited earlier; previously stated in the same document or discussion.
definition.zh: （正式、古旧）前文提及的；先前引用/陈述过的（常见于法律或正式文件）。

examples.en: The forerecited cases support the court’s conclusion.
examples.zh: 前文所引的判例支持法院的结论。

examples.en: As in the forerecited paragraph, the parties agreed to settle.
examples.zh: 如前文所述段落所示，双方同意和解。

extraExplanation: “forerecited”多见于较旧的法律文书或非常正式的写作中，相当于现代更常用的“aforementioned / previously mentioned / cited above”。
构词上可理解为：fore-（在前）+ recited（陈述/引用过的），意思就是“前面已经陈述过的”。

summary.en: “Forereckon” means to predict or anticipate something in advance (a rare, old-fashioned word).
summary.zh: “forereckon”指事先预料/预测（较少见、略显旧式的用词）。

definition.en: to predict or guess what will happen in the future, especially based on what you know now
definition.zh: 预料；预测（尤指根据现有信息作出判断）

examples.en: I didn’t forereckon how expensive the trip would be.
examples.zh: 我没预料到这趟旅行会这么贵。

examples.en: She forereckoned that the meeting would run late.
examples.zh: 她预料会议会拖到很晚。

extraExplanation: “forereckon”是较少见的词，更常见的表达是“foresee / predict / anticipate / reckon”。在现代英语里，你可能更多在旧文本、方言色彩较重的写法，或强调“事先估算/预判”的语境中见到它。
词形上可拆为“fore-（在前、预先）+ reckon（估算/认为）”。其中“reckon”在英式和口语里常有“认为、估计”的意思，所以“forereckon”带有“提前估计/预判”的感觉。

summary.en: “Forerehearsed” means rehearsed beforehand; prepared in advance.
summary.zh: “forerehearsed”意为“事先排练/准备好的”。

definition.en: Rehearsed in advance; prepared ahead of time so it can be performed or said smoothly.
definition.zh: 预先排练过的；事先准备好的（因此说/做起来很顺）。

examples.en: Her apology sounded forerehearsed, as if she had practiced it in front of a mirror.
examples.zh: 她的道歉听起来像是预先排练过的，好像对着镜子练过一样。

examples.en: The team delivered a forerehearsed presentation with almost no pauses.
examples.zh: 团队做了一场事先排练好的展示，几乎没有停顿。

extraExplanation: “forerehearsed”可理解为“fore-（在前、预先）+ rehearsed（排练过的）”。在现代英语里更常见的说法是“pre-rehearsed”或“well-rehearsed”。
这个词带有一点文学/古典气息，偶尔出现在较正式或带修辞感的写作中，用来强调“提前准备、像背过稿一样”。有时也带轻微的负面暗示：听起来不够真诚、太“做作”。

summary.en: Foreremembered is a rare, archaic form meaning “remembered beforehand.”
summary.zh: foreremembered 是罕见的古语形式，意思是“事先记住/预先牢记”。

definition.en: (Rare/archaic) to remember beforehand; to keep something in mind in advance.
definition.zh: （罕见/古语）预先记住；事先牢记。

examples.en: Please foreremember to bring your passport on the day of travel.
examples.zh: 请事先牢记出行当天要带护照。

examples.en: In old writings, a narrator may foreremember a promise before it is tested.
examples.zh: 在一些旧体作品中，叙述者可能会在承诺经受考验之前就先把它牢记在心。

extraExplanation: “foreremembered”通常是动词“foreremember”的过去式/过去分词，但它在现代英语中几乎不用，更常见的表达是“remember beforehand / keep in mind / bear in mind / anticipate”。
构词上由前缀“fore-”（表示“在……之前”）+“remember”组成，语感偏文学或仿古。写作中若不是刻意追求古风，建议用更常用的现代说法以避免读者困惑。

summary.en: Forereport is a rare, archaic word meaning to announce or predict something beforehand, or an advance report.
summary.zh: Forereport 是一个罕见的古语词，指“预先报告/预言”，也可指“提前的报告”。

definition.en: (archaic) To report, announce, or predict something in advance; to foretell.
definition.zh: （古语）预先报告、预先宣告或预言；预示。

examples.en: Old chronicles sometimes forereport disasters before they happen.
examples.zh: 古老的编年史有时会在灾难发生前就加以预示。

examples.en: The omen was said to forereport the king’s downfall.
examples.zh: 据说那个征兆预示了国王的覆灭。

definition.en: (rare) An advance report or early announcement.
definition.zh: （罕见）预先的报告；提前的通告。

examples.en: They received a brief forereport of the ship’s arrival.
examples.zh: 他们收到了一份关于船只到港的简短预先通告。

extraExplanation: “forereport”是由前缀“fore-”（表示“在前、预先”）+“report”构成的较少见/偏古典的词。现代英语更常用“foretell / predict / foreshadow（预示）”或“report in advance（提前报告）”。
在文学或宗教/古文语境中，你可能会看到它用来表达“征兆/预言提前宣告某事将发生”的感觉，语气比普通的“predict”更带“预示、宣告”的色彩。

summary.en: A rare term meaning a request made in advance (or to request in advance).
summary.zh: 一个罕见词，表示“提前提出的请求”（或“提前请求”）。

definition.en: (Rare/old-fashioned) A request made in advance; an advance request.
definition.zh: （罕见/较旧用法）预先提出的请求；提前请求。

examples.en: Please send a forerequest if you need special seating.
examples.zh: 如果你需要特殊座位，请提前提出请求。

examples.en: The hotel noted her forerequest for a quiet room.
examples.zh: 酒店记录了她提前提出的“要安静房间”的请求。

definition.en: (Rare) To request something in advance.
definition.zh: （罕见）提前请求；预先提出请求。

examples.en: Guests may forerequest a late checkout.
examples.zh: 客人可以提前申请延迟退房。

extraExplanation: “forerequest”更常见的写法是带连字符的“fore-request”，但在现代英语里非常少见。日常表达通常用“request in advance / make an advance request / pre-request（较少见）”。
词素提示：fore- 表示“在前、预先”（如 foresee 预见；forewarn 预先警告），request 表示“请求”。把两者合在一起就是“预先请求”。

summary.en: “Forerevelation” is a rare, nonstandard word meaning an advance revelation or early disclosure.
summary.zh: “forerevelation”是罕见的非标准用法，大意是“提前的揭示/预先披露”。

definition.en: (Rare / nonstandard) A revelation or disclosure that happens beforehand; an advance unveiling of information.
definition.zh: （罕见/非标准用法）提前发生的启示或揭示；对信息的预先公开。

examples.en: In the story, the prophecy acts like a forerevelation of the hero’s fate.
examples.zh: 在故事里，这个预言就像对英雄命运的提前揭示。

examples.en: The author uses dreams as a kind of forerevelation, hinting at the ending.
examples.zh: 作者把梦当作一种预先揭示，用来暗示结局。

extraExplanation: “forerevelation”不是常见标准词，更像由前缀 fore-（“预先、在前”）+ revelation（“揭示、启示”）临时组合出来的造词。正式写作里通常不用。
更自然、常用的替代表达有：premonition（预感）、foreshadowing（伏笔/预示）、forewarning（预警）、advance revelation/disclosure（提前披露）。如果你是在写小说或诗歌，这种造词可以用来制造“命运提前被揭开”的文学感。

summary.en: Forerib means a front rib, especially a traditional cooking term for a cut of meat from the front ribs (often beef).
summary.zh: forerib 指前肋（靠近胸部的肋骨），在烹饪中常指取自动物前肋部位（常见为牛肉）的一块肉。

definition.en: a front rib (one of the ribs nearer the chest); in cooking, a cut of meat from the front ribs of an animal
definition.zh: 前肋（靠近胸部的肋骨）；（烹饪）取自动物前肋部位的一块肉/肉排

examples.en: The butcher recommended forerib for a slow roast because it stays tender.
examples.zh: 肉铺老板推荐用前肋肉慢烤，因为口感更嫩。

examples.en: In older cookbooks, “forerib” often refers to a roast cut from the front ribs of beef.
examples.zh: 在较早的食谱里，“forerib”常指牛的前肋部位烤肉。

extraExplanation: “forerib”多见于英式/传统烹饪语境，尤其是牛肉分割名称中。不同国家与屠宰分切体系（英式、美式）对部位命名不完全一致：在美式语境里更常见的是“rib roast / prime rib / standing rib roast”等说法。
词形上由“fore-（前面的）+ rib（肋骨）”组成；也可写作“fore rib”。如果你是在菜单或食谱中看到它，通常指可烤、可炖的前肋部位肉。

summary.en: Foreribs means the front/upper ribs, used in anatomy or as a meat cut.
summary.zh: foreribs 指前（上）肋：可用于解剖学语境，也可指动物前段肋排肉。

definition.en: The upper part of the ribs in the chest (used especially in anatomy/medicine).
definition.zh: 前（上）肋；上部肋骨（多用于解剖学/医学语境）。

examples.en: The injury affected the patient’s foreribs and sternum.
examples.zh: 这次受伤影响到了病人的前肋和胸骨。

examples.en: Pain in the foreribs can come from muscle strain or bruising.
examples.zh: 前肋疼痛可能来自肌肉拉伤或挫伤。

definition.en: (In butchery/cooking) The front ribs of an animal, often cut as meat.
definition.zh: （屠宰/烹饪）动物的前肋排；前段肋骨肉。

examples.en: The recipe calls for beef foreribs cooked slowly until tender.
examples.zh: 这道菜谱需要用牛前肋，小火慢炖至软烂。

examples.en: Foreribs are usually fattier and fuller of flavor than some other cuts.
examples.zh: 前肋通常更肥一些，风味也更浓。

extraExplanation: “foreribs”由“fore-（前面的）+ ribs（肋骨）”构成，属于较少见的词，常见于专业语境（医学解剖、屠宰分割）。日常英语里，人们更常说“upper ribs / front ribs”或直接说“ribs”。
在英文肉类分割里，不同地区叫法可能不同；点餐或买肉时更常见的是“short ribs（牛小排/排骨）”“spare ribs（猪肋排）”“baby back ribs（小排/背排）”等。

summary.en: Fore rigging is the ship’s rigging associated with the foremast, used to support and control it.
summary.zh: Fore rigging 指与船的前桅相关、用于支撑和操控前桅的索具。

definition.en: (Nautical) The ropes, wires, and fittings that support and control the foremast (the mast near the front of a ship).
definition.zh: （航海）前桅索具：用于支撑与操控前桅（船前部的桅杆）的绳索、钢索与配件。

examples.en: The sailors inspected the fore rigging before setting sail.
examples.zh: 水手们在启航前检查了前桅索具。

examples.en: A sudden gust strained the fore rigging, so they tightened the lines.
examples.zh: 一阵突如其来的强风拉紧了前桅索具，所以他们把缆绳收紧。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“forerigging”更常见的拼写是 **fore rigging**（分开写），也可写作 **fore-rigging**（用连字符）。这是比较专业的航海词汇，常出现在海事记录、航海小说或历史文献中。
在传统帆船语境里，**rigging**（索具）可分为 **standing rigging**（固定索具，用于支撑桅杆）和 **running rigging**（活动索具，用于操作帆）。fore rigging通常指与前桅相关的那部分索具。

summary.en: Foreright means direct and honest in speech or manner.
summary.zh: foreright 表示说话或态度直接坦诚、直率。

definition.en: Direct and honest; saying what you think clearly without trying to hide it.
definition.zh: 直率的；坦诚的；直言不讳的。

examples.en: She was foreright about the problems in the plan.
examples.zh: 她对计划中的问题直言不讳。

examples.en: I appreciate your foreright answer—now we can fix it.
examples.zh: 我很感谢你坦率的回答——现在我们可以解决了。

examples.en: Try to be foreright but respectful when giving feedback.
examples.zh: 给反馈时尽量坦率，但要保持尊重。

extraExplanation: “foreright”较少见，更常用的拼写是“forthright”（意思几乎相同：直率、坦诚）。
构词上可理解为“fore-（向前）+ right（正直）”，表达“正直地、直面地说”。在正式写作中，建议优先使用更常见的“forthright”，以避免读者误以为是拼写错误。

summary.en: Foreroom means a forward room/compartment on a ship.
summary.zh: foreroom 指船只前部的房间或舱室（前舱）。

definition.en: a room or compartment at the front (forward part) of a ship or boat; a forward room
definition.zh: （船上的）前舱；前部的房间/舱室

examples.en: The crew stored extra ropes in the foreroom.
examples.zh: 船员把备用的绳索存放在前舱里。

examples.en: We were told not to enter the foreroom during the voyage.
examples.zh: 航行期间我们被告知不要进入前舱。

extraExplanation: “foreroom”多见于航海/船舶语境，日常英语里更常写作 two words：fore room（前部房间）或用更具体的词：forecabin（前舱）、forward compartment（前部舱室）。
前缀 fore- 表示“前面的、在前方的”（如 forehead 额头、forecast 预测）。

summary.en: A high, small square sail on the foremast of an old-style sailing ship, set above the fore-topgallant.
summary.zh: 老式方帆船前桅上最高层之一的小方帆，位于前上桅帆之上。

definition.en: (Nautical) A square sail set above the fore-topgallant sail on the foremast of a traditional sailing ship; also called the fore-royal sail.
definition.zh: （航海）传统帆船前桅上、位于前上桅帆（fore-topgallant）之上的一面方帆；也叫前桅皇家帆（fore-royal sail）。

examples.en: As the wind freshened, the crew decided not to set the fore-royal.
examples.zh: 风势变强后，船员决定不升前桅皇家帆。

examples.en: In old sea stories, the fore-royal often appears as a symbol of pressing on in fair weather.
examples.zh: 在老海洋故事里，前桅皇家帆常被写作顺风时继续前行的象征。

extraExplanation: “fore-royal”属于老式方帆船的帆具层级之一：从下到上常见为 fore course（前桅下帆）→ fore topsail（前桅上帆）→ fore topgallant（前桅上桅帆）→ fore royal（前桅皇家帆）。越靠上的帆越小、越依赖稳定风况，风大时通常不会升得太高。
拼写上常见为 fore-royal（带连字符）或 fore royal（分开写）。它主要出现在航海史、海洋文学或模型帆船/帆装介绍中，现代船只日常英语里较少见。

summary.en: Forerun means to come before something, often as a sign that it will happen later.
summary.zh: forerun 指某事先发生，常带有“预示后续将发生”的含义。

definition.en: To happen before something else; to come earlier in time and show what will happen later.
definition.zh: 在某事之前发生；先出现并预示后续会发生的事。

examples.en: Small arguments can forerun bigger problems if they are ignored.
examples.zh: 如果小争吵被忽视，可能会先于并预示更大的问题。

examples.en: The dark clouds foreran the storm.
examples.zh: 乌云先出现，预示着暴风雨将来。

definition.en: To run or go before; to precede as a guide or scout (less common).
definition.zh: （较少用）在前面跑/走；先行带路或探路。

examples.en: A messenger foreran the group to prepare the way.
examples.zh: 一名信使先行，为队伍做准备。

extraExplanation: “forerun”较偏书面或旧式，用来表达“先发生并预示”的感觉。日常英语里更常用“precede”（先于）或“foreshadow”（预示）。
词形上可联想：fore-（在前）+ run（跑），字面就是“在前面跑”。常见相关名词是“forerunner”（先驱；前兆）。

summary.en: A forerunner is someone or something that comes earlier and points to or prepares for what comes later.
summary.zh: forerunner 指在时间上更早出现、预示或为后来者铺路的“先驱/前导者”，也可指“前兆”。

definition.en: A person or thing that comes before another and prepares the way; an earlier sign or example of what will come later.
definition.zh: 先驱；前导者（或事物）；预兆：在时间上先出现，并为后来的事物铺路的人或事物。

examples.en: The first smartphones were forerunners of today’s powerful mobile devices.
examples.zh: 最早的智能手机是如今强大移动设备的先驱。

examples.en: Dark clouds can be a forerunner of a storm.
examples.zh: 乌云可能是暴风雨来临的前兆。

definition.en: A person who goes ahead to announce, guide, or prepare for someone’s arrival (often in religious or historical contexts).
definition.zh: （常用于宗教或历史语境）先行者；开路者：先到前方通报、引导或为重要人物到来做准备的人。

examples.en: In the New Testament, John the Baptist is described as a forerunner of Jesus.
examples.zh: 在《新约》中，施洗约翰被描述为耶稣的先行者。

examples.en: Messengers rode as forerunners to prepare the town for the king’s visit.
examples.zh: 信使作为先行者骑马赶去，为国王来访做准备。

extraExplanation: 词源上，forerunner字面意思是“跑在前面的人/事物”。现代英语中既可指“科技或思想上的先驱”，也常指“某事即将发生的预兆”。
常见搭配：a forerunner of/to…（……的先驱/前兆）。注意与pioneer（开拓者）相比，forerunner更强调“在时间上更早、预示或引出后来者”。

summary.en: Forerunners are pioneers or early signs that come before and lead to something later.
summary.zh: forerunners指走在前面并为后续铺路的先驱者，或某事发生前出现的征兆。

definition.en: People or things that come earlier and prepare the way for what follows; pioneers or early signs of something.
definition.zh: 先驱者；前驱；（某事发生的）先兆、前兆。

examples.en: These early scientists were the forerunners of modern medicine.
examples.zh: 这些早期科学家是现代医学的先驱。

examples.en: Dark clouds can be forerunners of a storm.
examples.zh: 乌云可能是暴风雨的前兆。

extraExplanation: “forerunners”是“forerunner”的复数，词源上可理解为“跑在前面的人”（fore- + runner）。因此既可指“开路的先驱”，也可指“事情发生前的迹象/征兆”。
常见近义表达：pioneers（先驱，强调开创性）、precursors（前身/先兆，更正式）、harbingers（预兆，常用于较强烈或重要的事件，如war, change）。
在文学和历史写作里，forerunners常用来强调“后来成就并非凭空出现”，而是由早期人物、思想或现象铺垫出来的。

summary.en: Forerunnership means the state or role of being a forerunner—someone or something that comes first and helps shape what follows.
summary.zh: Forerunnership 指“作为先驱/前导者的状态或角色”，强调走在前面并影响后续发展。

definition.en: the role, status, or quality of being a forerunner (someone or something that comes before and helps prepare the way for what follows)
definition.zh: “先驱/前导者”的身份、地位或特质；指走在前面、为后来者铺路的状态

examples.en: Her research showed real forerunnership, pointing the field toward new methods.
examples.zh: 她的研究体现了真正的先驱性，把这个领域引向了新的方法。

examples.en: The early community’s forerunnership made later reforms possible.
examples.zh: 早期社群的先驱作用使后来的改革成为可能。

extraExplanation: 这个词在现代英语里很少见，更常用的表达是 forerunner（先驱/前身）、pioneering work（开创性工作）、trailblazing（开路先锋的）或 leadership（领导力）。
词缀 -ship 常表示“身份/地位/状态/技能”（如 friendship 友谊、leadership 领导力），所以 forerunnership 字面意思就是“作为先驱的身份/状态”。在写作中用它，会显得偏学术或刻意，可根据语境改用更常见的替代说法。

summary.en: Forerunning means happening or coming earlier as a sign of what will follow.
summary.zh: forerunning 指“先行的、预示性的”，表示某事先出现并暗示后续发展。

definition.en: Going before something else; happening earlier as a sign or signal of what will come later.
definition.zh: 先行的；预示性的；作为征兆先出现的。

examples.en: The small protests were a forerunning sign of larger changes.
examples.zh: 这些小规模抗议是更大变化的先行征兆。

examples.en: In the novel, a forerunning storm hints that trouble is coming.
examples.zh: 在小说中，一场先行的暴风雨暗示麻烦即将到来。

definition.en: (Less common) The act of going before; preceding.
definition.zh: （较少见）先行；在前；先于……发生。

examples.en: The forerunning of the ceremony was marked by a brief announcement.
examples.zh: 仪式开始前的先行部分以一则简短公告作为标志。

extraExplanation: “forerunning”由“fore-（在前）+ run（跑、进行）”构成，含义接近“preceding（先于）”或“predictive（预示性的）”。在现代英语里更常见的是形容词或连字符形式“fore-running”，有时也会被更常用的词替代，如“early warning / preliminary / harbinger”。
在宗教或文学语境中，“forerunner（前驱者、先行者）”更常见，例如“John the Baptist as the forerunner（施洗约翰作为先行者）”，对应“为……铺路的人/事”。

summary.en: “Forerunnings” means early signs or events that suggest something is about to happen.
summary.zh: “forerunnings”指预示某事将发生的早期迹象或事件（前兆）。

definition.en: early signs or events that happen before something else and suggest it is coming; preliminary indications (plural form, somewhat uncommon).
definition.zh: 先兆；前兆；预示某事将发生的早期迹象或事件（复数形式，用法较少见）。

examples.en: The sudden rise in prices was one of the forerunnings of a larger economic crisis.
examples.zh: 物价的突然上涨是更大经济危机来临的先兆之一。

examples.en: In the novel, small acts of kindness are the forerunnings of the characters’ later reconciliation.
examples.zh: 在小说中，一些小小的善意举动预示着人物后来会和解。

extraExplanation: “forerunnings”较少单独作为词条出现，更常见的是单数“forerunning”（作名词或形容词）或“forerunner”（先驱、前导者）。在现代英语里，如果你想表达“前兆/预兆”，更自然的说法通常是“signs,” “early signs,” “indications,” 或 “warnings”。
词源上与“run”有关：forerunner 原意是“跑在前面的人”，引申为“先驱/预告者”。在宗教或文学语境中，forerunner 有时指“为重要人物或事件铺路的人”。

summary.en: “Foreruns” means “comes before,” often as a sign or foreshadowing of what will happen next.
summary.zh: “foreruns”表示“先于……发生”，常带“预示/预兆”的意味。

definition.en: (Third-person singular of “forerun”) to come before something, especially as a sign that it will happen later; to foreshadow.
definition.zh: （forerun 的第三人称单数）先于某事发生，尤指作为将要发生之事的预兆；预示、预兆。

examples.en: A sudden calm often foreruns the storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨来临前常常会先出现一阵突然的平静。

examples.en: In the novel, small acts of cruelty forerun the larger tragedy.
examples.zh: 在小说里，一些小小的残忍行为预示着更大的悲剧。

definition.en: (Less common) to happen earlier than something; to precede in time.
definition.zh: （较少见）在时间上先于某事发生；早于。

examples.en: Winter’s first frost foreruns the heavy snows.
examples.zh: 冬天的第一场霜冻先于大雪到来。

examples.en: Her early successes forerun a long career.
examples.zh: 她早期的成功早于并开启了漫长的职业生涯。

extraExplanation: “forerun/foreruns”更偏书面、文学或较正式的表达，日常口语里常用“precede”“come before”“foreshadow”“be a sign of”来替换。
词根思路：fore-（在前）+ run（跑）→“跑在前面”，引申为“先行、预示”。

summary.en: “fores” usually means the front parts (plural of “fore”); in rare old usage it can be the verb form meaning “precedes.”
summary.zh: “fores”通常是“fore”的复数，指“前部/前方的部分”；在少见的旧式用法中也可作动词形式，表示“先于”。

definition.en: the front part of something; the parts or people at the front
definition.zh: 前部；前方（的部分或人）

examples.en: Keep the heavier items in the fores of the boat to balance it.
examples.zh: 把较重的物品放在船的前部来保持平衡。

examples.en: The dancers in the fores of the stage stepped forward first.
examples.zh: 在舞台前方的舞者先向前迈步。

definition.en: (nautical) the forward part of a ship, especially the front area or structures
definition.zh: （航海）船首；船的前部（尤指前方区域或结构）

examples.en: Spray hit the fores as the ship cut through the waves.
examples.zh: 船破浪前进时，浪花拍打着船首。

examples.en: They stored ropes near the fores for quick access.
examples.zh: 他们把绳索放在船首附近，方便取用。

definition.en: (rare) third-person singular form of “fore” meaning to come before or precede
definition.zh: （罕见）动词 fore 的第三人称单数：在……之前；先于

examples.en: In old texts, the prologue often fores the main story.
examples.zh: 在旧文本里，序言常常先于正文故事出现。

extraExplanation: “fores”更常见是名词“fore”的复数形式，表示“前部/前方”。日常英语里更常用的说法是 the front (of …)、the bow (of a ship)。
注意不要和高尔夫球场上的喊声“Fore!”混淆：那是提醒前方有人小心来球的感叹词，不是名词复数“fores”。

summary.en: The front part of a saddle, especially a pack-saddle.
summary.zh: 鞍的前部（尤指驮鞍的前部）。

definition.en: the front part of a saddle (especially a pack-saddle), near the horse’s withers and the saddle’s front arch
definition.zh: （尤指驮鞍的）鞍前部；靠近马的鬐甲处、鞍的前拱处

examples.en: The straps were tightened at the foresaddle to keep the load from sliding back.
examples.zh: 他们把鞍前部的带子收紧，以免货物向后滑。

examples.en: He checked the foresaddle for rubbing before starting the long ride.
examples.zh: 长途出发前，他检查鞍前部是否会磨伤马。

extraExplanation: “foresaddle”属于较少见、偏传统的马具词汇，常见于旧式骑乘、驮运或历史文本中。现代日常英语里人们更常说“the front of the saddle（鞍的前部）”，或在某些语境下用“pommel（鞍头/鞍桥前端）”来指更具体的部位，但两者不总是完全等同。

summary.en: “Foresaid” is a formal adjective meaning “mentioned earlier (in this document).”
summary.zh: “foresaid”是正式用语，表示“本文/同一文件中前面提到的（前述的）”。

definition.en: (Formal/legal) mentioned earlier in the same document or text; said before.
definition.zh: （正式/法律用语）前述的；在同一文件或文章中先前提到的。

examples.en: The aforesaid agreement shall remain in effect for one year.
examples.zh: 上述协议有效期为一年。

examples.en: Payment must be made under the terms of the aforesaid contract.
examples.zh: 付款必须依照前述合同条款进行。

examples.en: The court referred to the aforesaid evidence.
examples.zh: 法院提及了前述证据。

extraExplanation: “foresaid”常见于法律文件、合同、规章、判决书等正式文本，用来避免重复写出同一个人名、条款或事项。日常口语里很少用，更常用“mentioned earlier / above / previously mentioned”。
相关近义表达：aforesaid（更常见的法律用语）、above-mentioned、previously mentioned。反义表达可用“following / below-mentioned”（后述的）。
词源提示：fore- 表示“在前”，said 是 say 的过去分词，合起来就是“先前说过的”。

summary.en: A sail on the foremast, near the front of a sailing ship.
summary.zh: 帆船前桅上的帆（靠近船头的帆）。

definition.en: A sail set on the foremast (the mast closest to the front of a sailing ship), used to help drive and balance the ship.
definition.zh: （帆船）前桅上的帆；装在最靠近船头的桅杆上的帆，用来提供动力并帮助船只保持平衡。

examples.en: As the wind picked up, the crew reefed the foresail to keep the ship steady.
examples.zh: 风变大后，船员把前帆收小（打缩帆）来让船更稳。

examples.en: The captain ordered the foresail hoisted before dawn.
examples.zh: 船长下令在黎明前升起前帆。

extraExplanation: “fore-”表示“前面的、在前方的”（如 foredeck 前甲板、foremast 前桅）。因此 foresail 字面就是“前面的帆”。在不同船型与年代，前帆的具体名称/组合可能不同，但核心概念都是“位于前桅的帆”。
航海文学（如梅尔维尔《白鲸》、帕特里克·奥布莱恩的航海小说）常用这类词来营造海上氛围；读到 foresail、mizzen（后桅帆）、jib（前纵帆）等时，可以把它们当作“帆位/帆型”的术语来理解。

summary.en: “Foresails” are the sails on a ship’s foremast (front mast).
summary.zh: “Foresails”指帆船前桅（最前面桅杆）上的帆。

definition.en: Sails set on the foremast (the front mast) of a sailing ship; plural of “foresail.”
definition.zh: （帆船上）前桅（最前面的桅杆）所挂的帆；“foresail”的复数。

examples.en: The crew raised the foresails to catch the morning wind.
examples.zh: 船员升起前桅帆来迎接清晨的风。

examples.en: In rough weather, they reefed the foresails to reduce speed.
examples.zh: 在恶劣天气里，他们收小（缩帆）前桅帆以降低航速。

extraExplanation: 在传统帆船结构里，foremast（前桅）通常位于最靠近船头的位置；因此 foresail 指“前桅上悬挂的帆”。不同船型可能有多张前桅帆（例如前桅横帆/纵帆的不同组合），所以常见复数 foresails。
相关航海动词：raise/hoist（升帆）、reef（缩帆/收小以应对大风）、set (the sails)（张帆）。这些词常和 foresails 一起出现。

summary.en: “Foresaw” means “knew or anticipated in advance” (past tense of foresee).
summary.zh: “foresaw”意为“预见/预知（提前知道或料到）”，是foresee的过去式。

definition.en: Past tense of “foresee”: to know or correctly guess that something will happen in the future.
definition.zh: “foresee”的过去式：预见；预知（未来将会发生某事）。

examples.en: She foresaw trouble if they didn’t change their plan.
examples.zh: 她预见到如果他们不改变计划，就会有麻烦。

examples.en: No one foresaw how quickly the technology would spread.
examples.zh: 没人预见到这项技术会传播得这么快。

definition.en: (Formal) Past tense of “foresee”: to plan for something that might happen; to anticipate and prepare.
definition.zh: （较正式）“foresee”的过去式：预先考虑并为可能发生的情况做准备。

examples.en: The contract foresaw delays and included a backup schedule.
examples.zh: 合同预先考虑了延误，并包含了备用时间表。

examples.en: They foresaw the need for more staff during the holiday season.
examples.zh: 他们预先考虑到假期期间需要更多员工。

extraExplanation: “foresaw”是动词“foresee”的不规则过去式（foresee–foresaw–foreseen）。常见搭配：foresaw that + 从句；foresaw trouble/problems/risks。
语体上，“foresee”比“predict”更强调“提前看见并理解可能后果”，而不一定是基于数据的“预测”。法律或合同语境中常用来表示“条款已预设某种可能情况”。

summary.en: Foresay means to say beforehand or to predict something.
summary.zh: foresay 指“预先说出”或“预言、预告”。

definition.en: to say something in advance; to predict or foretell
definition.zh: 预先说出；预言；预告

examples.en: I can’t foresay what will happen next, but we should prepare.
examples.zh: 我无法预言接下来会发生什么，但我们应该做好准备。

examples.en: No one could have foresaid how quickly the city would change.
examples.zh: 没有人能预料这座城市会变化得这么快。

extraExplanation: “foresay”比较少见，带有较强的书面/古旧色彩。现代英语更常用“foretell / predict / foresee”。
形式上由“fore-”（在前、预先）+“say”（说）构成，字面意思就是“提前说”。

summary.en: “Foresaying” is a rare, old-fashioned word meaning a prediction or the act of foretelling.
summary.zh: “foresaying”是较罕见的古体词，意为“预言/预告”或“进行预言的行为”。

definition.en: (rare/archaic) The act of predicting; a statement that foretells the future; a prophecy.
definition.zh: （罕见/古体）预言；预告未来的话；预言之辞。

examples.en: In old stories, a wise woman’s foresaying often warns the hero of danger.
examples.zh: 在古老故事里，智者的预言常常警告英雄将有危险。

examples.en: His foresaying proved accurate when the storm arrived that night.
examples.zh: 当晚暴风雨真的来临时，他的预言被证明很准确。

definition.en: (rare/archaic) Predicting or foretelling (the present participle of “foresay”).
definition.zh: （罕见/古体）预言、预告（“foresay”的现在分词）。

examples.en: They spoke in riddles, foresaying a change in the kingdom.
examples.zh: 他们用谜语般的话语预告王国将有变故。

examples.en: The narrator is foresaying what will happen in the final chapter.
examples.zh: 叙述者正在预告最后一章将发生的事。

extraExplanation: “foresaying”在现代英语中很少用，更常见的表达是“prediction / foretelling / prophecy”（名词）以及“predict / foretell / prophesy”（动词）。
词根上可理解为 fore-（在前、预先）+ say（说），意思是“提前说出（将要发生的事）”。在文学或仿古风格写作中偶尔出现，用来营造古典、神秘的“预言”语气。

summary.en: “Foresays” is the third-person singular form of the rare verb “foresay,” meaning to predict or say in advance.
summary.zh: “foresays”是少见动词“foresay”的第三人称单数形式，意思是“预言/预告、事先说出”。

definition.en: to predict or foretell; to say in advance (rare/old-fashioned)
definition.zh: 预言；预告；事先说出（较少用/较古老）

examples.en: No one can truly foresay what will happen next year.
examples.zh: 没有人能真正预言明年会发生什么。

examples.en: The report did not foresay the sudden change in policy.
examples.zh: 这份报告并没有预告政策会突然改变。

extraExplanation: “foresays”通常是动词“foresay”的第三人称单数（he/she/it foresays）。这个词在现代英语里很少见，更常用的是“foresee / predict / foretell”。
构词上：fore-（在前）+ say（说），字面意思是“提前说”。在较正式或现代的表达中，你可以用：It is hard to foresee… / Experts predict… / The signs suggest…

summary.en: “forescene” is a rare theater word meaning the front part of the stage, closest to the audience.
summary.zh: “forescene”是很少见的戏剧用语，指舞台最前方、最靠近观众的区域。

definition.en: (theater, uncommon) The front part of a stage, closest to the audience; the area in front of the main scenery.
definition.zh: （戏剧用语，较少见）舞台最前方、最靠近观众的区域；主布景（景片）前面的表演空间。

examples.en: The actor stepped into the forescene to deliver a short speech directly to the audience.
examples.zh: 演员走到舞台前沿（forescene），直接对观众做了一段简短的讲话。

examples.en: Keep the props out of the forescene so the audience has a clear view.
examples.zh: 把道具移出舞台前沿（forescene），这样观众视线更清楚。

extraExplanation: “forescene”在现代英语里非常少见，更常见的写法是带连字符的“fore-scene”。在舞台术语中，它接近“stage apron（舞台前沿）/ downstage area（下舞台、靠近观众的区域）”。
如果你本来想写的是“foreseen”（动词 foresee 的过去分词/形容词，意为“预见到的”），那是另一个词：foreseen /fɔrˈsin/。你可以告诉我你的句子，我可以帮你确认到底要哪个词。

summary.en: “Forescent” is a rare/nonstandard form, usually a misspelling of “fluorescent,” meaning “glowing or emitting light.”
summary.zh: “forescent”是少见且不标准的写法，通常是把“fluorescent（荧光的/发光的）”拼错。

definition.en: (Nonstandard/rare spelling) glowing or giving off light; often used by mistake for “fluorescent.”
definition.zh: （非标准/少见拼写）发光的；常被误用来指“fluorescent（荧光的）”。

examples.en: The sign looked forescent in the dark, almost like it was lit from inside.
examples.zh: 那块招牌在黑暗里看起来像“forescent”一样发亮，仿佛从里面被点亮。

examples.en: If you mean a tube light, the usual word is “fluorescent,” not “forescent.”
examples.zh: 如果你指的是日光灯管，通常用“fluorescent”，而不是“forescent”。

extraExplanation:
“forescent”在现代英语里非常少见，多数情况下是把“fluorescent（荧光的）”拼错了。常见正确词：
- fluorescent：在紫外线等激发下发光；也常指“日光灯/荧光灯”。
- phosphorescent：吸收光后还能在黑暗中持续发光一段时间（夜光）。
另外，“florescent”才与“开花/花的”相关（源自拉丁语 flōr- “花”），也容易和 fluorescent 混淆。

summary.en: Preschool is education for young children before kindergarten; it can also describe things related to the pre-kindergarten age group.
summary.zh: preschool指孩子上幼儿园/学前教育（入学前的教育阶段）；也可作形容词表示“学龄前的”。

definition.en: A program or school for young children (usually ages 3–5) before they start kindergarten; it helps children learn basic social, language, and early academic skills through play and activities.
definition.zh: 学前班；幼儿园（通常指3–5岁、上小学前的教育项目或学校），通过游戏和活动培养社交、语言与基础学习能力。

examples.en: My daughter goes to preschool three mornings a week.
examples.zh: 我女儿每周上三个上午的学前班。

examples.en: Preschool teaches kids to share, take turns, and follow simple rules.
examples.zh: 学前教育会教孩子学会分享、轮流、遵守简单规则。

definition.en: Happening or existing before a child begins formal schooling (especially kindergarten or elementary school).
definition.zh: 学龄前的；入学前的（尤指上幼儿园大班/小学之前）。

examples.en: Preschool children often learn best through play.
examples.zh: 学龄前儿童通常通过游戏学得最好。

examples.en: The clinic offers preschool health checkups.
examples.zh: 这家诊所提供学龄前健康检查。

extraExplanation: 在美式英语里，preschool通常指“幼儿园/学前教育阶段”的统称；具体机构可能叫daycare（托儿所，更偏照看）、nursery school（较传统说法）、pre-K（学前班，通常指入学前一年，约4岁）。不同州/地区用法会有差异。

summary.en: Foreschooling means education and care for young children before kindergarten/primary school.
summary.zh: foreschooling 指孩子上幼儿园大班/学前班或小学之前的学前教育与照护。

definition.en: Education and care provided to young children (typically ages 3–5) before they start kindergarten or primary school.
definition.zh: 学前教育；为幼儿（通常3–5岁）在入读幼儿园大班/小学之前提供的教育与照护。

examples.en: Foreschooling can help children learn basic social skills like sharing and taking turns.
examples.zh: 学前教育可以帮助孩子学习分享、轮流等基本社交技能。

examples.en: Many families choose part-time foreschooling to ease the transition into kindergarten.
examples.zh: 很多家庭选择兼职学前教育，帮助孩子更顺利过渡到幼儿园大班/学前班。

extraExplanation: “Foreschooling”不是最常见的标准用词，日常英语里更常说“preschool education”“early childhood education (ECE)”“preschool”。如果你在文章或政策语境中看到“foreschooling”，通常指的就是“入学前阶段的教育/保育”。

summary.en: “Forescript” is a rare word meaning a preface/foreword, or (as a verb) to write something in advance.
summary.zh: “Forescript”是个罕用词，表示“前言/序言”，也可作动词表示“预先写下、提前准备”。

definition.en: (Rare) A piece of writing placed at the beginning of a document or book; a preface or foreword.
definition.zh: （罕用）放在文件或书籍开头的一段文字；序言、前言。

examples.en: The author added a short forescript to explain why she wrote the book.
examples.zh: 作者加了一段简短的前言，解释她为什么写这本书。

examples.en: In the forescript, he thanks his teachers and readers.
examples.zh: 在前言里，他感谢了自己的老师和读者。

definition.en: (Rare) To write or prepare something in advance; to plan beforehand in written form.
definition.zh: （罕用）预先写下；提前准备（以文字形式）安排。

examples.en: They forescripted the main points so the meeting would stay focused.
examples.zh: 他们提前写好要点，让会议保持聚焦。

examples.en: The speech was carefully forescripted before the event.
examples.zh: 这场演讲在活动前被仔细地预先写好。

extraExplanation: “forescript”在现代英语中非常少见，很多时候人们会用更常见的词：**foreword**（书的前言，通常由他人写）、**preface**（作者写的序言）、**introduction**（引言/导言）。
它也容易和 **postscript (P.S.)**（信件末尾的附言）形成对比：*fore-* 表示“在前”，*post-* 表示“在后”。
如果你在学术或出版语境想表达“前言/序言”，通常用 *preface/foreword* 会更自然。

summary.en: Foreseason means the period before a sports season starts, usually for training and warm-up games.
summary.zh: Foreseason 指赛季开始前的季前阶段，通常用于训练和热身赛。

definition.en: the period before a sports season begins, when teams train and play practice games
definition.zh: （体育）赛季开始前的时期；季前阶段（用于训练和热身赛）

examples.en: The team works on fitness during the foreseason.
examples.zh: 球队在季前阶段主要进行体能训练。

examples.en: Several foreseason games help new players learn the system.
examples.zh: 几场季前热身赛能帮助新球员熟悉战术体系。

definition.en: the early part of a season or the time leading up to the main season (less common, sometimes used outside sports)
definition.zh: （较少用）季节的前段；旺季到来之前的一段时间（有时也用于非体育语境）

examples.en: In the foreseason, the resort prepares staff for the busy months.
examples.zh: 在旺季来临前的这段时间，度假村会培训员工以应对繁忙月份。

extraExplanation: “fore-”表示“在……之前”（如 forecast 预报、forehead 前额），所以 foreseason 字面意思是“在赛季之前”。
在美式英语里，更常见的说法是 preseason；foreseason 更少见，但意思非常接近。

summary.en: Foreseat means the front seat, especially in an old carriage or wagon.
summary.zh: Foreseat 指前排座位，尤用于旧式马车或货车等语境。

definition.en: the front seat of a vehicle (especially an older carriage or wagon); by extension, the front seat in a car
definition.zh: （尤指旧式马车、货车的）前排座位；引申为汽车的前排座位

examples.en: The driver sat on the foreseat and held the reins.
examples.zh: 车夫坐在前排座位上，握着缰绳。

examples.en: She rode in the foreseat while her friends sat in the back.
examples.zh: 她坐在前排座位上，朋友们坐在后排。

extraExplanation: “foreseat”常写作“fore-seat”。其中 fore- 表示“前面的”，seat 表示“座位”。这个词在现代日常英语里不太常用，更常见的说法是“front seat”。
在文学或历史语境中（如描写马车、旧时旅行），用“foreseat”会更有年代感，也更贴合当时交通工具的结构。

summary.en: Foresee means to predict or expect something before it happens, often so you can prepare.
summary.zh: Foresee 指在事情发生之前预见或预料到它，常带有“提前想到、以便准备”的含义。

definition.en: to know or guess that something will happen in the future; to predict
definition.zh: 预见；预知；预测（将来会发生的事）

examples.en: No one could foresee how quickly the small problem would become a crisis.
examples.zh: 没人能预见这个小问题会这么快演变成危机。

examples.en: Economists try to foresee changes in the job market.
examples.zh: 经济学家努力预测就业市场的变化。

definition.en: to imagine or expect something as a possible future situation, often so you can prepare for it
definition.zh: 预先设想；预料（常含“为此做好准备”的意味）

examples.en: We didn’t foresee any major delays, so we didn’t build extra time into the schedule.
examples.zh: 我们没预料到会有严重延误，所以时间表里没有留出额外时间。

examples.en: It’s hard to foresee all the risks when you start a new project.
examples.zh: 开启新项目时很难预先设想所有风险。

extraExplanation: 词源提示：fore- 表示“在前、预先”，see 表示“看见”。合起来就是“提前看见/预见”。
用法上，foresee 常用于表示“难以预料”的结果（often with can/could: can’t foresee…），也常与名词 like consequences, problems, future, changes 搭配。
和 predict 的区别：predict 更像“基于数据/规律的预测”，foresee 更强调“预见到某事可能发生”（可基于经验、直觉或判断），语气更偏“提前想到”。
文学/常见表达：在较正式写作中会出现如 “It is difficult to foresee the consequences.”（很难预见后果）。

summary.en: Foreseeability means how predictable or reasonably expected something is, especially in legal and risk contexts.
summary.zh: Foreseeability 指某事在多大程度上可合理预测或预期，尤其常用于法律与风险语境。

definition.en: The quality of being able to be reasonably predicted or expected (often used in law and risk planning).
definition.zh: 可预见性；可合理预测或预期的程度（常用于法律与风险管理语境）。

examples.en: In negligence law, foreseeability helps decide whether the harm was predictable.
examples.zh: 在过失法中，“可预见性”有助于判断损害是否可预测。

examples.en: Good planning increases the foreseeability of costs and delays.
examples.zh: 良好的规划能提高成本与延误的可预见性。

extraExplanation: “foreseeability”常见于法律（尤其是侵权法/过失）中：如果某种伤害对“理性的人”而言是可预见的，责任更可能成立。日常语境中也用于项目管理、保险、风控等，表示“结果是否在预期范围内”。
词源上来自 fore-（预先）+ see（看见/预见）+ -ability（能力/性质），字面意思就是“能够提前看见的性质”。
相关常见搭配：reasonable foreseeability（合理可预见性）、lack of foreseeability（缺乏可预见性）、foreseeability of harm/risk（损害/风险的可预见性）。

summary.en: Foreseeable means likely to happen or be known about in advance, especially in the near future.
summary.zh: foreseeable 指“可预见的、可预测的”，常强调在近期内合理地能预料到。

definition.en: Able to be predicted or expected in the near future; not surprising.
definition.zh: 可预见的；可预测的；在不久的将来可能发生的（不令人意外）。

examples.en: There will be no pay increases for the foreseeable future.
examples.zh: 在可预见的将来，不会加薪。

examples.en: It was foreseeable that the project would run late without enough staff.
examples.zh: 如果人手不足，项目会延期是可以预见的。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：for the foreseeable future（在可预见的将来），用于表示“短期内看不到变化”。
foreseeable 常和责任/风险语境一起出现，例如法律或管理中说 a foreseeable risk（可预见的风险），意思是“合理的人可以预料到的风险”。

summary.en: “Foreseeably” means “as can be expected” or “in a predictable way.”
summary.zh: “foreseeably”表示“可预见地、可以预料地”。

definition.en: in a way that can be expected or predicted; as is likely to happen
definition.zh: 可预见地；可以预料地；按可能发生的情况来看

examples.en: Foreseeably, prices will rise if demand keeps increasing.
examples.zh: 可预见地，如果需求持续增加，价格就会上涨。

examples.en: The project will foreseeably take longer than two weeks.
examples.zh: 这个项目可预见地会比两周花更久。

examples.en: Foreseeably, she was upset after hearing the news.
examples.zh: 可预见地，她听到这个消息后很难过。

extraExplanation: “Foreseeably”常用于更正式的写作或新闻语体，表示“根据现有信息合理推断”。在口语中也常用“probably / likely / as expected”来表达类似意思。
它通常放在句首作评注（Foreseeably, ...），或放在情态动词后/句末（will foreseeably ... / ... foreseeably）。

summary.en: “Foreseeing” means predicting or anticipating something before it happens; it is the -ing form of “foresee.”
summary.zh: “foreseeing”表示“预见/预知；预期”，是动词“foresee”的-ing形式。

definition.en: to predict or know about something before it happens; to anticipate
definition.zh: 预见；预知（某事在发生之前）

examples.en: No one could have foreseen how quickly the situation would change.
examples.zh: 没人能预见局势会变化得这么快。

examples.en: She foresaw problems with the plan and suggested a safer option.
examples.zh: 她预见到这个计划会有问题，于是建议了一个更安全的方案。

definition.en: (present participle/gerund of “foresee”) used to describe an action of predicting the future
definition.zh: “foresee”的现在分词/动名词形式：表示正在进行或作为名词使用的“预见”行为

examples.en: Foreseeing the risk, they bought extra supplies.
examples.zh: 预见到风险后，他们多买了一些物资。

examples.en: Foreseeing is not the same as worrying; it’s about planning ahead.
examples.zh: 预见不同于担心；它强调的是提前规划。

extraExplanation: “foresee”由“fore-（在前）+ see（看见）”组成，字面意思是“提前看见”，常用于较正式的书面语（新闻、报告、学术写作）。
常见搭配：foresee + 名词（foresee problems/changes/consequences）；foresee + that 从句（foresee that prices will rise）。
近义词区别：predict（预测，偏结果/数据）、anticipate（预期/预计，常含提前准备）、foresee（预见，强调凭判断看到未来可能发生的事）。

summary.en: “Foreseeingly” means doing something with foresight—anticipating future events and planning ahead.
summary.zh: “foreseeingly”表示“有远见地、能预见未来地”，强调提前预判并做准备。

definition.en: In a way that shows you can predict or anticipate what will happen in the future; with foresight.
definition.zh: 以有远见的方式；能预见未来地；有先见之明地。

examples.en: She invested foreseeingly, choosing industries that later grew quickly.
examples.zh: 她有远见地进行投资，选择了后来快速增长的行业。

examples.en: Foreseeingly, the city expanded its subway lines before traffic became unbearable.
examples.zh: 这座城市很有先见之明地在交通变得难以忍受之前就扩建了地铁线路。

extraExplanation: “foreseeingly”比较少见，更常用的表达是“with foresight / prudently / in anticipation”。如果你想听起来更自然，写作里常把它改成短语：with foresight（有远见地）或 in anticipation of…（为应对……而提前）。

summary.en: Foreseen means “expected or known in advance,” and it’s also the past participle of foresee.
summary.zh: foreseen 意为“预见到的、事先预料的”，也可作 foresee 的过去分词。

definition.en: known about or expected before it happens; anticipated in advance.
definition.zh: 事先知道或预料到的；预见到的。

examples.en: The delays were foreseen, so we built extra time into the schedule.
examples.zh: 延误是预见到的，所以我们在计划里预留了额外时间。

examples.en: No one could have foreseen how quickly the situation would change.
examples.zh: 没人能预见局势会变化得这么快。

definition.en: the past participle form of “foresee,” used in perfect tenses or passive voice.
definition.zh: “foresee”的过去分词，用于完成时或被动语态。

examples.en: We have foreseen the risks and prepared a backup plan.
examples.zh: 我们已经预见到这些风险，并准备了备用方案。

examples.en: The problems were foreseen by the engineers early on.
examples.zh: 工程师们很早就预见到了这些问题。

extraExplanation: “foreseen”常见于较正式的书面语或报告中，尤其搭配：as foreseen（如所预料的）、foreseen risks（可预见的风险）、foreseen circumstances（可预见的情况）。日常口语里也常用 expected / anticipated 来表达相近意思。
拼写提示：foresee（预见）→ foresaw（过去式）→ foreseen（过去分词）。

summary.en: A foreseer is someone who predicts or foresees what will happen in the future.
summary.zh: foreseer 指能预见或预测未来将发生什么的人。

definition.en: A person who foresees (predicts) future events; a predictor or seer.
definition.zh: 预见者；能预知未来的人；预言者。

examples.en: In the story, the foreseer warns the king about a coming drought.
examples.zh: 在故事里，预见者警告国王即将到来的干旱。

examples.en: She wasn’t a foreseer—she just noticed patterns and planned ahead.
examples.zh: 她并不是预言者——她只是善于发现规律并提前规划。

extraExplanation: “foreseer”由“foresee（预见）+ -er（做……的人）”构成，语气上偏文学或较正式；日常英语里更常用“predictor（预测者）”“seer（先知/预言者）”或直接说“someone who can foresee the future（能预见未来的人）”。
在宗教或神秘语境里，“seer”更常见；在商业、科技语境里通常用“forecaster/analyst（预测员/分析师）”来表达更现实的“预测”。

summary.en: “Foreseers” means people who can foresee or predict the future (plural).
summary.zh: “foreseers”指能预见或预测未来的人（复数）。

definition.en: people who can foresee future events; predictors or visionaries (plural of “foreseer”)
definition.zh: 能预见未来的人；预言者、先见之明者（“foreseer”的复数）

examples.en: Some foreseers warned that the economy might slow down months before it happened.
examples.zh: 一些预见者在事情发生前几个月就警告经济可能会放缓。

examples.en: In old stories, foreseers often appear as wise figures who guide the hero.
examples.zh: 在古老故事里，预言者常以智者形象出现，引导英雄。

extraExplanation: “foreseers”是比较少见的词，更常见的说法是“seers”“prophets”（宗教/预言语境）或“predictors/forecasters”（更中性、现代、偏分析）。
构词：fore-（在前、预先）+ see（看见）+ -er（人）→ foreseer（预先看见的人）→ foreseers（复数）。
文学/叙事里“seer/foreseer”常带一点神秘或象征色彩；新闻/学术写作中通常会用更具体的角色词，比如“analysts”“experts”“trend watchers”。

summary.en: “foresees” means “predicts or anticipates what will happen,” or “plans for a future need.” It is the third-person singular form of “foresee.”
summary.zh: “foresees” 意为“预见/预料将发生的事”，也可指“为未来需要提前打算”。它是 “foresee” 的第三人称单数形式。

definition.en: to know or predict that something will happen in the future; to anticipate
definition.zh: 预见；预知（将来会发生某事）；预料

examples.en: She foresaw trouble if they rushed the decision.
examples.zh: 她预见到如果他们仓促做决定，可能会出问题。

examples.en: No one foresaw how quickly the technology would spread.
examples.zh: 没人预料到这项技术会传播得这么快。

definition.en: to see ahead or plan for a future need or situation
definition.zh: 预先看到并为未来的需要或情况做打算

examples.en: The designer foresaw the need for more storage and added extra shelves.
examples.zh: 设计师预先想到需要更多储物空间，于是加了额外的架子。

examples.en: We didn’t foresee having to work so late.
examples.zh: 我们没想到会工作到这么晚。

extraExplanation: “foresees” 是动词 “foresee” 的第三人称单数现在时（he/she/it foresees）。常见搭配：foresee + noun（foresee problems/changes），或 foresee + that 从句（foresee that prices will rise）。
语气上，“foresee” 比 “guess” 更正式、更强调基于经验或判断的预见；但它不保证一定准确。

summary.en: “Foreseeing” means having the ability to predict or plan for the future; “foreseing” is usually a misspelling.
summary.zh: “Foreseeing”表示“有预见性、能预测或提前规划未来”；“foreseing”通常是拼写错误。

definition.en: able to predict or plan for what will happen in the future; showing good judgment about future results
definition.zh: 有预见性的；能预测或提前为将来做打算的

examples.en: A foreseeing manager prepares a backup plan before problems happen.
examples.zh: 有预见性的经理会在问题发生前准备好备用方案。

examples.en: With foreseeing thinking, the company invested early and grew fast.
examples.zh: 凭借有预见性的思考，这家公司早早投资并迅速发展。

definition.en: the act of predicting or imagining future events (less common; usually written as “foreseeing”)
definition.zh: 预见；预知（较少用作名词，通常写作 foreseeing）

examples.en: Her foreseeing of the risks helped the team avoid mistakes.
examples.zh: 她对风险的预见帮助团队避免了错误。

extraExplanation: 你输入的 **foreseing** 很可能是拼写错误，正确拼写是 **foreseeing**（adj./n.）。
常见搭配：**foreseeing person**（有远见的人）, **foreseeing mind/approach**（有预见性的思维/方法）。
易混词：**foresight**（远见；名词，更常用：have foresight/with foresight）。

summary.en: “Foreseize” is not standard; it’s usually a misspelling of “foresee.”
summary.zh: “foreseize”不是标准用法，通常是把“foresee”拼错了。

definition.en: A nonstandard or very rare form; in modern English, it is usually a misspelling of “foresee” (to predict) or a mistaken blend of “fore-” + “seize.”
definition.zh: 非标准或极罕见的形式；在现代英语里通常是把“foresee”（预见、预测）拼错了，或是把前缀“fore-”与“seize”（抓住、夺取）误混在一起。

examples.en: I can’t find “foreseize” in standard dictionaries; did you mean “foresee”?
examples.zh: 我在常见词典里找不到“foreseize”；你是不是想写“foresee”？

examples.en: We can’t foresee every problem, but we can prepare for common ones.
examples.zh: 我们无法预见每个问题，但可以为常见问题做好准备。

extraExplanation:
“foreseize”不是现代英语中的常用词，写作和考试中建议避免使用。最常见的目标词是：
1) foresee：意为“预见/预测”（例：I foresee trouble. 我预见会有麻烦）。
2) seize：意为“抓住/夺取”（例：seize an opportunity 抓住机会）。
如果你是在法律或历史文本里看到它，请把原句发来，我可以根据上下文判断它是否为古拼写、印刷错误，或特定方言用法。

summary.en: “Foresend” means to send something ahead of time.
summary.zh: “foresend”指把某物提前发送/寄送。

definition.en: to send something in advance; to dispatch ahead of time (often so it arrives earlier or can be prepared for).
definition.zh: 预先寄送；提前发送（常为让对方提前收到或准备）。

examples.en: Please foresend the contract so our lawyer can review it.
examples.zh: 请先把合同预先寄来，好让我们的律师审阅。

examples.en: They foresent the documents by email and mailed the originals later.
examples.zh: 他们先用电子邮件预先发送文件，之后再把原件寄出。

extraExplanation: “foresend”在现代英语里比较少见，书面语或商务/法律语境偶尔会出现。日常更常用的表达有：send ahead, send in advance, pre-send。
词由 fore-（在前、预先）+ send（发送）构成，意思直观。注意它通常是及物用法（foresend something）。

summary.en: A rare word meaning a premonition—sensing something before it happens.
summary.zh: 较少见的词，表示“预感/预兆”，即在事情发生前先感到。

definition.en: a feeling or ability to sense something before it happens; a premonition
definition.zh: 对未来将发生之事的预感；预兆（预先感知）

examples.en: She had a strange foresense that the trip would be delayed.
examples.zh: 她有种奇怪的预感，这趟旅行会被耽搁。

examples.en: His foresense of danger made him leave early.
examples.zh: 他对危险的预感让他提前离开了。

extraExplanation: “foresense”在现代英语中比较少见，更常见的表达是“premonition”（预感）或“foresight”（远见、预见）。写作或考试中如果想更自然，通常建议用这些更常用的词。
词形结构：fore-（在前、预先）+ sense（感觉）。它强调“提前感到”，语气往往带一点直觉、神秘或不安的色彩。
文学/风格提示：在小说或诗歌里，“foresense”有时用来营造命运感或不祥预兆；在正式的现代非虚构写作中使用频率较低。

summary.en: “foresentence” is a rare/nonstandard word meaning an earlier (previous/preceding) sentence in a text.
summary.zh: “foresentence”是罕见/非标准用法，意思是文章中的前一句（previous/preceding sentence）。

definition.en: (Rare/nonstandard) A sentence that comes before another sentence; an earlier or preceding sentence, often used to refer back to something already written.
definition.zh: （罕见/非标准用法）指位于另一句之前的句子；前一句、上文的一句，常用于回指前文内容。

examples.en: In the foresentence, the author introduces the main character’s name.
examples.zh: 在前一句里，作者介绍了主角的名字。

examples.en: Please revise the foresentence so it connects more smoothly to the next idea.
examples.zh: 请修改前一句，让它与下一个观点衔接得更顺畅。

definition.en: (More common wording) Used to mean “the previous sentence” or “the preceding sentence.”
definition.zh: （更常见的表达）通常想表达“前一句 / 上一句（previous/preceding sentence）”。

examples.en: The previous sentence explains why the policy changed.
examples.zh: 前一句解释了为什么政策发生变化。

examples.en: Refer to the preceding sentence for the definition.
examples.zh: 定义请参见前一句。

extraExplanation: “foresentence”并不是现代英语里常见或规范的拼写。学术写作或日常表达中更自然的说法是：the previous sentence（前一句）、the preceding sentence（前一句/上一句）、the sentence above（上面那句）。
如果你是在编辑软件/语法检查里看到“foresentence”，也可能是把“fore-”当作“在前的”来造词；类似的规范词有 foreword（序言）、foresee（预见）。

summary.en: “foreset” is a rare word meaning “set up in advance.” In modern English, people usually say “preset” or “set in advance.”
summary.zh: “foreset”是个很少见的词，意思是“事先设定/预先安排”。现代英语更常用“preset”或“set in advance”。

definition.en: (Rare/archaic) To set or arrange in advance; to pre-establish beforehand.
definition.zh: （罕见/古义）预先设定；事先安排、确立。

examples.en: The rules were foreset before the meeting began.
examples.zh: 会议开始前，规则就已经预先设定好了。

examples.en: A rigid schedule, once foreset, can be hard to change.
examples.zh: 一旦预先设定了死板的时间表，就很难更改。

extraExplanation: “foreset”在现代英语中非常少见，更多时候人们会用“preset / prearrange / set in advance”。
容易与“foresee”（预见）和“forest”（森林）混淆：如果你想表达“预见未来”，通常应写“foresee”；如果是“森林”，则是“forest”。
在实际写作中，建议用更常见的词替换，以免读者看不懂或以为是拼写错误。

summary.en: Foresettle means to arrange or decide something ahead of time, especially in formal contexts.
summary.zh: Foresettle 指在事情发生前就预先安排或决定，常见于较正式的语境。

definition.en: to settle, decide, or arrange something in advance (often used in formal or legal contexts)
definition.zh: （常用于正式或法律语境）预先解决、预先决定或预先安排

examples.en: They tried to foresettle the terms of the contract before the meeting.
examples.zh: 他们试图在会议前预先敲定合同条款。

examples.en: The dispute was largely foresettled through private negotiation.
examples.zh: 这场纠纷主要通过私下协商被预先解决了。

extraExplanation: “foresettle”较为罕见，现代英语中更常用的表达是：settle in advance / prearrange / predetermine / resolve beforehand。
词源上，“fore-”表示“在……之前、预先”，加上“settle（解决/安定/定居）”，合起来就是“提前处理好”。在旧式法律或正式文书里更可能见到。

summary.en: Foresettled means decided or arranged in advance (the past form of foresettle).
summary.zh: foresettled 指“预先决定/事先安排好、提前敲定的”，是 foresettle 的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of foresettle) to arrange or decide something in advance, so it is already settled before it happens.
definition.zh: （foresettle 的过去式/过去分词）预先安排或决定某事，使其在发生前就已“定下来”。

examples.en: The terms of the agreement were foresettled before the meeting began.
examples.zh: 协议条款在会议开始前就已预先敲定。

examples.en: They had foresettled the schedule, so there was little left to discuss.
examples.zh: 他们已经预先定好了日程，所以几乎没什么可讨论的了。

definition.en: already decided or arranged beforehand; predetermined.
definition.zh: 预先决定的；事先安排好的；既定的。

examples.en: With a foresettled plan, the project moved quickly.
examples.zh: 有了事先定好的计划，项目推进得很快。

examples.en: She followed a foresettled route to avoid delays.
examples.zh: 她按事先定好的路线走，以避免耽误。

extraExplanation: “foresettled/foresettle”在现代英语里比较少见，更常用的表达是“prearranged / predetermined / agreed in advance / settled beforehand”。
它有时会出现在较正式的语境（如法律、合同、谈判）中，强调“在正式场合开始之前就已经把关键点谈妥”。

summary.en: “Foresey” is not a standard spelling; it is most likely “foresee,” meaning to predict or expect something in the future.
summary.zh: “foresey”不是标准拼写；最可能是“foresee”，意思是“预见/预测将来会发生的事”。

definition.en: To know or guess that something will happen in the future; to predict.
definition.zh: 预见；预知；预测（未来会发生某事）。

examples.en: I didn’t foresee any problems with the plan.
examples.zh: 我没有预见到这个计划会有什么问题。

examples.en: No one could have foreseen how quickly the city would change.
examples.zh: 没人能预见这座城市会变化得这么快。

examples.en: Experts foresee higher prices next year.
examples.zh: 专家预测明年价格会上涨。

extraExplanation: “foresey”不是常见的英语单词拼写，最可能是把“foresee”拼错了。
“fore-”表示“在前、预先”，而“see”是“看见”，合起来“foresee”就是“提前看见/预见（将来）”。
常见搭配：foresee problems（预见问题）、foresee a rise in prices（预测价格上涨）、can’t foresee（无法预见）。

summary.en: Foreshadow means to hint or signal something that will happen later.
summary.zh: Foreshadow 指“暗示、预示”将来会发生的事。

definition.en: To hint or give signs that something will happen later (often in a story, movie, or situation).
definition.zh: （常用于故事、电影或情境中）暗示、预示某事将会在之后发生。

examples.en: The dark clouds foreshadowed a storm.
examples.zh: 乌云预示着一场暴风雨要来了。

examples.en: In the novel, a small warning early on foreshadows the tragedy at the end.
examples.zh: 在小说中，前面一个小小的警告暗示了结尾的悲剧。

examples.en: His nervous glance seemed to foreshadow bad news.
examples.zh: 他紧张的一瞥似乎预示着坏消息。

definition.en: To be a sign that something will happen later.
definition.zh: 成为……的征兆；预示……（将发生）。

examples.en: Rising prices can foreshadow economic trouble.
examples.zh: 物价上涨可能预示经济将出现问题。

examples.en: These early symptoms may foreshadow a larger illness.
examples.zh: 这些早期症状可能预示更严重的疾病。

extraExplanation: “foreshadow”常用于文学分析，指作者在前文埋下线索，让读者对后续情节有心理准备。常见方式包括：反复出现的意象（如乌鸦、风暴）、不祥的气氛、角色的梦或预感、看似随意但后来变关键的细节。
词源上可理解为“fore-（在前）+ shadow（影子）”：像影子先出现一样，事情还没发生就先有“影子”显现。

summary.en: “Foreshadowed” means something gave a hint or sign of a future event, especially in storytelling.
summary.zh: “foreshadowed”表示某事预示/暗示未来将发生的事，尤用于叙事与文学中的“埋伏笔”。

definition.en: to hint at or give a warning of something that will happen later (often in stories, movies, or real events)
definition.zh: 预示；预兆；（常用于故事/电影等中）暗示后面将发生的事

examples.en: The dark clouds foreshadowed a storm later that night.
examples.zh: 乌云预示着那天晚上会有暴风雨。

examples.en: In the novel, the broken mirror foreshadowed the character’s bad luck.
examples.zh: 在小说里，破碎的镜子暗示了角色将遭遇厄运。

examples.en: Her sudden silence foreshadowed an argument.
examples.zh: 她突然的沉默预示着一场争吵。

extraExplanation: “foreshadowed”是“foreshadow”的过去式/过去分词，常见于叙事写作中的写作手法“foreshadowing（伏笔/预示）”。作者会用细节（天气、物品、对话、象征）提前给读者提示，让后面的转折更合理、更有张力。
词源上可拆成“fore-（在前）+ shadow（影子）”，字面感觉像“事情还没发生，影子先出现”，很贴合“预示/伏笔”的意思。

summary.en: A “foreshadower” is something or someone that hints at what will happen later.
summary.zh: “foreshadower”指能提前暗示后续发展的人、事或细节（伏笔/预兆）。

definition.en: a person, event, or detail that gives an early hint or warning about what will happen later (a sign of foreshadowing).
definition.zh: （人、事件或细节）对将来会发生的事作出提前暗示或预告的线索；伏笔的提示者。

examples.en: In the first chapter, the broken watch is a foreshadower of the family’s collapse later in the story.
examples.zh: 在第一章里，那只坏掉的手表是后来家庭崩溃的伏笔提示。

examples.en: Her sudden silence was a foreshadower of the argument that followed.
examples.zh: 她突然沉默，是接下来争吵的预兆。

extraExplanation: “foreshadower”在现代英语里不算常见；更常用的说法是用名词“foreshadowing（伏笔/预示）”，或说“a sign/omen/hint that foreshadows …（预示……的迹象）”。
文学写作中，“foreshadowing（伏笔）”常通过反复出现的物品、天气、梦境、对话里的细节来实现；这些细节在后文会“兑现”，让读者产生“原来早有暗示”的阅读体验。

summary.en: Foreshadowing means giving a hint that suggests a future event, especially in stories.
summary.zh: Foreshadowing 指用“伏笔/暗示”预示故事后续将发生的事。

definition.en: A hint or clue in a story, movie, or speech that suggests what will happen later.
definition.zh: （在故事、电影或演讲中）对未来情节的暗示或线索，预示后续会发生什么。

examples.en: The stormy sky at the beginning is foreshadowing for the trouble that comes later.
examples.zh: 开头阴沉的天空是在为后面的麻烦做铺垫（埋下伏笔）。

examples.en: Her nervous glance at the clock was a small piece of foreshadowing.
examples.zh: 她紧张地看了一眼钟表，是一个小小的伏笔。

definition.en: To give hints or signs that something will happen in the future, especially in a story.
definition.zh: （尤指在叙事中）用暗示或迹象预告将来会发生的事。

examples.en: The author foreshadows the ending by repeating the same strange phrase.
examples.zh: 作者反复使用同一句奇怪的话，来暗示结局。

examples.en: That early scene foreshadowed his decision to leave home.
examples.zh: 那个早期场景预示了他后来决定离家。

extraExplanation: “foreshadowing”是写作与阅读中的常见术语，中文常译为“伏笔/预示/铺垫”。它通常不是直接把结局说出来，而是用细节（天气、物件、对话、反复出现的意象等）让读者产生预感。
常见类型：①明显伏笔（读者容易察觉）②隐性伏笔（回头看才懂）③“红鲱鱼”式误导（看似伏笔但其实引向错误猜测）。
文学与影视中很常用：例如开场出现的“破碎的照片/反复的铃声/不祥的音乐”，常在后面对应重要转折。相关词：hint（提示）、clue（线索）、build-up（铺垫）、predict（预测，语气更直接）。

summary.en: Foreshadowingly means “in a hinting or warning way about what will happen later.”
summary.zh: foreshadowingly 意为“以暗示或预告后续事件的方式（埋伏笔地）”。

definition.en: In a way that gives a hint or warning about something that will happen later (often in stories, movies, or speeches).
definition.zh: 以“预示/伏笔”的方式；用暗示或预告的方式提示后面将发生的事（常见于小说、电影或演讲中）。

examples.en: The sky darkened foreshadowingly, and everyone felt a storm was coming.
examples.zh: 天空预示性地变暗了，大家都感觉暴风雨要来了。

examples.en: She smiled foreshadowingly, as if she knew a surprise was waiting for us.
examples.zh: 她带着一种预示性的微笑，仿佛知道有个惊喜在等着我们。

examples.en: The author describes a cracked mirror foreshadowingly to hint at the family’s future breakup.
examples.zh: 作者用“破裂的镜子”作伏笔，预示这个家庭未来会分崩离析。

extraExplanation: “foreshadowingly”来自“foreshadow（预示、埋下伏笔）”。在文学写作里，foreshadowing（伏笔/预示）常用来制造悬念：作者通过天气、物品、对话或细节，让读者隐约感觉“后面会出事”。
这个副词在日常口语中不算常见；更自然的替换说法包括：“in a foreshadowing way / as a hint / ominously（不祥地）”（视语气而定）。

summary.en: Foreshadowings are hints or signs—especially in stories—that suggest what will happen later.
summary.zh: Foreshadowings 指暗示或预兆，尤其是故事里提示后续发展（伏笔）的细节。

definition.en: hints or signs that suggest what will happen in the future (often in a story or situation).
definition.zh: （对未来的）暗示、预兆；（常指故事或情境中）提示将要发生的事。

examples.en: The dark clouds were foreshadowings of the storm that arrived that night.
examples.zh: 乌云是那晚暴风雨来临的预兆。

examples.en: In the first chapter, small foreshadowings prepare readers for the surprise ending.
examples.zh: 在第一章里，一些细微的暗示为读者铺垫了意外的结局。

definition.en: in literature and film: details (images, lines, events) that subtly point to later developments in the plot.
definition.zh: （文学/电影）伏笔：用细节（意象、台词、事件等）含蓄地指向后续剧情发展。

examples.en: The writer uses repeated mentions of a locked door as foreshadowings of the final reveal.
examples.zh: 作者反复提到一扇上锁的门，作为最终揭示的伏笔。

examples.en: These foreshadowings make the story feel more connected when you reread it.
examples.zh: 这些伏笔让你重读时觉得故事更连贯。

extraExplanation: “Foreshadowing/foreshadowings”在写作课里常译为“伏笔”。好的伏笔通常“轻描淡写”：第一次看不一定注意到，但回头看会觉得合理、早有提示。
词形提示：单数是 foreshadowing；复数是 foreshadowings，强调“多处暗示/多个伏笔”。

summary.en: “Foreshadows” means “gives a hint or sign that something will happen later,” especially in storytelling.
summary.zh: “foreshadows”表示“预示、暗示将来会发生的事”，尤其常用于叙事写作中。

definition.en: To give hints or signs that something will happen in the future (often used in stories, movies, and speeches).
definition.zh: （常用于故事、电影、演讲等）预示、暗示某事将要发生。

examples.en: Dark clouds often foreshadow a storm.
examples.zh: 乌云常常预示着暴风雨。

examples.en: In the novel, the broken mirror foreshadows the character’s downfall.
examples.zh: 在小说里，破碎的镜子暗示了角色的衰败。

examples.en: His sudden silence foreshadowed bad news.
examples.zh: 他突然的沉默预示着坏消息。

extraExplanation: “foreshadow”在文学中是一个常见写作手法，叫“伏笔/预示（foreshadowing）”。作者会用细节（天气、物品、对话、梦境等）提前暗示后面的剧情发展，让读者产生期待或紧张感。
形式说明：你输入的“foreshadows”是第三人称单数（he/she/it foreshadows）。常见搭配：foreshadow trouble/disaster/changes；foreshadow what is to come（预示将要发生的事）。

summary.en: A foreshaft is the front section of an arrow or spear shaft, sometimes made as a replaceable piece between the point and the main shaft.
summary.zh: foreshaft 指箭或矛的杆身前段，位于箭头/矛头与主杆之间，有时做成可更换的部件。

definition.en: The front (forward) part of an arrow or spear shaft, usually the section between the point (head) and the main shaft.
definition.zh: 箭杆或矛杆的前段；通常指连接箭头/矛头与主杆之间的那一截。

examples.en: The arrow’s foreshaft was reinforced so it wouldn’t split on impact.
examples.zh: 这支箭的前杆做了加固，以免撞击时裂开。

examples.en: In the museum, you can see a hunting spear with a detachable foreshaft.
examples.zh: 在博物馆里，你可以看到一支带可拆卸前杆的猎矛。

definition.en: A short front section added to the main shaft, often designed to be replaceable (for example, to change the point or to repair damage).
definition.zh: 加在主杆前端的一段短杆，常做成可更换的结构（例如便于更换箭头/矛头或修复损坏）。

examples.en: He swapped the foreshaft to use a different arrowhead for fishing.
examples.zh: 他更换了前杆，以便换上适合捕鱼的箭头。

examples.en: A replaceable foreshaft can make field repairs much easier.
examples.zh: 可更换的前杆能让野外维修容易得多。

extraExplanation: “foreshaft”多见于弓箭、狩猎工具、考古与博物馆说明文字中，属于相对专业的词。
构词很直观：fore-（前面的）+ shaft（杆、轴）。在日常英语里更常见的是“shaft”（箭杆/杆身）或“arrow shaft”。
在一些传统或原住民工艺中，可拆卸的foreshaft有实际用途：前端更容易损坏，做成可替换能节省材料，也便于携带不同用途的箭头/矛头。

summary.en: Foreshank means the lower part of an animal’s front leg, and the meat cut from that part—often used for slow-cooked dishes.
summary.zh: Foreshank 指动物前腿的小腿部位，也指该部位的肉（前腱子/前小腿肉），常用于慢炖料理。

definition.en: The lower part of an animal’s front leg (foreleg), especially the section between the knee and the hoof; also used for the meat cut from this part.
definition.zh: （动物）前腿的小腿部位（膝盖到蹄之间的部分）；也可指该部位切下的肉（前腱子/前小腿肉）。

examples.en: The stew uses foreshank because it becomes tender after slow cooking.
examples.zh: 这道炖菜用的是前腱子肉，因为慢炖后会变得很软烂。

examples.en: The butcher trimmed the foreshank and left the bone for flavor.
examples.zh: 肉贩修整了前腱子，并保留骨头来增加风味。

examples.en: In some recipes, foreshank is preferred over hindshank for a milder taste.
examples.zh: 在一些食谱里，人们更喜欢用前腱子而不是后腱子，因为味道更温和。

definition.en: (Anatomy/animal husbandry) The front shank or shin area of a four-legged animal’s forelimb.
definition.zh: （解剖/畜牧）四足动物前肢的胫部/前小腿区域（前“shank/shin”）。

examples.en: The veterinarian checked the horse’s foreshank for swelling.
examples.zh: 兽医检查了马前小腿是否肿胀。

examples.en: In judging livestock, the foreshank should look straight and strong.
examples.zh: 在评估家畜体态时，前小腿应看起来笔直有力。

extraExplanation: “foreshank”由“fore-（前）+ shank（小腿/胫部）”构成，常见于屠宰分割与烹饪语境。
烹饪中它通常筋多、胶原蛋白丰富，适合慢炖（如炖汤、红烧、braise）。点餐或买肉时也可能看到更常用的写法“front shank / fore shank”。

summary.en: “Foreshape” means to shape something in advance, or (less commonly) to suggest what will happen later.
summary.zh: “Foreshape”指预先塑造/设计；也可指（较少见）预示未来会发生的事。

definition.en: to shape or form something in advance; to plan or design the outline of something before it is made
definition.zh: 预先塑造；预先设计（某物的形状或结构）

examples.en: Engineers foreshaped the prototype with a simple 3D model.
examples.zh: 工程师用一个简单的3D模型预先塑造了原型。

examples.en: The teacher foreshaped the course by setting clear goals from the start.
examples.zh: 老师从一开始就设定明确目标，从而预先规划了课程的框架。

definition.en: to show or suggest what will happen later; to foreshadow
definition.zh: 预示；预兆（后来的事情）

examples.en: Early disagreements foreshaped the breakup of the team.
examples.zh: 早期的分歧预示了团队的解体。

examples.en: In the novel, the storm foreshapes the trouble to come.
examples.zh: 在小说里，这场暴风雨预示着即将到来的麻烦。

extraExplanation: “foreshape”由“fore-（在前、预先）+ shape（塑造）”构成，语感上接近“pre-shape（预先成形）”。在现代英语里更常见的表达是“shape in advance / pre-shape”，而表示“预示”时更常用“foreshadow”。在文学分析中，第二个意思偶尔出现，用来强调某个早期细节“提前塑造/勾勒”后续走向。

summary.en: A sailing rope used to control and trim the foresail.
summary.zh: 用于控制并调整前帆的航海绳索（帆脚索）。

definition.en: (Sailing) A rope or line used to control the angle of a foresail (front sail) by trimming it in or letting it out.
definition.zh: （航海）前帆帆脚索：用来控制前帆（船前部的帆）角度的绳索/索具，通过收紧或放松来调整帆形。

examples.en: The crew tightened the foresheet to sail closer to the wind.
examples.zh: 船员收紧前帆帆脚索，让船更贴风航行。

examples.en: Ease the foresheet a little, or the sail will luff.
examples.zh: 把前帆帆脚索稍微放松一点，不然帆会拍打抖动。

extraExplanation: 在帆船术语里，sheet（帆脚索/控帆绳）并不是“床单”的意思，而是指用来“调整帆”的绳索。foresheet 特别指前帆（如 jib 或 genoa）的那根（或那组）sheet。常见搭配：trim the foresheet（收紧调整）、ease the foresheet（放松放出）、take up the slack（收回松弛）。

summary.en: Foresheets are the nautical lines used to control and trim a foresail, especially on a sailboat.
summary.zh: foresheets 指帆船上用于控制和调整前帆的操帆绳（前帆绳）。

definition.en: (Nautical) Ropes/lines attached to the lower corners of a foresail (or other forward sail) and used to control or trim the sail’s position.
definition.zh: （航海）系在前帆（或前部帆）下角的操帆绳，用来控制/调整帆的角度与受风状态。

examples.en: The crew eased the foresheets to let the foresail catch more wind.
examples.zh: 船员放松前帆操帆绳，让前帆吃到更多风。

examples.en: In heavy weather, they tightened the foresheets to keep the sail from flogging.
examples.zh: 在大风浪中，他们收紧前帆操帆绳，防止帆布拍打。

extraExplanation: 这是一个典型的航海术语，常见于帆船操作语境。这里的 sheet 不是“床单”，而是“操帆绳/帆脚绳”的意思（用于控制帆的角度与张力）。
foresheets 是复数形式；单数是 foresheet。它通常与“ease (放松绳索)”和“trim (调整帆形/绳索)”等动词搭配出现。

summary.en: Foreshift means the earliest work shift of the day (often a British term).
summary.zh: Foreshift指一天中最早的一班（多为英式用法）。

definition.en: An early work shift, especially the first shift of the day (often used in British English, historically in mining and factory work).
definition.zh: 早班；头班（尤指一天中的第一班，常见于英式英语，历史上多用于矿业或工厂）

examples.en: He’s on the foreshift this week, so he starts work at 6 a.m.
examples.zh: 他这周上早班，所以早上6点就开始工作。

examples.en: The foreshift crew checked the equipment before the next team arrived.
examples.zh: 早班的工人在下一班到来前检查了设备。

extraExplanation: “foreshift”常见于英国的传统行业（如煤矿）语境：一天可能分为foreshift（早班）、backshift（晚班/后半天的班）以及night shift（夜班）。在现代日常英语里，更常说morning shift/day shift。

summary.en: The forward (front) part of a ship near the bow.
summary.zh: 指船的前部，靠近船头（船艏）的区域。

definition.en: the forward (front) part of a ship; the area near the bow
definition.zh: （船的）前部；靠近船艏/船头的区域

examples.en: The cargo was stored in the foreship to balance the vessel.
examples.zh: 为了保持船只平衡，货物被存放在船的前部。

examples.en: Waves hit the foreship first as the ship turned into the wind.
examples.zh: 船迎风转向时，浪先拍打到船的前部。

extraExplanation: “foreship”是航海/船舶语境中的词，日常英语里比较少见。更常见的说法包括“the bow”（船头/艏）或“the forward part/section of the ship”（船的前部）。
词形上由“fore-”（在前的）+“ship”（船）构成，含义直观：指船体的前方区域。

summary.en: A foreshock is a smaller quake before a larger main earthquake; it can also mean an early warning sign of something bigger.
summary.zh: foreshock 指主震前发生的较小地震（前震）；也可比喻为更大事件来临前的征兆。

definition.en: a smaller earthquake that happens before a larger main earthquake (the mainshock) in the same area
definition.zh: 发生在同一地区、在更大主震（mainshock）之前的较小地震（前震）

examples.en: Scientists study foreshocks to better understand when a bigger earthquake might follow.
examples.zh: 科学家研究前震，以便更好地理解是否可能随后发生更大的地震。

examples.en: The foreshock was mild, but it made people nervous because the region is seismically active.
examples.zh: 这次前震不算强，但由于该地区地震活动频繁，人们仍然感到紧张。

definition.en: an earlier warning sign that something serious may happen later (used figuratively)
definition.zh: （比喻）更严重事情发生前的早期征兆；预警信号

examples.en: The sudden drop in sales was a foreshock of the bigger financial problems to come.
examples.zh: 销量的突然下滑是之后更大财务问题的前兆。

examples.en: Small protests can be a foreshock of major political change.
examples.zh: 小规模抗议可能是重大政治变革的先兆。

extraExplanation: “foreshock”是地震学术语：只有在后来真的发生了更大的“主震”（mainshock）后，之前那次较小地震才会被事后认定为“前震”。如果没有更大的主震跟随，它就只是一次普通地震。
词源直观：fore-（在前）+ shock（震动/冲击）。日常写作中也常用作比喻“风暴来临前的第一阵风”。

summary.en: A “foreshoe” is the horseshoe fitted to a horse’s front hoof.
summary.zh: “foreshoe”指马前蹄上的马蹄铁（前蹄铁）。

definition.en: (Horse care) The front horseshoe on a horse’s hoof; a horseshoe used on a front foot.
definition.zh: （马匹护理）前蹄铁；装在马前蹄上的马蹄铁。

examples.en: The farrier replaced the mare’s left foreshoe after it came loose.
examples.zh: 钉蹄师在母马左前蹄铁松动后把它换掉了。

examples.en: A heavier foreshoe can help protect the front hooves on rocky trails.
examples.zh: 在多石小路上，较重的前蹄铁能更好地保护前蹄。

extraExplanation: 这个词主要见于马术、养马与钉蹄（farriery）语境。与之相对的是 hindshoe（后蹄铁）。在日常英语中更常说 front horseshoe 或 simply horseshoe；foreshoe 更偏专业或较旧的用法。
拼写注意：foreshoe = fore-（前）+ shoe（蹄铁/鞋）。不要和 forefoot（前足/前蹄）混淆。

summary.en: “Foreshop” means the front, customer-facing area of a shop.
summary.zh: “foreshop”指商店面向顾客的前店面/营业区。

definition.en: the front part of a shop or store, where customers are served (often contrasted with the back room/work area)
definition.zh: （商店的）前店面；临街的营业区（常与后面的工作区/仓库相对）

examples.en: Please wait in the foreshop while I check in the back.
examples.zh: 请在前店面稍等，我去后面查看一下。

examples.en: The foreshop displays the new arrivals, and the stock is kept behind the counter.
examples.zh: 前店面陈列新品，库存则放在柜台后面。

extraExplanation: “foreshop”在英式英语里更常见，尤其用于描述“前店面/门市区”。在美式英语中，人们更常说“front of the shop/store”或“sales floor”。
很多学习者会把“Photoshop（修图软件/动词）”误写成“foreshop”。如果你想表达“用PS修图”，正确拼写通常是“Photoshop”，读音也不同。

summary.en: Foreshore is the strip of coastal land between high tide and low tide, sometimes discussed in terms of public access or ownership.
summary.zh: Foreshore 指高潮线与低潮线之间的海岸带（前滩/潮间带），也常在公共通行权或所有权语境中出现。

definition.en: the part of a shore (especially at the sea) that lies between the high-tide mark and the low-tide mark; the strip of land that is covered and uncovered by the tide
definition.zh: （尤指海边）高潮线与低潮线之间的岸边地带；随潮水涨落而时隐时现的海岸带

examples.en: At low tide, we walked across the foreshore and collected shells.
examples.zh: 退潮时，我们走在前滩上捡贝壳。

examples.en: The kayak was pulled up onto the foreshore before the water rose again.
examples.zh: 涨潮前，他们把皮划艇拖到前滩上。

examples.en: Please avoid driving on the foreshore to protect fragile habitats.
examples.zh: 请不要在前滩上开车，以保护脆弱的栖息地。

definition.en: (law, especially in the UK and some Commonwealth contexts) land along the coast that may be subject to public rights or government ownership
definition.zh: （法律用语，尤见于英国及部分英联邦语境）可能涉及公共权利或政府所有权的沿海地带

examples.en: The dispute focused on who owned the foreshore in front of the houses.
examples.zh: 争议焦点在于房屋前方前滩的归属权。

examples.en: In some places, people have public access rights across the foreshore.
examples.zh: 在一些地区，人们对前滩享有公共通行权。

extraExplanation: “foreshore”常见于海岸地理、生态保护与土地权属讨论中。与之相关的词有“tideline（潮线）”“intertidal zone（潮间带）”。在不同国家/地区，前滩的所有权与通行权规定可能不同，因此在涉及开发、围栏或私人码头时常会出现法律争议。

summary.en: Foreshorten means (1) to make something look shorter by perspective (common in art), or (2) to shorten something in time or length.
summary.zh: foreshorten 意为：（1）用透视法让物体看起来更短（艺术中常见）；（2）缩短时间或长度。

definition.en: To make something appear shorter than it really is, especially in a drawing, photo, or description, by showing it at an angle (a perspective effect).
definition.zh: （尤指在绘画、摄影或描述中）用透视法使物体看起来比实际更短（产生“近大远小、长度被压缩”的效果）。

examples.en: In the portrait, the artist foreshortened the man’s arm so it looks like it’s reaching toward you.
examples.zh: 在这幅肖像里，画家把男人的手臂做了透视缩短，所以看起来像伸向你。

examples.en: The wide-angle lens foreshortens the hallway, making it seem shorter than it is.
examples.zh: 广角镜头会把走廊“透视缩短”，让它看起来比实际更短。

definition.en: To shorten something (time, a process, or a distance); to make it shorter or briefer.
definition.zh: 缩短（时间、过程或距离）；使更简短。

examples.en: We can foreshorten the meeting by focusing only on the key decisions.
examples.zh: 我们可以只讨论关键决策来缩短会议时间。

examples.en: A new shortcut foreshortened our walk to the station.
examples.zh: 一条新近路缩短了我们去车站的路程。

extraExplanation: “foreshorten”最常见于艺术与视觉表达：来自“fore-（在前）+ shorten（缩短）”。当物体朝向观者时，近处看起来更大、远处更小，物体在画面中的长度会被“压缩”，这就是透视缩短（foreshortening）。
常见搭配：foreshorten an arm/leg/figure（把手臂/腿/人物做透视缩短）；foreshortened perspective/view（透视缩短的视角/画面）。

summary.en: Foreshortened means “made to look shorter because of perspective” or “shortened/condensed compared with the original.”
summary.zh: foreshortened 指“因透视而显得更短”，也可指“被缩短或压缩的（缩略的）”。

definition.en: Made to look shorter than it really is, especially in a drawing or photo, because it points toward or away from the viewer (a perspective effect).
definition.zh: （尤指绘画/照片中因透视）看起来比实际更短的；（物体朝向或远离观者而）缩短的。

examples.en: In the portrait, the artist painted the raised arm foreshortened to make it feel closer to us.
examples.zh: 在这幅肖像里，画家把抬起的手臂画成透视缩短的效果，让它看起来更靠近我们。

examples.en: The camera angle makes the runner’s legs look foreshortened.
examples.zh: 这个拍摄角度让跑者的腿看起来被缩短了。

definition.en: Shortened or compressed compared with the original length, time, or amount (often used about writing, schedules, or versions of a story).
definition.zh: （与原本相比）被缩短的；被压缩的（常指文章、日程或故事版本）。

examples.en: We read a foreshortened version of the novel in class.
examples.zh: 我们在课堂上读的是这部小说的缩略版。

examples.en: Because of the storm, the event had a foreshortened schedule.
examples.zh: 由于暴风雨，这次活动的日程被压缩了。

extraExplanation: “Foreshortened”来自动词“foreshorten”（使在视觉上缩短/使缩短）。在艺术语境里，它强调一种“看起来变短”的透视现象（比如手伸向镜头会显得更短、更大）。
常见搭配：foreshortened arm/leg（透视缩短的手臂/腿）、foreshortened view（透视缩短的视角）、foreshortened version（缩略版）。

summary.en: Foreshortening is a technique (especially in art and photography) where something looks shorter because it’s viewed at an angle, creating depth.
summary.zh: Foreshortening 指（尤其在绘画和摄影中）因观看角度而产生的“看起来变短”的效果，用来增强空间深度感。

definition.en: A drawing or photography technique that makes an object or person look shorter (compressed) because it is seen at an angle, creating a strong sense of depth.
definition.zh: （绘画/摄影）透视缩短法：由于从某个角度观看，使物体或人物看起来被“压缩”变短，从而增强空间深度感。

examples.en: In the photo, his arm looks unusually short because of foreshortening.
examples.zh: 在这张照片里，他的手臂看起来异常短，是透视缩短造成的。

examples.en: Artists use foreshortening to make figures feel as if they are reaching toward the viewer.
examples.zh: 画家会用透视缩短，让人物看起来像在朝观者伸手。

definition.en: The act of making something appear shorter or more compact; a “compressed” representation of length or time.
definition.zh: 缩短；压缩式呈现：把长度或时间等以更短、更紧凑的方式表现出来。

examples.en: The film is a foreshortening of the novel’s long storyline.
examples.zh: 这部电影把小说很长的故事线做了压缩呈现。

examples.en: In summaries, complex histories often become a foreshortening of events.
examples.zh: 在摘要里，复杂的历史常常会被压缩成更短的事件串。

extraExplanation: 词源提示：fore-（在前）+ shortening（缩短）。在美术语境里最常见，常与 perspective（透视）一起出现。
文化/艺术背景：文艺复兴时期的艺术家发展线性透视后，透视缩短被广泛用来制造强烈的空间感；例如一些宗教绘画中，人物的脚或手会被画得“近大远小、近短远长”，让观者有更强的临场感。

summary.en: “Foreshortens” means makes something appear shorter due to perspective, or shortens something in time/length.
summary.zh: “foreshortens”指（因透视）使看起来变短，或把时间/长度缩短。

definition.en: to make something look shorter than it really is (especially in drawing, painting, photography, or film) because it is seen at an angle
definition.zh: （尤指在绘画、摄影、电影中因透视角度）使某物看起来比实际更短

examples.en: The camera angle foreshortens his arm, making it look unusually short.
examples.zh: 这个机位把他的手臂“压短”了，让它看起来异常短。

examples.en: In many comic panels, an object pointed toward the viewer foreshortens dramatically.
examples.zh: 在很多漫画分镜里，朝观众伸出的物体会被明显地透视缩短。

definition.en: to shorten something in time or length; to cut it down
definition.zh: 缩短（时间或长度）；压缩；缩减

examples.en: The editor foreshortens the article to fit the page.
examples.zh: 编辑把文章压缩到能放进版面。

examples.en: We’ll need to foreshorten the meeting because the next class starts soon.
examples.zh: 因为下一节课马上开始，我们得缩短会议时间。

extraExplanation: “foreshortens”是动词“foreshorten”的第三人称单数现在时（he/she/it foreshortens）。在艺术语境里更常见，常与“in perspective（在透视中）”“in the foreground（在前景）”等搭配。

summary.en: Foreshot most commonly means the first, usually discarded portion of alcohol distillate; rarely it can mean an opening shot fired before others.
summary.zh: Foreshot 最常指蒸馏酒最先流出的“酒头/前馏液”，通常会被弃掉；较少见时也可指先发的一枪/开场的一枪。

definition.en: In distilling alcohol, the first liquid that comes out of the still, usually discarded because it can contain harmful compounds (especially methanol) and harsh flavors.
definition.zh: （蒸馏酒时的）酒头／前馏液：蒸馏器最先流出的那部分液体，通常会被弃掉，因为可能含有有害物质（尤其是甲醇）且味道刺鼻。

examples.en: When making moonshine, you must separate and discard the foreshots for safety.
examples.zh: 自酿私酒（moonshine）时，为了安全必须把酒头分离出来并丢弃。

examples.en: The distiller carefully cut the foreshots, heads, hearts, and tails.
examples.zh: 蒸馏师仔细地切分了酒头、酒头后段（heads）、酒心（hearts）和酒尾（tails）。

definition.en: (Rare) A shot fired before others; an early or opening shot.
definition.zh: （罕见）先发的一枪；开场的一枪。

examples.en: The foreshot signaled the start of the hunt.
examples.zh: 那一声先发的枪响标志着狩猎开始。

extraExplanation: “foreshots”常见于蒸馏与烈酒制作语境，和“heads / hearts / tails（酒头/酒心/酒尾）”一起出现。现代正规蒸馏会通过温度、气味与酒精度等指标来做“cut（切分）”。因为甲醇等成分的风险，家庭蒸馏在很多地区也涉及法律与安全问题。

summary.en: Foreshots are the first portion of distillate in spirit-making, usually discarded for quality and safety reasons.
summary.zh: Foreshots 指蒸馏烈酒时最先出来的一段馏出液，通常因口感与安全原因被丢弃。

definition.en: The first liquid that comes out when alcohol is being distilled; it is usually discarded because it often contains more harsh or unsafe compounds (such as methanol and other volatile substances).
definition.zh: 蒸馏酒时最先流出的那一段酒液；通常会被倒掉，因为其中往往含有较多刺激性或不安全的成分（如甲醇及其他易挥发物）。

examples.en: The distiller threw away the foreshots before collecting the hearts.
examples.zh: 蒸馏师在收集“酒心”之前先把 foreshots（前段酒）倒掉。

examples.en: If you’re making spirits, you need to separate the foreshots carefully.
examples.zh: 如果你在蒸馏烈酒，就需要小心分离 foreshots（前馏分）。

extraExplanation: 在蒸馏的常见分段里，人们常把产物分为 foreshots（前段）、heads（酒头）、hearts（酒心）和 tails（酒尾）。其中 foreshots 通常气味更刺鼻、挥发性更强，因此传统做法多会丢弃。
foreshots 常以复数形式出现（即使指一段液体也用复数），这在英语里属于较固定的用法。

summary.en: A nautical term for the forward, curved side area of a ship near the bow.
summary.zh: 航海用语，指船首附近船侧向外弯曲的前部区域（船体前肩部）。

definition.en: the forward part of a ship’s side (near the bow), where the hull begins to curve outward
definition.zh: （船体）前肩部：靠近船首的船侧前部，船体开始向外弯曲的地方

examples.en: In rough seas, waves kept slamming into the ship’s foreshoulder.
examples.zh: 在风浪很大的海况下，海浪不断拍打着船的前肩部。

examples.en: The crew inspected the foreshoulder for damage after the collision.
examples.zh: 碰撞后，船员检查了船体前肩部是否受损。

extraExplanation: 这是一个偏航海/造船的专业词，也常写作 two-word 形式 fore shoulder。它描述的是船体从船首向船侧过渡的“肩部”曲面区域。理解时可以把船想象成一个人的身体：bow（船首）像“头”在最前面，foreshoulder 就像靠前的“肩膀”位置。

summary.en: Foreshow means to indicate or predict something before it happens; it’s a less common verb, often replaced by foreshadow.
summary.zh: Foreshow 指在事情发生前就“预示/预告”，但较少见，常被 foreshadow 等词替代。

definition.en: to predict or indicate that something will happen in the future; to be an early sign of something
definition.zh: 预示；预告（某事将要发生）；作为……的先兆

examples.en: Dark clouds can foreshow a storm later in the day.
examples.zh: 乌云可能预示当天晚些时候会有暴风雨。

examples.en: Her sudden silence seemed to foreshow trouble.
examples.zh: 她突然的沉默似乎预示着麻烦。

definition.en: to show or reveal something in advance; to give an early preview (less common)
definition.zh: （较少用）提前展示；预先显露；先给出预览

examples.en: The opening scene foreshows the ending by repeating the same image.
examples.zh: 开场镜头通过重复同一意象来预示结局。

examples.en: In the novel, small details foreshow the main character’s later choice.
examples.zh: 在小说中，一些小细节预示了主角后来会做出的选择。

extraExplanation: “foreshow”在现代英语中比较少见，更常用的是“foreshadow”（尤其在文学/影视里表示“伏笔、预示”）或“predict / indicate”。在写作中想表达“埋伏笔”，通常用“foreshadow”。

summary.en: “Foreshowed” means “showed in advance” or “was a sign of something to come.”
summary.zh: “foreshowed”意为“预先显示/预示”，指某事作为未来事件的征兆。

definition.en: To indicate or predict that something will happen in the future; to be a sign of something coming.
definition.zh: 预示；预告（将来会发生的事）；作为……的征兆。

examples.en: Dark clouds often foreshow a storm.
examples.zh: 乌云常常预示着暴风雨。

examples.en: Her sudden silence foreshowed trouble in the relationship.
examples.zh: 她突然的沉默预示着这段关系可能会出问题。

examples.en: The first chapter foreshowed the tragedy that followed.
examples.zh: 第一章预示了随后发生的悲剧。

extraExplanation: “foreshowed”是动词“foreshow”的过去式/过去分词，语气偏书面或文学，用来表达“某事是未来事件的预兆”。
构词提示：fore- 表示“在前、预先”，show 表示“展示”，合在一起就是“提前显示/预示”。
现代英语里更常见的近义表达有：predict（预测）、foretell（预言）、portend（预兆，较正式）、hint at / signal（暗示/信号）。文学写作中也常用 foreshadow（伏笔/预示），和 foreshow 意思相近但更常用。

summary.en: Foreshower means an early sign or warning of something to come.
summary.zh: Foreshower 指某事将要发生的早期迹象或警示（前兆）。

definition.en: An early sign or warning of something that will happen later; a precursor.
definition.zh: （将来事情的）预兆；先兆；前兆。

examples.en: The sudden drop in temperature was a foreshower of the storm that arrived that night.
examples.zh: 气温突然下降是当晚暴风雨来临的前兆。

examples.en: Her small victories were a foreshower of the success she would later achieve.
examples.zh: 她那些小小的胜利是她后来成功的预兆。

extraExplanation: “foreshower”在现代英语中比较少见，更常见的说法是“sign/omen/harbinger”或动词“foreshadow”（预示）。
词形上可理解为“fore-（在前）+ shower（像雨点一样落下的东西）”，比喻“提前落下的一点点迹象”。在写作里偶尔用于强调“先出现的小征兆”。
容易与“foreshadow”（预示、埋伏笔）混淆：foreshadow更常用于文学叙事技巧；foreshower更像“现实中的预兆/信号”，但使用频率低。

summary.en: Foreshowing means giving an early sign or hint of what will happen later; it’s the -ing form of “foreshow” and is less common than “foreshadowing.”
summary.zh: Foreshowing 指“预示、暗示未来将发生的事”，是动词 foreshow 的 -ing 形式；在现代英语中不如 foreshadowing 常见。

definition.en: (Gerund/participle of foreshow) Showing or suggesting something that will happen in the future; giving an early sign.
definition.zh: （foreshow 的动名词/现在分词）预示、暗示未来将发生的事；给出前兆。

examples.en: Dark clouds were foreshowing a storm later that day.
examples.zh: 乌云正在预示当天晚些时候会有暴风雨。

examples.en: His nervous smile was foreshowing trouble.
examples.zh: 他紧张的微笑在暗示麻烦将至。

examples.en: In the story, the broken watch is foreshowing the hero’s loss of time and control.
examples.zh: 在故事中，坏掉的手表在暗示主角将失去时间与掌控。

definition.en: The act of foreshowing; an early sign or warning of what is coming (less common).
definition.zh: 预示之举；将要发生之事的征兆/警示（较不常用）。

examples.en: For them, the sudden silence felt like a foreshowing of bad news.
examples.zh: 对他们来说，突然的沉默像是不祥消息的预兆。
